text: Same as other habanero's.  Best damn quesadilla money can buy at a really affordable price.
Best quesadilla I have ever had.  I go with steak extra meat with hot sauce and sour.   Real coke.  Sure the place isn't fancy.  But I'm reviewing food darn it!  And its great!

Found this place on Yelp while I was on vacation in Scottsdale so figured we would try it out and it was wonderful!  The service was great and there wasn't really anyone else there when we went so Arturo stopped by and offered us some of the Habanero Tequila (apparently he makes it). WOW it was hot. Not really for me but very interesting and awfully cool of him to come out and offer us some.  Food was great! I had three different tacos (Calimarii, Blackened Fish, and Carnitas) and all were awesome!. Other people in my party got blackened fish entree, the carnitas entree, the carne asada entree. Everyone was happy!  Friendly people and great food. Pricing was very reasonable too. My tacos were $2.50/$2.99 each and most entrees were in the $6-$9.50 range.  Would definitely return!

I absolutely love this place. My husband has been coming here practically since it opened and it is the freshest, tastiest, fast Mexican food out there. The ambience is casual but the customer service is exceptional as the staff always asks me to have a seat and brings menus as if it were a sit-down restaraunt. Fajitas are out of this world but I find I can't stop myself from ordering the nachos the past several times I have been. Their red and green salsa is delicious (very important) and they even have an actually spicy hot sauce instead of a wimpy excuse for hot sauce that most places have. The owner works hard to keep this place with a friendly, mom and pop vibe that I think keeps patrons like us coming back again and again.

AHHHHH BURRITOS!!!!  This place is terrific.  I can't say enough good things about them.  The food is fantastic, the staff is friendly, the service is lightening fast.  Don't have much time for lunch?  Here's your place.  I can't wait to get into town to try their breakfast burritos someday soon!
Incredible. Recently stumbled on this great lunch venue. We have ordered for staff meetings and all items were delicious

I've passed this place a couple of times, so I finally decided to stop in and give it a try. It's about ten minutes till  9 o'clock,  and they are about to close.  They serve me anyways,  I wish she would have denied because the food was not  warm. The only good recommendation is that the chicken was freshly prepared. It ends there,  the pork carnitas were not flavorful nor were the pinto beans. I was also disappointed they didn't offer a combination platter or enchilada entrees.

I love this place because it reminds me of what good authentic Mexican food should taste like. I've had issues finding relatively cheap and high quality tacos my whole life (AZ native) but this place successfully does the job! Also the service is very quick and the people are friendly. I would recommend this place to anyone who asks. The blackened chicken tacos and carne asada tacos are my number one go to!
Great little Mexican  joint. Reminds me of rocky point a bit. The owner is usually there and he's a really nice guy. Love supporting small business especially when the product is worth it.
Today's lunch special, the blackened chicken burrito, enchilada style with salsa verde was the best burrito I have ever had!! Outrageously delicious!!

Quick, excellent and inexpensive Mexican food.  Order and watch as your taco, burrito or breakfast fair is made.  Eat at simple tables(the kind you will keep somewhere  like the basement) and watch Spanish speaking television.  They serve good Mexican beer (bring your i.d.) and a brand of soft drinks and juices that I have never heard of along with  your basic American-type sodas.  Also, the place is very clean. Takes credit cards and you usually get a parking space right in front.  Definitely, try  it.

BEST MEXICAN FOOD IN MADISON!  Habanero's is hands down the best Mexican food I have had EVER. I have been to several Mexican restaurants before and I have never had better service or better food. The tacos are amazing and I would also recommend the tortas.   This place is small and has a very cozy and intimate atmosphere. It is kind of hard to find, but look for it across from Farm and Fleet on Stoughton Road.

Great mexican in a solid location. It is small but was not busy on a Tuesday night. Must go in prepared...recommend blackened chicken tacos and the fish tacos. Cannot wait to return.   Best authentic mexican in Scottsdale.
My favorite are the chicken fajitas! The vegetables are crispy and the chicken has great favor. Highly recommend!
The carnitas is amazing, burritos, enchiladas, or tacos. Try a burrito enchilada style!
Love it love it love it !  Have frequented this local find since the day they opened last year. It's a locals favorite for sure. I now recommend this spot as a catering option for my clients as well.

Oh yes. Fantastic. This is one of those places I'd like to simultaneously tell everyone about and have it as a best-kept secret. Wonderful favors, nice service. Horrible little dining room, bright fluorescent lights, old sliding glass coolers. Totally basic, but so nicely done.

I went here a few weeks ago as part of my taco-quest, and was very not-impressed, despite the good I had heard about it.  I got three tacos and a drink, and the tortillas were really dry and rubbery.  The fillings (pork, chicken, steak) all kinda tasted the same, pretty much like grease, and the dude slopped so much into the tortilla, along with a splash of pan drippings, that all the tortillas just fell apart into a shredded, wet mess.  If they had tasted good at all, I wold have used the plastic fast food fork from the counter to finish them, but I thought, "why bother?"  The interior is your basic, depressing repurposed fast food joint, with cheap curved (and uncomfortable) melamine seats and worn-down tables left over from some KFC or something.  A TV in the corner silently barfs CNN or Fox or some useless crap to distract you from the ennui of the place.  Yecch.  If I was a fair man, I would try them again to see if I hit them at a bad time.  But I have discovered other places that are SO much better that I really won't bother.  I have a feeling it's *always* this time at Habanero's.
Great place, friendly staff and a relaxing environment. The food is great, we have had a variety from the menu and really liked all of it!

After reading so many reviews on how great and authentic this place was,  we were very disappointed.  The salsa was not Bueno and neither was the food.  We were highly disappointed,  as everything from the guacamole  to the flautas tasted like onions.  The service was great and if the food had been decent,  we would be back often!

I was in desperate need for a taco fix...  Thanks to yelp, I found a winner!  I really like this place.  I ordered a couple of tacos and they were SO good I had to order more.  The ground beef taco is a bargain with all that it contains.  (Lettuce, sour cream, cheese, & pico de gallo). The sour cream really sets it off.    It is important to note that each order is cooked especially for you.  The meat is not setting in a pan and spooned onto your tortilla.  It takes a little longer, but it's SO worth it!  If you can't wait then you'll just have to drive through a Taco Bell and suffer the consequences.  Enjoy the friendly service and wonderful Mexican food...  I want to come back for breakfast!
All the components are pretty tasty. I don't love it as much as Chipotle, but I'm very happy to have it so close by in my neighborhood

Not impressed.  I had the huevos rancheros with green sauce.  The sauce was bland - tasted like it came out of an 89 cent can.  Eggs were overcooked, and the potatoes were greasy.  With all of the reviews I read on this site, I was expecting something authentic and excellent.  I've had better food (and I mean this sincerely) off of a taco truck.  Habaneros: work on your textures, add a salsa bar, and trim the menu down-you can't be great at everything.  On the plus side, the service was good.

Nice quaint place, clean and basic. I asked them to repeat a few things and there was a language barrier which was difficult because I settled for what I actually wanted. Please understand English if you have a restaurant, or hire an interpreter.   I had the spicy pork nachos. They let you build them kinda like Subway does with their sandwiches, kinda cool. I asked for more meat and pointed at the picture that was fully topped with meat and the guy ignore me and put my nachos in the microwave inside styrofoam to melt the cheese. I was taken back and knew then I should had left. Styrofoam plus microwave equals poison. I was too hungry to care. After munching on about two thirds of the nachos I noticed that my styrofoam had melted into my food, sick. I'll pay for the toxins later,   I went up to the cashier and pointed it out and asked for a refund, he said I shouldn't have eaten it if I wanted my money back, I responded that I just discovered it (since it was near the bottom side) and I was still hungry and intended to finish it if it wasn't melted to my meal. After a few exchanges (civil ones) I fought back my refund.   The place could easily be a four star if they knew English, didn't melt my styrofoam container containing my meal and had better customer service skills.   I won't go back.   In my picture I posted of the nachos, you can see on the bottom left backside that it's melted.

This place came as a recommendation for great take-out Mexican from some local friends. We were visiting from Chicago, so we are used to some pretty delicious Mexican food. Habanero's did not disappoint. They parrillada was different and fantastic. We placed a large order and they got every last thing right.

This place is great.  I love the blackened shrimp tacos and fish tacos and they have some really tasty carnitas too.  I haven't had any of their burritos since I crave the tacos so frequently, it pains me to order something else when we do go!  My husband loves that they have Horchata in their self serve drink area.  We try to make it there at least once per month!

Absolutely my favorite Mexican restaurant in Scottsdale! The service is ALWAYS friendly, the food is excellent and the price is right. What else can you ask for? My husband and I always split the Parrillada for two, which is amazing. Their homemade chorizo is to die for, and their roasted jalapenos are wonderful. Even their simple tacos are incredible.  Get there before noon or go after 1pm if you're going with a group and want a table at this location!

Chipotle model, but food is consistently better for the same price. You choose a burrito, tacos, or some other main dish, then choose your meat and toppings. My wife and I had pastor; mine had habanero salsa and hers had salsa verde. Both were phenomenal. Nice attention to small details, too: the tortillas are warm and nicely browned, there are lots of fresh seasonings in the toppings, etc. Help was friendly. It's a great addition to the North Side. We'll be back.

after reading much wave about this place ... I must be honest that .... it doesn't impress me much   the place doesn't seem clean and the food is just very so so ... I feel I can get a better meal from Taco Bell ...

this place is incredible for a small hole-in-the-wall  I think the blackened chicken tacos & carne asada burrito might be the best I have EVER HAD. they are somewhat addicting  big lunch time crowd and very busy with long lines. they do offer a call-ahead service that will save you time.  I would eat here 5 days a week if i could!  very casual, small and kind of hidden from the street

This is excellent Mexican food in a strip mall location.  The staff was terrific: they were welcoming, friendly and efficient.  The food was wonderful, authentic Mexican food.   The nachos, enchiladas and tostadas were all super.   My only criticism is that the ample-sized margaritas could have used more tequila and/or orange liquor.

Wow! When you first walk in it seems like a fast food place, like Chipotle, but it really isn't. We went for lunch but I figure they would be good for dinner too. We are planning to go for breakfast while we stay, we are looking forward to the juevos rancheros. But the service is quick, the staff is friendly, they cook right in front of you. I highly recommend the tacos, the sauce they put on them is delicious, it's similar to some sort of aioli. Be sure to put this on your list!

Ahhhh I love it when a great place forces me to get off my ass and write another review.   We were driving around and I had this unrelenting craving for fresh, delicious tacos...with a catch: not a chain restaurant and PLEASE not another fast food joint. So, I am combing through places on my yelp app when Habanero's pops up. How had I never come across this place and I live a mile away?!?!?!? Oh, and I forgot to mention, that this was on my last day in Arizona. Glorious. Secretly, I was hoping that this place would underwhelm me, just so I did not feel like an idiot for running to Taco Bell all those years.  We arrive and judging the place from the outside...well...I was underwhelmed and happy since my ego was still in place. Then we entered and I felt as though a permanent dunce cap plopped on my head. The menu looked delicious and my mouth was watering from the smell.  We ordered chips and salsa/guac, a fish taco, carne asada taco, blackened shrimp taco and calamari taco (the chips were $2.25 and each taco was $2.50). Everything was AMAZING. I would have a difficult time picking a favorite taco.   Please go and give this place a try...avoid the dunce cap.  MUST TRY: shrimp taco and carne asada taco MEH: chips (a little too thick for my taste) AVOID: nothing...try everything! Then run home to work it off. :)

The Parrillada was pretty good. I got it for one. So, it's not as big as it looks in the pictures. However, the meat is nicely spiced and cooked. The beans were tasty and the guacamole was alright. Definitely a good spot/meal choice for a light lunch.

Amazing burritos and pleasant staff. I probably stop here at least once a week. Their commitment to locally sourced, organic foods is commendable. This is a  build your own line style burrito/taco/torta place run by a family with strong local ties. Not only do the burritos make my stomach happy but their ethos makes my my heart happy too.

after seeing such good reviews i decided to stop by for a late lunch with my family. the prices were pretty good and the inside looked neat. after ordering meal for 2ppl i expected a nice portion of food. the gave us each 3tortillas a teaspoon of guac and sour cream and a tablespoon of rice. also a tablespoon amount of each meat which looked only for one person. when we asked for more the charged us extra. also we paid almost 5 more dollars to recieve 3 pieces of shrimp which the mixed with potatos to fake it that you got a decent portion. over all taste was good but the extra charges and the amount of food you get for the price is not worth it. worst experience ever!!

The people who work there are super friendly and accommodating. Good price. Pretty good food. Its hard to find if you don't know where it is at. But I will stop and get tacos whenever I am in the area at lunch. Love the corn salsa.
This is my favorite Mexican restaurant in town. Fast, friendly service, GREAT meat, always a tasty treat.
Staff was very friendly. Happy to see vegetarian/vegan options on their menu!  More of a fast food environment but decent food!
Loved this restaurant!  Everyone was friendly and laid back.  Food was authentic and cooked right in front of us.  Reasonably priced, fast service.

Just finish eating an the food was outstanding. Do not let the the hole in the wall exterior run u off. If your interested in eating awesome food over ambiance this is the place. Try the parrillada it won't disappoint.

I originally ignored this place when I saw a Chipotle reference (note: it's just counter style). Not that I don't love my occasional Chipotle fix, but that's not what I was looking for. I just wanted REALLY good food. After rereading reviews, it sounded tempting and I put it on my radar. Shortly after, we ended up in the area and were hungry, so we gave it a try. I am so glad we did!  The staff was extremely friendly. The prices were very reasonable ($2 for a super stuffed taco?!). The meat (between us, we tried the pastor and beef) was incredible. So were the sauces/salsa. I kept my toppings fairly minimalistic, but it's nice to know you can add what you want. The flavor of the food was fantastic. We all left so satisfied.  I will definitely be back, even though it's in an odd location out of the way (for us). Oh, and they serve beer.

Best tacos in town!  As was mentioned, it's setup Qdoba/Chipotle style. Quasi-cafeteria, semi fast-food. Service is quick.  That's no knock however, because the food is amazing. I've only had tacos, but I have tried all the different meats available. All are well seasoned and spiced, and you get huge portions of meat.  My advice? Get your tacos w/ only onions, cilantro, and the habanero sauce. Your tastebuds will thank me.   I am of the opinion that too many toppings detract from the quality of the meat, and you lose some of the flavors. Get it authentic style, and enjoy!

Seriously the BEST guacamole I've ever eaten! and fantastic carnitas cooked RIGHT! I rate it as good as it gets FOR IT'S CATEGORY! Meaning, if you are looking for FANTASTIC food, that is real, for good prices and GREAT service, this is the place! If you want real plates, umbrellas in your margaritas and fancy whatever, then find somewhere else to waste money! The owner was incredibly friendly, came around making sure we were enjoying our food multiple times (and we got there 20 minutes BEFORE they closed-he even made FRESH guacamole for us! WHO does that!?!?!?). The server was very friendly, never once did we feel like "it's almost closing time". We ate at Cantina Laredo the night before, and both my husband and I RAVED about Habanero's to our hotel and business center where we were attending meetings! Can't wait to go back!!! Found them via Google search BTW.
Hands down the best burritos and tacos in Madison!

Delicious little spot! Ordered some takeout. The blackened chicken burrito and lobster taco. Both were very flavorful and just the right spice. While I waited I was watching the employees and they were working hard with smiles on their faces!

FRESH food! The guacamole was phenomenal and the hint of lime really completes it. I ordered the blackened chicken burrito and it was delicious. You can taste the freshness in everything, from the tortillas to the jalapeños to the tender, juicy chicken.   Friendly staff and quick service. Will definitely come back again.

This could have been 4 stars.  I wanted it to be 4 stars.  I came in with my family asuming this would be as good as the other location.  I was wrong.  When we walked in, we were not greeted by the staff at the counter.  they just stared at us.  We ordered 7 tacos, a torta, a side of beans and 3 drinks. The Torta was more bread than anything else.  the amount of meat and toppings they give is ridiculous. The tacos werent bad but they could have used more flavor in the meat.  Someone behind us came in with a punch card and when my husband asked about getting one, the guy just ignored him. When he asked again, the employee said they were out of cards and to ask next time.  We asked for limes and we were told they do not have limes.  What the heck?  What kind of mexican restaurant doesn't have limes?  Not to mention, the place is filthy.  We left hungry and disappointed.  We wont be back.

This place is Qdoba's ugly step sister.  It's the same concept of Qdoba in which you pick a burrito, nachos, etc then your meat and the toppings.  For some reason, there were tons of cigarette butts in the front of the store sprinkled in the rocks.  It wasn't dirty per say but it wasn't the cleanest either.  We ate there just because we were lazy and didn't feel like finding another place in that area.  There just aren't many restaurants around that area.  Either way, I'm full which is perfect because I'm going grocery shopping and shouldn't shop for food when I'm hungry.
My favorite Mexican restaurant in the Phoenix area. Staff is very friendly and every dish I have tried has been good. The blackened chicken is delicious.
Fantastic service, delicious Mahi Mahi bowl made fresh to order and a house margarita that is muy grande!
Very nice blackened shrimp taco and chicken taco. The guacamole was heavenly. Cool place with a nice atmosphere. Go there.
Good food, great prices.  They handled our large group with no reservations very well.  Recommend!

Man so many people hand out 5 stars like its candy.  5 stars should be for food that just blows you away.  This is not food that does that.  The food isn't bad at all, i would say its pretty average and will suffice for a quick lunch or dinner.  This is the issue with help and why everyone isnt a good "reviewer"

Habanero's is good fresh food at a reasonable price...but it's generally slow to get your food and/or so hectic it takes a REALLY long time to be served.  If you plan on dining there, make sure it's nice out--otherwise you won't find a place to sit inside and will be roasting or freezing outside!  Mad kudos for: --Cholula on the table --Really good food  A big boo for: --15 min wait after ordering...at 11:30...with 2 people in front of us --Salsa didn't arrive until after we finished eating despite 3 requests --No real combo options  The food beats Baja Fresh, Chipotle, & Qdoba--and all those places can be hectic as well, but after a couple visits I'll stick with my 3 stars.  Maybe I'll call ahead and pick-up next time...or just drive through the much closer Taco Bell and have some 35% beef :p.

Dude. This is a solid place. Great surprise as I was getting my car worked on. I had a "Platillo" $9 with carnitas and corn tortillas, also came with rice, beans, grilled onions and choice of several fresh salsas (pico, tomatillo, corn, and a couple spicier harbanero options). The carnitas were flavorful, lean and moist. Guacamole was an extra 75 cents - totally worth it.  Assembly line, so very quick.   Sweet hochata with free refills. The fountain also had margaritas, frappes with other usuals. Bottled Mexican pops and cerveza also available.   These guys take pride in their food and service. The dining area and restroom were clean and tidy. Do it.

Best Mexican food in the area and it's not close. Staff is friendly and helpful. Atmosphere fine not overly special but food is great and very reasonably priced. Actually please avoid for lunch since line long enough already.
The burritos are as big as your head, weigh as much as your head and are only about $5-$6.  Fresh, quality and really good.
It's ok. I've been there 2x's. next time I'm getting the dish with the eggs on top. It look delicious.
Tried the special "calamari tacos". Extremely delicious.  Everything tasted fresh.  Definitely my regular from now on.

With all the authentic Mexican places in the Madison area Habaneros stands out because as a vegetarian, I can finally get something to eat! I'm not knocking all the other great taquerias, however its hard to find food that isn't laced with beef fat :( Habaneros is a build your own kind of restaurant but it is the real deal! Nothing fancy but great food. Also everyone who works there is super nice; it's awesome to have your food with a smile!!
Outstanding authentic food for a great price!! The restaurant is small, but has outdoor seating as well.

I love this place! There are so many Mexican restaurant in Madison but this one is by far the best service and the best food. I go there about once a week and I'm never dissatisfied with what I received for service or food. If you try it out you won't be disappointed!

Good food, fast service, fair prices...what more could you want for lunch? Habenaros is the working stiff's Chipotle - high quality, wholesome Mexican food without the haute cuisine ambiance or high prices. The menu is beautiful in its simplicity...mix and match classic Mexican meats, breads, vegetables, salsa and cheese into one of a handful of entrées. Personally I like the rice bowl but the torta Mexican sandwich and tacos and burrito are amazing as well.

I highly recommend Habanero's! They have great guacamole and AWESOME pork tacos. For the price, it can't be beat. Their salsa is bland. And the waiters/waitresses came over every 5 minutes to check up on us. Which was really annoying, but it turned comical. I'm pretty sure they weren't communicating with one another about how often service was stoping by our table. Oh well, I'd rather have eager service than lazy service. My husband got fajitas and the chicken was marinated beautifully. For the value, this place is a home run.
Service was friendly & quick. Margaritas were good. Chicken fajitas were amazing but the rice, black beans & chips were just so-so. Great tomatillo salsa!

Delicious tacos,  I had one each of barbacoa, pastor, and chicken, all softshell.  The meat was well seasoned with the barbacoa being the best of the three in my opinion.  The habanero hot sauce was great tasting but my mouth was on fire after all three tacos.  I will be returning to try the other taco varieties and the breakfast food as well.  Oh and did I mention they are open til 3am on the weekends.  I will probably never go to taco bell at bartime again.  The guy working behind the counter was very friendly as well.

Well worth a try!!!!  In a very hidden location, this place definitely fly's under the radar. Tucked behind KO's and Salty's in North Scottsdale it knocks both of them out with the taste and quality of the food. Everything is cooked fresh in the open kitchen after your order. I have been there many times and have sampled a few things, all delicious. The fajita burrito is my favorite and very filling for under $6. I have also had the Buenas Nachos which was a huge plate that was so good. My fiancee had the chicken enchiladas which she also loved. The guacamole is phenomenal and definitely fresh . Basically I have always had a great meal for a reasonable price and have been greeted by friendly people. Try this place!

Great personable service atmosphere, with the food being truly authentic! Best habanero sauce around, finally a place where taste takes precedence over worrying about what the mass "mild flavor" people want!  Will come back again and again!

Habenero's serves excellent build-to-order burritos and tacos. (Order at the counter, choose your shell, meat, toppings, etc.) The portions were generous, prices reasonable, and the service very good all three times I visited.
Not the easiest place to find, especially in the dark of night. But, oh, it is worth the effort.  Excellent taste, Great value. Friendly, fast service.
Fresh, tasty, excllent service. Carna Asada, Carnitas, Fajitas all good.

Absolutely awful. If I could give no stars I would. I went for lunch, and waited almost a half hour for some tacos and a salad. While we were waiting, there was two other tables that ordered after us and had gotten their food before us. When I went to ask how much longer it was going to be, both of the waitresses snapped at me to wait my turn like everyone else, and they would bring it out when it was ready. I would not recommend wasting your time or money.

OK-so we came here on a HOT, muggy day in the heat of the summer when the air is thick.  When we walked in the door you could barely breath from smelling the habanero peppers they had been chopping.  It seriously thought I was about to have a coughing attack but that's a good thing right?  I had a snack before I ate here and am so bummed about that because everything looked so delicious.  I ordered the carne taco. It was really good!  Hubs had the chili relleno - really enjoyed it. Kids ordered nachos & one of their nachos plates could have fed the entire family it was so big!    I can't wait to come back when I have my appetite on!
This place is great! Super value, amazing tastes, and lovely staff. It's all the best things of a fast Mexican grill, with none of the bad things.
The food was great, I had the steak and chicken tacos.    The restaurant was clean and the staff is extremely friendly. This is the best value in Scottsdale.

Relaxing, Not Loud, Very Friendly Service.  Carne Asada Fajita was solid, not the best ever, but really good.  Chips, Salsa, Guac for starters was great.  They are not cheap with the Guac you get a great portion with your entree and your chips.  Best part you can do your own free refills!  Get the sopapilla's for dessert.  You get 3 big ones.  Saved one for the next morning's coffee.
Food was good, not great. Too many tomatoes in the guacamole and the chips weren't fresh. The servers were busy and need a bus person. Margaritas were excellent.
Decent Mexican food for a good price. Great spot to come on a short lunch break with a few buddies. The Horchata is amazing I would highly recommend it, some of the best Horchata I have had.

This is my local watering hole and the people are friendly and like family. The food is outstanding, fresh and more than enough spicey! Personally the taco salad is my favorite and nothing like I have ever had with sauteed veggies and the perfect seasoning. Go have one of there great margaritas and grub.

Been going for years. Consistent, tasty, reasonable. Great variety. Really friendly owners and same staff for years. Never had a bad meal. It's a little hidden Scottsdale gem. Tell your friends, but save me a seat!
Wonderful spot! Two great meals on two consecutive days. Grilled chicken is perfection, carne asada and carnitas are superb. Very friendly and helpful staff. This place is a keeper!

I can't believe the quality of fish tacos they have woohoo...that's not easy to find. I was just in California and I was in fish taco heaven but this place comes super close. We kinda waitied for awhile but they fill you up on chip and great salsa so yay to that. Its very casual which was really nice. Really nice staff . Kinda dated decorations but whatever its still a great place to eat.

I've been trying to get to this place for almost a year now.  It is in a general area that I go to at least once or twice a week - Costco, K. O'Donnells, Golfsmith, Four Peaks, etc.  but it seems that I just am never around there when I want a light lunch or quick bite to eat. I finally made it!!  It is a delightful little restaurant located in the strip mall behind K. O'Donnells and serves breakfast, lunch and dinner. It reminds me of a taco stand in a building.  The first time I was there, I made it for lunch - and I could see why it has so many good reviews. The line was out the front door, but they simply take your order and you find a table to wait until it is done.  Although it was crowded, I did find a table, and was able to watch as they served lunch - very efficient, very friendly.   The food is delicious, made with fresh ingredients while you wait.  The menu is large.  I have tried the blackened chicken burrito, carne asada tacos, blackened chicken quesadillas, and, of course, the Dos Equis - all were great.  They also have a breakfast menu, and children's menu.  They have several salsas available, but once I found out they had Habanero salsa, I knew I loved this place.  For those that like less fire, they do have both green and red salsa, of varying hotness.     I have only given 4 stars as I haven't tried everything I want to.  So now I will work through their menu - it's a dirty job, but someone has to do it. But with Dos Equis, I will persevere.
Great family run place. We'll be back for sure! Terrific friendly service, great food, and yummy margaritas

Great lunch!  The food was delicious. Very tasty. I had the  chicken fajitas my husband had cheese enchiladas with beans and rice and my son had the carne asada burrito. The food was prepared fresh, served hot and really good. The chips and salsa were plentiful- I preferred the green sauce. Definitely a place that we will visit again.

Finally made it here!  I've had this place book marked for several months when another yelper saw my  reviews for fish tacos and sent me a note to try this place out. What a great find. We started off with chips and salsa. They asked if we wanted the habanero sauce, and we tried it - let me tell you HOT!  I tried the fish taco and the calamari taco. The fish was deep fried, which I like, a good portion. It didn't have too much cabbage and was it topped with tarter sauce, again a nice portion. The calamari taco also had fried calamari, topped with a little bit of cabbage and a chipotle sauce. Both were very good. I have to say I would have preferred another sauce over the tarter sauce, so next time I will order the fish with the chipotle sauce. They also offer a blackened fish (grilled) and shrimp tacos (grilled), which I want to try as well. of course, I don't go anywhere without trying Dave's, so I took a bite of his beef burrito, and it was good. It needed a little of the Cholula Chipotle Flavored hot sauce, but otherwise, good flavor. of course we washed all this down with a couple of DOS EQUIS XX.  We had the opportunity to speak to one of the owners because it was late on a Monday night. He is an extremely nice guy. They just opened another location on Scottsdale and Shea, and both are family run. They take a great deal of pride in their food and service, and you can tell.

Some of the menu items are pretty good (shrimp fajitas, wet burrito), but others are not good at all (cheese enchiladas were dry and thin). Also, the salsas weren't very good, either.  Inside, the tables are set too close together. It feels cramped and you may get bumped into a lot if the customer sitting behind you at the next table tries to lean back or get up from their chair. The most redeeming part of my visit was the server: although they were SLAMMED in a dinner rush right after we sat down and she had the entire place to take care of, she kept a smile and was polite and moved as quickly as she could. I don't remember her name but it's the only reason I'm giving 3 stars instead of 2.  All-in-all, seems like it might be OK for take-out if you already know something there you like...but otherwise, there are a few better sit-down options within a mile or two.

Last Friday I was in the mood for some Mexican food and my boyfriends only condition was, "Please, no more American Mexican food."  Living in North Scottsdale, I understand his frustration and turned to YELP to find something new.  After reading about Habernero's which sounded like the opposite of American Mexican food, I decided to try though I wasn't exactly sure what to expect on a Friday night since it seemed rather casual.  Well, let me assure you, going to Habernero's for dinner was the best decision I made all week.  First off, it is casual, walk in and order at the counter but after that you sit down and your food will be delivered to you, as well as you served the rest of the meal.  Need silverware, extra tortillas, you name it, they come to you.  The staff really could not have been more friendly, they were helpful but also just joking around making you feel right at home.  Now onto the most important thing, the food--delicious, melt in your mouth, perfect!  We tried the steak fajitas, blackened chicken platter, quesadilla appetizer and it was all among the best Mexican I've had in at least a year (probably last rivaled by an LA taco truck  ).  Not to mention the salsa!  There are 3, all with a reasonable level of spiciness but the habernero (orange) salsa really does take it to the next level.  My lips were still tingling 30 minutes after the meal but I didn't care, I am full on addicted to that stuff and can't wait to enjoy it again.    Our meal came out to about $20/person and we each had a full entrée and margarita (very good  very strong  1 was plenty ) and split the quesadilla and chips along with additional side items (extra guac, of course!).  So, in sum, amazing food, amazing value, casual ambiance (they do have outside seating but no alchy on the patio), so I know I will be back soon!

Blackened fish burrito special was huge and delicious, guacamole was chunky and fresh, and the house margarita was large and tasty.  Great value for money, and the service was kind and attentive as well.  Could not have been happier!

I have been working near, and eating at Haba's for fir years now. In my office we tend to eat here at least one a week. Not only does it always impress, but it never gets old.   Ask the food is prepared fresh using traditional methods and spices. Everything they serve its hot, fresh, and large in proportions. They don't have fountain drinks, which is fine since my food it's often to go, and the choices are plentiful.   They just opened a second location near my house, it's dangerous for my wallet :(  Since I've found this place I've not been back to Chipotle out Qdoba.

This place was awesome! The family took a Yelp leap of faith after caving some Mexican food and we were not disappointed.  It was tucked back in a half-vacant shopping center but had a steady stream of customers all night.    All cooked to order, great selection of tacos (and everything else).  GUAC WAS FANTASTIC!! Their green salsa was really good too.  Good draft beer selection and really strong lineup of tequila.    Our family of four was in and out of here for less than what Chipotle would run us and this was way fresher / better. This will definitely be or new Mexican place going forward!!!
Great food, awesome taste and great customer service! So happy there right around the corner and quick.

One of the favourite place for a quick bite by our family.My favourite is chicken quasedia.The waiters and staff are always very friendly.Saturday afternoons is the usual time that we go and is usually crowded and which sometimes results in usually long wait of 25-30 mins for the food to come.

Had the carne asada burrito and the lobster taco, they were delicious! Only bad thing about this place is the location :( im not a local and isnt easy to find if you dont have gps. But this is a definite place to eat if you want authentic Mexican food. Its a open grill layout so you can see the cook making your food. Everything looks well Presented when its brought to you. I would have taken a picture of the chips and guacamole but we started eating it. I would definitely eat here again when im in town.

I go to this place for lunch at least 2-3 times per week. For lunch it is amazing. The service is great, the salsas are good and I still have not had anything that I did not like. They just changed the shrimp they use which is an excellent upgrade. The steak fajita burrito as simple as it sounds is perfect, the carnitas are amazing and the carne asada is excellent. They also have orange bang which is super old school but really enjoyable.   Overall this is my favorite place to go for lunch. Fresh delicious food at a great price.   I have only been once for breakfast and to be honest the burritos left a little to be desired and they also do not open until 8.

Best place for lunch in the valley. At work whenever someone suggests Chipotle, I reply, "how about Habanero's instead".  What makes it the best: - 3 Salsas: Green, Red, and Habanero, all hot and each amazing - Freshly Pressed Tortillas - Your order is made fresh, the meat and fresh vegetables are all cooked just for you - Refillable Horchata - All for a good price under $10

Food was ok.  Cook was rushed, threw food down on the counter, most of which spilled out.  Cheese crisp as underdone (meaning cheese wasn't even melted).  Cook put a bus tub on the hot grill, melted the bottom a little, then pulled it off and set it on the food prep counter.  Then he threw raw chicken on the grill, 2 pieces, then pulled one piece off and put it back into the raw chicken after it sizzled on the grill a little.  Place needs a cook that actually knows what he is doing in the kitchen.  If you ask me, I'm not going there again.

I've only been there once but it was so good it deserves 5 stars!  I got the barbacoa burrito and my husband had carnitas.  Both were delicious.  We added guac for 75 cents each,  well worth it. I forgot to try the onions that everyone's been talking about... next time!

This is a tough one for me...my husband loves this place, I hate this place.  He raves about the fish and shrimp tacos, especially the blackened fish - those are his favorites.  I tried the beef taco and chile relleno.  Completely flavorless beef that I am convinced had been a hamburger right up until I ordered the taco - it was in big gray chunks.  Relleno was so loaded with seeds I couldn't eat it and it ended up in the garbage.  I will give it another try at some point because he likes the tacos so much.  Pretty cheap too.
Meals were all super good!  Service excellent!  Tostada salad was one of the best I've had.

The reviews were very good so my wife and I tried this place last night. Granted it was the Friday before Christmas and it was 30 minutes before closing but we could not have been more disappointed. My wife ordered enchiladas and I had a carne asada burrito. Mine came to the table 5 minutes after my wife's and when I bit into it it was cold. I sent it back to the kitchen and 5 minutes later it was re-served cold again. Besides the temperature, the meat was very tough to cut. At that point we gave up after registering our complaint with the manager. He asked if I wanted something else but by this time I had no confidence in the kitchen. My wife's meal was fair at best. She said her food was tasteless and not very fresh. I'm afraid we won't be back. There are too many good restaurants in Scottsdale to risk another disappointment.

We searched it on Yelp, went to the restaurant, and hesitated at the door, as it seemed quite small (12 tables/ room for about 40) and looked only "OK". The lady at the counter smiled and said lots of people have that reaction, but encouraged us to try. It was excellent, and low cost too, and great service. So good that we returned two nights later, on our last night in Scottsdale. Just as good the second time. Authentic, and they will make the food as mild or as hot as you want it. I definitely will bring my friends there next time I am in Scottsdale.

I thought the quality and originality of their food was on par with what you'd expect from the Mexican food selection at Chili's. There is a lot of Mexican food in Phoenix and they do very little to differentiate themselves.

Very tasty food, friendly service, good prices. Stopped with the kids after the science museum. Would definitely recommend! The blackened chicken nachos were top notch! My niece and I split them and were both full.
I had the carnitas burrito served enchilada style.  It was intensely flavored.  The service is excellent and the server was friendly.

Why would you go to Chipotle when you could come here? The barbacoa was tender and flavorful...think of good Pot roast. The spicy pastor was also flavorful and lean. The guys were super friendly and fast.  The restaurant had a basic decor with clean tables and a clean bathroom...which I've been told likely means that the kitchen is clean. No farm-to-table or bells and whistles but that's not why you would come here anyway. I'll be back even though I live on the other side of town!
Yummy food! You definitely get plenty of food for the price you pay. Lots of choices on the menu. My new go to place for Mexican food.

So I have had two different breakfast burritos and three different tacos from Habanero's and loved them all.  The carne asada taco wasn't as good as I was hoping, but it definately wasn't bad.  The carnitas is the best I have ever had.  It isn't dry, but it isn't covered in grease and doesn't tast liek it has been sitting in a bath a water.  It was perfect.  The blackened chicken taco was my favorite and the chipotle sauce is amazing.  For breakfast, I highly recommend a chicken breakfast burrito with the chipotle sauce added.  Keeps you full for a long time, is inexpensive, and tastes AMAZING!  If you are in the area, the kind service and wonderful food is worth the stop and any wait you may or may not have to endure.

Looking at all the reviews we had high expectations coming in. Fair waring this IS NOT AUTHENTIC MEXICAN FOOD. The food had no flavor and tasted like it was made three days ago. If want to try real Mexican food make an extra 10 minute drive and visit Los Taqitos, not this place.
Wonderful staff, great Mexican food!! Never been disappointed yet; as I come here once sometimes twice a week.

Horrendous experience, this place is a dirty little hole in the wall fast food set up with the worst tasting food I think I have ever experienced. They must have had friends or fake accounts write good reviews because there is no way anyone would consider any of this hot mess as good food. AVOID AT ALL COSTS

We were vacationers looking for a quick, but good Mexican meal after a hike. This place did not disappoint. We ordered the Parrillada for two, with extra guac and chips. Everything was delicious. The chicken was good, and all other meats on the dish (beef, chorizo, carnitas) were excellent. If anything, we ordered too much food, but gladly ate nearly all of it. The medium and spicy salsas had both flavor and heat. The wait staff is helpful and friendly. Not sure how this place ranks among locals, but for visitors not used to authentic Mexican fare, who are looking for a quick and reasonably priced meal, this is the place.

Truly authentic, family owned restaurant. Mari took care of us and had excellent recommendations. The green chile sauce, carnitas de Jalisco and enchiladas were excellent but my margarita was weak. Food was made quickly. I will definitely be going back soon to either the Phoenix or Scottsdale location :).

I had one carne asada and one carnita taco both were excellent. The salsa with the chips and salsa isn't very good though. A cheese filled churro rounded out my meal, I could have eaten 10 of them, it was so good. They also have cinnamon aguas frescas that is to die for. Definitely worth a visit.
Chicken Burrito is usually pretty good! This past time it had a little too much rice and not enough chicken and sauce. I would go back again...

This is one of the best Mexican places I've ever eaten. I'm in Madison twice a week and I stopped here for lunch both days you can't go wrong the food is delicious, it is made right in front of you. For 6 dollars and some change you can get a gigantic burrito with anything you want on it. I love this place.
New to town, found this place recently.  The crispy fish tacos and chicken tacos are dank!

Habanero's is a great little spot. It's not usually packed and is always kept clean and tidy. I appriciate the attention to detail and excellent service..The food exceeded my expectations. Great place for a nice meal for 2...or bring the family (very family friendly). I reccomend getting a side of thier Chipotle sauce - its amazing.

Lively, loud, good food, friendly service. Small mom n pop type feel. Food is tasty, the spicy salsa is ultra hot! A little lick of it & I gulped down a bunch of water. Not for me. Margarita did not taste great but after a couple of sips I realized I was already feeling tipsy. Now I see why I thought the taste wasn't great, I guess I'm used to the watered down Lemony variety :) Would go again. Great value for $
I like coming here when I'm in the area instead of chains. Great food. I always get the steak burrito!

As with most things in Phoenix, it opens later than expected (9:00 am).  We're used to 5:00 am for breakfast burrito places.  My husband had a green chili sausage breakfast burrito and loved it.  Good salsas too.

Good local Mexican joint with the process of Chipotle; they have a menu similar to the counterpart system of ordering. You go in front of a glass covered buffet table and pick your ingredients.   We had the spicy pork tacos and shredded beef bowl. Both were excellent in flavor!   The tacos you get to decide between corn our flour tortillas. We chose corn but it lost the tenderness once pressed.   They have five salsa choices along with guac, lettuce,  and my favourite a xxx pickled onion and carrot mix.   There was a constant stream of customers the entire time we were there.

I love their short-order Mexican food! I usually get carry-out. It's fast but not "fast food" and it tastes fresh. Prices and serving sizes are OK. They have a variety of soda fountain drinks which include Mexican-style sodas, too. Plus, they have iced teas...and booze. I've had their shrimp tacos, burritos, and enchiladas. Plus, I've had their chips, salsas, and homemade guacamole. I highly recommend their food.  Their customer service if also fast & friendly! They're really nice people.
I like this place.  It's not fancy or exotic, but their burritos are satisfying and tasty.  They also have a selection of Mexican (I assume) sodas, which is a nice touch.

This place was good kind of pricey for a small plate of tacos but it was alright. I've had several plates but the tacos would be a better choice maybe? But last time it taste kind of off so didn't enjoy it as much.

Love their new location for cheap and plentiful Mexican cuisine.   I had the carnitas tacos and I gotta be honest, they were as tasty as the carnitas I had at Rick Bayless's restaurant in Chicago. The nachos were well executed, although we watched them microwave them-- I wish they'd just broil them, but still quite tasty.  Not gonna blow your mind, but quality Mexican food nonetheless.
My first taco experience! Had the spicy pork was flavorful, but not spicy for me. I enjoyed my taco, quick and fast hunger fix. Portion was goods, was full after the 2nd taco.
I had the parrillada and it was delicious! The food is great and the ambience is on point. Thank you!

I am visiting Scottsdale and came here based on the Yelp reviews. I ordered the steak burrito to go and it was really good. Great portion size with a handful of tortilla chips with salsa. I will definitely be back.
I haven't tried much, but what I have tried was excellent. The chicken fajitas, refried beans, and guacamole are all awesome. I also love the Horchata drink machine! Yum!!

Yep, as good as it gets. Ive been coming here for years and the food is excellent, always consistent and the Habanero Hot Salsa is by far the best.  The service is excellent all around, always a smile and alway paying attention to their customers. The proof is in the food, service and the clientele, the place is always busy which speaks volumes for a great restaurant. Well done Habaneros, The best.

Hidden gem!  Tucked away in a nondescript industrial park meets strip mall, you would never know this restaurant existed.  Staff is EXTREMELY friendly and attentive.  Menu isn't large but has a good variety of options.  The paraillada plate is a must . . . go ahead and add the shrimp.  Guac is fresh and seasoned well and salsas are spicy like it should be.
Hanero's is one of my favorite places to go for lunch.  It's right by work and the staff is very friendly.  My fave is the carne asada burrito.

Awesome, affordable food. Found this place just after moving to Madison & have gone back time & again. The staff is friendly; the place is clean; the food is great; & prices are reasonable.  My favorite are steak tacos on corn tortillas. DO NOT SKIP THE ONIONS! They make all the food on site & the pickled onions (slightly hot) at the end of the condiment bar are so flavorful that you'll want a heaping helping.

Catering experience. Phenomenal service and food all around, I have no criticisms  Habanero's came to our event, in which I was a guest, with many Sterno chaffing dishes filled with wonder. There was chicken and pork, rice, black and refried beans, lettuce, tomatoes, onions, cilantro, limes, guacamole, cheese, cheese sauce, sour cream. There were three types of salsa ranging from fresh pico de gallo to a fresh green salsa with heat to a very hot, smoky deep red salsa that did make me blow my nose. Chips, flour tortillas, corn tortillas were offered, wrapped in foil to stay warm.  Staff was very friendly, greeted each person but moved swiftly and I waited nearly no time. I observed them aptly answering allergy related questions of others with confidence. Food was quite hot, tasted extremely fresh. Staff served the food in large servings on the plate for you, custom to order (think Qdoba, pero autentico). One could order anything, everything, or minimally. I, of course, got everything and enjoyed every last bit of it.  I will absolutely use Habanero's if I am ever trusted with the responsibility of arranging the catering for an event. I cannot believe their parking lot isn't packed with lines out the drive through (unsure if that's actually in operation). I know I will be a return customer.

We were in the area and wanted a quick bite to eat.. We asked for counter service instead of table service and the guy was ok with it. Looks like maybe they offer table at dinner.  Gotta save where we can, tipping adds up.  I ordered the parrilla plate (spelling is likely off)  it's basically the all meat plate... Carnitas, Chicken, Steak, Chorizo and add shrimp for $2.  Comes with beans, rice, sour cream and guacamole.  Yummy!!!  My son ordered the cheese Enchiladas plate, came with Sour Cream. That's a huge plus, most places charge for sour cream.  My husband ordered the Carne Asada burrito.  Lots of meat and very tasty.    Clean Restaurant and Friendly Staff!!!

Always searching for a great Chiles Rellenos I stopped by Habaneros today and I was very pleasantly surprised.  Most Chiles Rellenos in Phoenix Metro are 'Gringo Style', meaning a small chili entombed in thick batter or egg, stuffed with crappy yellow cheese and smothered in some sloppy assed sauce to where you can barely find or taste the chili.   They call that 'authentic' by the way and unfortunately most people thing that is the way to make them.     Habaneros Rellenos was near perfect:  a nice healthy chili (Anaheim, not Hatch, but OK)  in a paper thin egg batter with white cheese inside.  It coms with Pico de gallo but if you ask they will make it was green chili sauce on top.  That is all you need to know about the proper way to make Rellenos... it is about the chili.  Served with beans & rice, the beans are cooked, not refried, so no lard if you are being heart healthy.   The rice is cooked well, the texture light and fluffy, just enough tomato to flavor it.  The tortillas are thin and steamed and served in foil.  Ask for the salsa de la casa as well.....  The only negative is that Habaneros uses plastic plates which don't do well for retaining heat.  If you are a slow eater your food will cool.   But that is the only negative and accounts for your dinner being $9.99 instead of $13.50 like the others.  16 oz Mexican beers are only $2.99 at Happy Hour and the staff are truly friendly and accommodating.   How many times have you been asked you name in a Snottsdale Restaurant lately?   And been told they will remember you?  You can usually tell a good Mexican Restaurant by how many Mexicans are eating there after Church on Sunday, and there were a bunch today!   I felt bad being the poorly dressed Gringo amongst all the nicely dressed Catolicas.  Mui Bien!

I was not pleased. My roommate and I went here based on the really good reviews on Yelp. The food was sub par at best. The chicken was incredibly dry. Also, my roommate and I did not feel well after eating at this establishment. The only reason they are relatively getting any good stars is because the staff was decently friendly. Would not recommend this to anyone.

Came here before dropping my friend traveling back to Chicago at SkyHarbor Airport. It's only about 10 minutes to airport. We were greeted upon entering and our waitress Sylvia was great. We shared a plate that included steak, chicken, chorizo, pork with grilled onions & jalapeños. Each of us got a plate of beans, rice & guacamole along with sour cream. Of course we received tortillas(your choice of corn or flour). My friend loved the margaritas most, she had 4. Happy hour is short 3-6pm. I will be returning soon since I have family coming into town soon.

Our first time there, so we had 3 different tacos and a shrimp-burrito.  Very fresh and flavorful.  Burrito was surprisingly good, and so was the fish taco and blackened chicken.  We also tried the flan -- this was the best surprise.  Was great!  I don't think you can find anything that will top this place as far as a casual Mexican food joint in Scottsdale. We'll definitely be back.
Excellent food and service. Wish there was on on the west side of town.  Fresh ingredients. Would definitely go back.

Came to Yelp to located a reasonably priced Mexican restaurant in Scotts and found Habanero's and so we took a chance (albeit calculated). This location has been open for 8+ years and I can see why. The ingredients are fresh, tortillas are home made and the food is awesome. Maria served us and she was very friendly and helpful and made menu suggestions since it was our first time. Obviously she knows what is best on the menu and we really enjoyed everything she suggested. I will say the blackened chicken tacos along with the blackened fish tacos were fantastic. If you are "jonezin" for some really good Mexican food, this is the place!

This place is located on a frontage road on the east side of Stoughton road in east Madison. The place is clean, service is friendly and fast because you order at a bar like you would Qdoba or Subway, and prices are relatively cheap. Food wise, I have a love/hate relationship with Habanero's. I'd like to think the ingredients are fresh, but wouldn't be surprised if they are a day or two old at times. I usually order the tacos, which are consistently good. They use local tortillas and you can choose either flour or corn. They have four to five meat options, plus all the regular Mexican type toppings. My favorite tacos are chicken with fajita veggies, tomatoes, cilantro and hot salsa. The pork carnitas are also pretty good.   Overall this place is pretty legit for the price point. It's fine if you need a quick bite. But if you're looking for some really good Mexican, I'd suggest elsewhere.

Food was great. I ordered the Parrillada plate and had them add shrimp for 2.00 more. I will never do that again. 3 little shrimp for $2.00. Way to much. The waitress talked to the owner and all he did was shrug his shoulders.  Everything was awesome tasting though. Steak very tender. My boyfriend and I will be back.

I've gone here countless times since a friend recommended it to me, and I haven't been let down once! The staff is always nice and welcoming and the food is amazing. I've tried tacos almost everywhere in Scottsdale and these are probably my favorite. They're really quick too!

Absolutely, positively delicious!  My boyfriend and I had about 10 minutes to grab food before catching the 7:30 show at the Nash last Thursday.  I placed our order over the phone with the intent to just pick up our food and head straight to the Nash.  A lady took my order over the phone.  I ordered a chicken quesadilla ($7.25) for the Mister and a blackened shrimp burrito ($8.00) for me.  The lady repeated my ordered back to me, it was correct, she said my name twice and told me the total.  Once we got there my shrimp burrito was ready but for some reason, the cook said he didn't get the chicken quesadilla order so we had to wait a few minutes.  It didn't take long for them to make it but we were pushing it because of the 7:30 show time at the Nash.  For those who aren't familiar, the Nash is no longer BYOB.  They now sell beer and wine for pretty good prices.  They do allow you to bring your own food or snacks to eat while you enjoy the show.  So that's exactly what we did.  On first bite, the shrimp burrito was out of the world good!  Everything, everything taste so house made.  The rice, the guac, everything.  Same with the chicken quesadilla ... first bite, you're in heaven.  The chicken is grilled to perfection.  They were HUGE!  Made with green peppers, fried onions and gooey cheese.  The prices were really good too.  Total bill about $16 bucks.  Honestly, the best shrimp burrito and chicken quesadilla I've ever, EVER had in the Valley!

Underwhelmed after the hyped expectations from the other reviewers. Easy to miss, small store front in strip shopping area. It is relatively quiet except for the game shows on the TVs. Blackboard menu is a little confusing at first. My "server" (counter service only) was very difficult to understand; nice enough. I had some difficulty understanding his questions about how I wanted my food. Forget about drink refills, they serve sodas via bottle or can only. It is inexpensive and the meal was filling. I did not find the offerings particularly interesting or diverse.

I don't get what all the craze is about. My burrito was just okay---I had better burritos in Boston which doesn't really say much about haberneros. It's better than all the chain burrito places but it doesn't leave me saying "wow. That was good."
Margarita's to-die-for. The Parrillada is incredible. Chips and salsa is great as well. You won't be disappointed

The food is amazing. It is cooked fresh, while you wait. I have nearly everything on the menu and cant find anything I cant recommend. I have been to both of the other locations several times and am glad they came downtown.
The food is always delicious and served quickly. Been coming here since it opened. One of my favorite places. Get the taco salad..it's great

Got a burrito plate with tortillas on the side. The cashier was kind enough to give me the tortillas for free!  Great flavor and no wait! Honestly just ordered and got the food within minutes! Definitely recommend coming here for Mexican food. Solid food, wonderful flavors, and great portion size.

Small, quaint joint. Whoever is dialing up the grill is doing it right. Attention to detail is key here. Although a small, fast food type botique with comfortable seating, everything is prepared to exacting standards...
I just love this place. I always get the three tacos. So fresh and fast and tasty. Spicy pork is great. Pickled onions are amazing. Great basic guacamole.

I have been here a half dozen times for lunch.  The menu is fantastic, the food is flavorful to the point that it's almost addicting.  The service is very very good.  I have varied my orders between the breakfast menu, lunch and specials.  I have never regretted my plate.   This a great lunch choice for Mexican Food.
Great food, clean environment, friendly and fast service! The guacamole was very fresh. All of the food was well prepared. Would recommend.
OMG try their breakfast burritos!!!!  Habanero's has good, cheap, fast Mexican food.

We decided that it was time to try Habanero's Mexican Grill for the first time tonight.  This "locals" establishment is occupying an old Taco Del Mar location (that closed in early 2008) in a strip center behind the Salty Senorita; just north of the Scottsdale Gun Club.  The decor has been upgraded, slightly, from the previous quick-service business.  There is no table service, though there is real-metal silverware and the tables are bused.  I ordered the fried fish tacos and my wife had a carne asada taco.  The kids ordered cheese quesadilla kids-meals with fries.  We split two Mexican Cokes, a Jarriots and a horchata. The total was $20ish and the food was prepared fresh, as we sat at the bar-stools overlooking the grill.  After the meal, we agreed that the quality far-exceeded the price.  The fish tacos were crisp and balanced; the steak-taco was plain and simple with good flavor; and the quesadillas were too-big, and the kids loved them.  Overall we'd give the place a solid 4 out of 5.  The staff was friendly and helpful...even providing me a sample of the carnitas that was freshly prepared; very nice.  This location is situated in a neighborhood that gets blitzed during weekday lunches.  We recommend coming here on the weekend and/or in the evening.

My boyfriend and I have been looking for some amazing mexican food and we found it. Had to wait a little bit to get the food but it was well worth the wait! The nachos were out of this world and the burrito and quesadillas were amazing. Definitely will be back!!!
The Mexican food was standard fare. Salsa verde was really good but their regular salsa was sweet. Fried fish taco was yummy. Good service even for a large party.

Never left a review before... This place is great authentic Mexican food. Habanero salsa is FIRE!! I had the parrillada and I added shrimp. Great sampler of everything they have!  Get the pico and add some habanero salsa to it for a kick. Beans were amazing. Sounds like a fluffed review but it's not. This place is the real deal!

Me and Julie's first visit here. We found this place on Yelp. We needed to stop over and get dinner. Great food the fish tacos and carne asada tacos are very good. Also the chips guacamole and salsa are excellent. If we are ever in the area again, sure to be back. They also serve breakfast as well here.

I would classify. Habenero's  set up as a Mexican Subway.  The burrito's are huge! and even larger if you like alot of ingredients. They have about five different options to start from,Mexican soda, a margarita machine and a fountain machine. Eat and drink for six to nine bucks! The margaritas come in a Styrofoam cup and look like an Icee, that being said I almost walked out the door with it, good thing because there we're two sherrif's  parked out side! I will stop in again, it was convenient,fast and filling.

This place is AWSOME! If you're looking for nice little mexican joint, this is the place to go. Cheap and great food that more importantly, fills you up.  The salsa is amazing and same with the guac.  The owner just got his liquor licsense recently so now you can even grab an ice cold mexican beer with your mexican food. They even have a happy hour special of a bucket for mini-mexican beers for only $5! wow, just talking about this is making me hungry. I'm on my way! See you there!

First, I should say that I am no expert on Mexican food. With that said, I did take out at Habanero's Mexican Grill while in Scottsdale last month, and I liked it.   My blackened chicken quesadilla was good, and my wife's liked her blackened chicken burrito.

North Scottsdale is blessed to have Habanero's in its' midst, and here's why..... All the other Mexican food establishments in the area are corporate with little or no authenticity. Mexican food in North Scottsdale is pretty much styrofoamic. (Is that a word? It is now). And then along came Habanero's.  Clearly this place is a family operation.  The menu has a nice selection and is very economically priced. Fajitas are like $7, but we didn't get them. We ordered Chicken Nachos to start and they were wonderful. I liked that they were light on the cheese and heavy on the chicken. Very tasty.  We also got Blackened Shrimp tacos and fish tacos.  All were excellent.  My little guy got the kid's cheese quesedella and he was happy. The tacos had great flavor. The bill was very low. Keep up the good work and try this place before it gets packed.

Wow what a delicious burrito for the price. Im a Titanium Member at the Scottsdale Gun Club so I wondered by this place after shooting one day and ordered the Shredded Pork Burrito which I found to be loaded with flavor. The food is fresh and while the location is a little hard to find its worth it if you are looking for a good value and you love Carnitas or Fish Tacos.  The restaurant is small however the outdoor seating helps to accomadate the many folks who have heard about this little gem and keep returning much like myself.  I've been back a few times to try some of the other items and they are really good and most importantly fresh as well.  Recently, I visited for another round and the owner even remembered my name which was very impressive but most notable is that he really cares about the quality of food they put out here.  No hype just great food at fair prices.

Best Veggie Burrito around!  The Staff is always friendly and kind and quick.  The restaurant isn't so easy on the eyes, but really great places seem to roll that way.  I would recommend calling in your order in advance if you want it TO GO.  Not much room to sit around and wait for it to be done.  My GO TO place for lunch when I am craving Mexican!
Excellent black been quesadillas!! The prices are great!!! I will be back! Friendly servers and staff. Authentic food!

Excellent food! Not fancy, no frills but a definite place for a quick lunch or dinner that leaves you satisfied or stuffed in our case. Three salsas. The orange one is fire hot and awesome. Felt my tongue go numb and everything. The chips were pretty tasty, too. Service was timely and good. I liked that I could watch the chef prepare my food. I also can't complain about the price for two of us. We only paid 25 bucks for everything! Salsa & chips, soda, and fajitas for two. And the fajitas were seasoned well and brought out on a hot plate. Free tortilla refills, too. If we're in the area again we will be back. Only bad thing is bathroom looked like it needed a little love, but otherwise everything was great.
A much better choice than Qdoba or Chipotle. Pork was prepared perfectly. Green salsa was the perfect compliment. I will definitely be back.

Great food, nice, quiet environment, a little tough to find in a strip mall but totally worth it! The flan is outstanding, like all the tortilla options that come with dinner (they were not stingey with sides), and the staff were great. Agree with other reviews that the salsa was just OK.  Tasty, but far too thin; nearly impossible to eat with chips. Will definitely come back.  It's sooo much better than the other Mexican food restaurants nearby at FLW and the 101.

This place was a pleasant surprise ... looks totally "chain restaurant" (or worse) from the street, but it's apparently a one-off that just shares space with Jimmy John's (go figure).  Drinks were good, and adovada was really good ... could have been served hotter however, and having to ask for the key to use the restroom makes it seem like I'm eating in a Texaco station ... still, it was decent food and the prices were fair ... we will go back.

The food was great, but I was really impressed with the customer service!  Our waitress was super sweet, really attentive, and more than what you usually get in Scottsdale :)  Back to the food... I had a blackened shrimp salad that was bomb and my husband had the nachos which were loaded! I want to go back for the tacos and fajitas!
Not sure why their chicken is orange. I've never seen that before. Overall decent, definitely a lunchtime stop and not dinner.

HIDDEN GEM ALERT!!! I found about this place last week when I made a wrong turn into the parking lot and was starving, so I decided to try it out.   I've been back 3 times since. This place is awesome.  It's fast, fresh, cooked to order .  To be fair, I have only had the blackened chicken tacos on corn tortillas each time, but they are THAT good.  the serving sizes are no joke either, so be prepared to share or be really full.    The horchata is pretty damn good too.    My fiance has tried the bean burrito, the blackened chicken burrito and the fajitas and all have gotten rave reviews from him and he's pretty picky about his mexican food.  The prices are moderate, which makes it an even better find.  The service is always top notch, eager to help.  Excellent food and great prices, what could be better?
Just sooo good! I am a mexican food freak! This place just hits the spot when you want some fast tacos or some nice burritos man come here and get down!
This was a gem. Tucked away and very authentic. You can always tell a good Mexican restaurant when the clientele are Mexican. Loved the fajitas.

Man I love this place.  A more basic, and better priced version of Chipotle.  Authentic and tasty, the steak or pulled pork burritos are the best options.  Guacamole that's not over-sour creamed is a must.   The don't skimp on quality and are locally owned.

Ok, i know I am Hispanic but I had never had a parillada before. WHAT?  Ordered this tasty little dish for my husband and i to share (the 2-person parillada) Steak, Chicken, Chorizo, Shrimp, Potatoes, Onions, Jalapenos, Tomatoes all grilled up and served on a chafing/ grill dish. Served with a side of  beans, rice, tortillas, guacamole for each person. All this and a happy hour Modelo beer for $2. Had some sopapillas (deep fried flour puffs with sugar and honey) for dessert and thought they were ok.  Thank you for a fantastic meal, Habaneros! We are now loyal fans!

I'm coming back. As I've said in previous reviews, I have had a wide variety of Mexican food. 32 years living in the American Southwest will do that to you. I've been to greasy 'how are they still open' dives, upscale fusion cuisine and stuff in between.   Habaneros has no business being a hole in the wall that isn't packed. The food was excellent. My wife went to the Hawaiian joint next door and walked out wishing she had come with me.   They make their own chorizo (a Mexican don't ask what's in it food) which I enjoyed in the chorizo breakfast burrito. I also ordered the staple of guerro cuisine, the cheese quesadilla. It was all up to standard. I also enjoyed their refried beens (which didn't seem canned) and their Spanish rice. Would have liked the rice to be a bit spicier, but it may have just been overshadowed by the well seasoned chorizo.   Long story short... Va a Habaneros y comer.

Best burritos in Madison. Hands down. Think Chipotle or Qdoba... only privately owned and better quality.  The set up is a bit like a Chipotle or Burrachos; and the choices are endless. You choose your base (ei: burrito, quesadilla, tacos) and then all of your ingredients.  I'm a burrito type; with rice; lettuce; guac; pico de gallo and salsa verde. The burritos are MASSIVE.  It's a quick place to get lunch and I am never disappointed.
This place is really awesome! I had a fajita burrito with steak and added rice and cheese. Now going back for a second time. I will definitely be back the quality is good and the price is right!!!!!!
Awesome! This little hole in the wall Mexican place is the best.  Love the blackened shrimp tacos and my husband always gets the chicken burrito.  So good!
The food was very good and the waitress was very pleasant.  The restaurant was clean.  The place was ideal for visiting with family and friends.  I would definitely return.

Amidst one of the wealthier parts of the valley, Senor Taco is a gem because it provides excellent food for an exceptionally low price. Even during the busiest hours, orders are taken quickly and the food is made promptly, however, one can still plan on having a lunch meeting and not feel rushed. Those looking to eat very good Mexican food and save some cash have found the perfect restaurant.
I've only been there once but my carne asada burrito sucked. The meat was tasteless and my tortilla was soggy from all the grease.

I came here for lunch and was going to sit down but it looked so sad and depressing so I ordered my food to go. Then I waited 20 minutes for that order. At that point, I had to leave, so I went to ask the woman at the counter if my order was ready yet, and she turned and grabbed a bag that had been behind her on a shelf for a while! Not sure how long it would have taken to get my order if I hadn't said anything!  The food is good. Mexican fast food, basically. I had a chorizo quesadilla that came with sour cream and guac.   I don't really see the point in coming back, though. Oh well, I tried.

Really great fast casual Mexican.  Quality and great flavor.  I haven't encountered a strange piece of meat as you might at other spots.  I have gotten take out here 3 times and they are friendly, fast and good.  Can't beat that.

Nothing Great, Got the Blackened Chicken Burrito and it was really bland. If I'm ordering Mexican food I want tastes and flavors to be exploding in my mouth, I got red and green salsa for my chips, neither had much flavor and both were pretty watery giving me no relief when I tried to put them on my burrito. I finally  resorted to putting Tapatio hot sauce all over my food and it ended up being alright. On the upside however, the chicken was very tender and pretty tasty, considering. Probably will just stick to Arriba's down the street, a little pricier but their food has more flavor and their servings are bigger.
Best Mexican food in North Scottsdale.  The staff is very friendly and the food is ready quickly.
Look at all these reviews! I thought this place was my hidden gem. I go all the time for a solid breakfast burrito but they a menu full of great stuff. Staff is awesome too
Delicious burritos, that's all I've had because that's the first thing I ordered and haven't regretted it once yet.  Hot/spicy onions are addicting

Shared carne asada burrito and chicken fajitas. Burrito had mediocre tortilla and not very flavorful carne asada.  Beans accompanying fajitas were among the most tasteless I have ever eaten.  Chicken average at best.
Dynamite food one soft carnitas taco will be an entire meal for about $3. All the food is great and a local business to support. I have not been disappointed once!

Very solid spot for fast food style, yet homemade quality Mexican food. Had shrimp fajitas, priced right at about $8.99, was really good. Wife likes the steak quesedilla from here, tried it, very good as well. Funky smell coming from bathrooms could be fixed in an instant with charcoal filters. That would be my only complaint. They also have this cute, tiny, full bar, in case you feel like putiing a few back! And again, prices are very fair. Like it a lot!

Great spontaneous stop for a Saturday dinner. The blackened fish and chicken were fantastic, but the carnitas took it away. What a burst of flavor. Service was excellent, friendly and quick. Overall a great experience, we will be back.

Tried the Blackened Chicken burrito and Ground Beef Taco. Both were good, not legendary. Burrito had plenty of well seasoned chicken, but still seemed small. It was sort of spicy, more like medium. Taco was on a decent flour tortilla, but nothing stood out and green sauce was kind of too spicy for a mild salsa. Crowded on saturday and Horchata was out of a machine, which is far from authentic Mexican.
Thank you Yelp for helping an out of towner find yummy Mexican food nearby. Steak Fajitas for 2 was good, affordable, good drinks. The waitress was super nice too!
My whole team eats here at least once a week. Service is excellent and always friendly! Food is very authentic and always yummy. I highly recommend stopping in.
The food was delicious and inexpensive! We had a nice server and did not have to wait long for our food. Would definitely go back!
We stopped in for lunch. There was 1 waitress waiting on table of a large family. She didn't acknowledge us. We sat a few minutes and decided to leave for a better atmosphere....

This is one of my most favorite places to eat in Scottsdale.   Why? Because it's real, home style cooking and it's not expensive.
