For some reason (haha) it's really hard to find normal "food" that doesn't cost an arm and a leg. (Scottsdale rents $$$$$, I'm sure....)  BUT, these people have it DOWN! Perfect beans and rice. Warm chips and flavorful salsa (although it's more of a sauce, still, soooo good.)  The tacos are perfect: Size, stuffings, yeah... good stuff. Nothing is over done with sauces, it doesn't have to be. When good food is cooked right, it's good without all the extras that are nothing more than wasted calories.   They do have a bar, but I've never ordered anything more than a beer, so I'm not sure about cocktails.   Under $30 for two people, lots of really good food, chips, salsa and two beers is practically unheard of in Scottsdale. And while I'd love for this place to remain a hidden gem, the food, service and prices are just too good to remain a secret.
Great food, plenty of it, and an unbeatable price. Much better than Chipotle or Qdoba.  Location is in an inconvenient spot, but for food this good, totally worth it.

I drive for Uber and I gave the owner a ride a few months ago. Living in orange county I'd not sure where to eat in the Phoenix area so he recommended his restaurant. I'm happy to of been able to come here it is pretty good.

We visit Scottsdale for at least one week every year and for the first time investigated Habanero's. After our visit it will not be our last time eating in this excellent restaurant. Coming from Southern California we are well acquainted with Mexican cuisine, and used to "hole in the wall" or strip mall places. Habanero's is as good or better than anything I've had in the price range. I had the Parrillada combination of meats and all were fantastic. I tried my daughters ground beef burrito and it was very tasty as well. Great food, great value.

Mexican food fast!  And affordable!  And they actually have jamaica!    I had the chicken enchilada with green tomatillo sauce and a side of rice.   The portions were a little smaller than I'm used to seeing but the serving size was just enough to satisfy without over stuffing.  The price seems right for a dish this size.   The chicken had a nice seasoned flavor and the tortillas were good too.   The rice was a little dry and had that "not so fresh" kind of texture but was good none the less.  The salsas were good as well and had a little spicy heat and did taste fresh.   I'd give a solid three stars for this place but the fact they actually had jamaica made all the difference for me!
Really good carnitas burrito. The habanero salsa had some good flavor but wasn't very spicy. Horchata was very tasty but too sweet.
Great tacos!  I'm in town for a day and found this place on yelp.  Friendly service, good food.  Make sure you get the habanero sauce, nice and spicy.

I'm a huge fan of Habanero's Mexican Grill. I've tried pretty much every taco that they offer, and every single one of them is amazing. The lobster taco may be my favorite. Fresh, light, and full of flavor! The owner and staff are very friendly and helpful as well. If you're ever downtown, definitely give them a try!!

I typically would give a place like this a three had they been open for a substantial amount of time but given this place is fairly new, I lent a little leeway.  I ordered the Kayla's Favorite with green sauce and chicken, overall the food was good, the rice was a little under-cooked but nothing a little tweaking can't fix.  Friend ordered the revoltura and it wasn't stellar (potatoes tasted odd), but what sold it for me was the moment he brought out the food, he realized my buddy asked for no sour cream on the side, turned back around and got it off the plate.  The food isn't anything to write home about but it'll stick to your ribs and keep you full for a bit

This is a local, family business, the type we find has the best food and the friendliest people.  Everything is cooked to order, so it takes a little time. No microwave in sight. I was told some of the recipes were handed down from the Grandmother., a  lot of it seems to be Guadalajara, Jalisco dishes. I like the Calamari Tacos and Lobster Enchiladas. They don't have Lobster every day, usually Friday, and only if it looks good to them. There are a few breakfast items if you go in earlier. Everything I've tried here was good, and the staff is great!] The flan is also excellent for dessert.

Habanero's has excellent food and outstanding prices, making it one of my very favorite stops in Madison for a quick and delicious bite to eat. Service is friendly and Chipotle-style, and if you're like me you'll need some of pretty much EVERYTHING on your burrito! I love that Habanero's offers a local alternative to Chipotle (shop local eat local people!) and I love LOVE that they use local and organic ingredients in their food. If I were an octopus, I'd give Habanero's eight tentacles up... but alas, I am a mere human with cravings for good Mexican food, so I'll have to settle with two thumbs up. ;)

I just have to say that the carnitas was fantastic!! Everything else was good too along with a cold Mexican beer there is No complaints. The owner was very friendly and a little known fact is that some of the bad reviews about this place are rival mexican restaurants nearby so don't trust them..
Muy Bueno!! The best authentic Mexican food ever.  I am from old Mexico and i missed the food, the flavors, the aroma, and of course the love in the food.  Habanero's you guys hit a homerun!

I've been back several times and I'm still loving Habaneros!  Their green salsa is to die for.  Although I tend to order the same things, I've tried several different items and have enjoyed everything.  I especially like that the kitchen is open so you can see your food being prepared. Oh, and the green salsa?  Awesome!  I know I said that before, but it bears repeating.

Wow we had great meal and very reasonable prices- margaritas were good but would have preferred a more traditional glass.  Highly recommend this little "hole in the wall" place.  Can't wait to go back.

Good food , great costumer service and good prices what else can you ask for. I've been to Habanero's a hand full of times and every time it's been a great experience! Food is cooked fresh and the wait isn't very long. I strongly recommend this place!!

I love this place. Their menu is simple and the topping are fresh and authentic. I wish they hand make their tortilla. I had 3 tacos. 2 steak and 1 spicy pork. For $6, it was so filling. U can't bet the  price. My go to Mexican place in the north side.

We're 'regulars' and we have to get our calamari taco fix often.  Never disappointed!  Sometimes we'll mix up what we order to try other (delicious) items.  But we keep going back for their excellent calamari tacos!

Fish tacos are oh so amazing!!!  I have to eat here at least once a week. The food is fresh. The prices are fair. The guys are great. Everything I've tried has been excellent! I love the habanero salsa too- nice and hot!  Look, some people complain that they wait too long for their food to be prepared. If you want FAST food then try Burger King down the road. I'll wait 10 minutes for my fresh food.  As far as service... they are all so friendly! I always have a great time here!

A favorite in our office.  It's easy to miss this place if you're not looking. It's kind of in a weird spot, at the end of a building that houses other businesses. But it's so worth it.  No frills, no BS and a limited menu compared to other Mex joints, but don't let that stop you! This place is fantastic. Burritos, nachos, tacos, quesadillas - it's all good. The spicy pork is a favorite and not like anything I've had at other Mexican restaurants.  It's sort of like a Qdoba or Chipotle set up where you go through and "build" your item to order.  They also do fantastic catering! And to top it off, it's cheap. Like crazy cheap. Like you think it can't possibly be as good as it is for that cheap.

Decent tacos although the chicken is an unusual shade of orange, but it tasted fine. There was a pair of grumpy guys working behind the counter. Wouldn't go out of my way to eat here, but it certainly is solid enough if I worked nearby.
Great find, off the beaten path and tucked in behind a Jimmy John's. Great food and fast friendly service! Shrimp taco was super tasty and the verde salsa was great!

Came in for dinner on Saturday and the food was really bad. I am surprised at all the good reviews. My cheese enchiladas were served lukewarm, and the cheese on the inside was still cold and not melted. To make it worse, the enchilada sauce was bland. The black beans were bland. No reason to come back.

Came here for lunch yesterday and the food was pretty good.   You walk up to the front and put in your order and then go find a table. We came here before noon and it was pretty busy. It actually died down after noon. It takes about 10 minutes or so (maybe more) for your food to come to your table so don't come here if you're in a rush.   Some of the orders come with beans and rice and others with just chips. And they bring a green and red salsa to your table. I had a carne asada burrito with chips and it was just enough to fill me up. My boyfriend's enchilada meal came with rice and beans. The horchata was pretty good (I've had the homemade stuff and nothing compares), but not as good as the ones you can get from a Betos place.   The guy taking orders said their carnitas and blackened chicken were their specialties so I'll have to try one of those next time I stop by.

They have the best shrimp tacos ever! First time here and I loved it. Service was fast and friendly. Prices were reasonable. The Cajun shrimp tacos are the best tacos I've ever had. The guacamole was amazing too!

Love this place! I almost always get a burrito, but have had their tacos too. Everything is delicious and fresh. Most of the time, I order to-go, but have also eaten in. I've also done larger orders for work, 10-15 separate items (they have a PDF on their website you can download, print, and fill out. I just hand it to them and they make the order in no time). It's similar to a Chipotle or Qdoba, but is authentic and actually slightly less cost-wise. They are super fast, but don't let that pressure you if you're indecisive like me :)
Best Mexican food I had during my Arizona trip.  Warning, if you ask for your food spicy it will be super-spicy.    Zero ambiance, just excellent cheap Mexican food.

The food here is absolutely amazing and so is the staff! The breakfast burrito is one of my favorite things but there tacos and regular burritos are also amazing. I have never been disappointed with the food here. Even the fish tacos are amazing. The only thing that is missing is the Mexican rice and re fried beans. They have rice and beans but i like a more creamy re-fried bean almost like a dip.

This place is great, the staff always do the best they can to suit your needs. They are very friendly and they make good food. They keep upgrading small things here and there and it's exciting to see what they come up with next. I am a regular customer.

I love it here! It reminds me of authentic little restaurants in Mexico. No frills, no fancy decor. The food and service is delightful. We started off with my favorite beer drink, a "michelada." The bartender was not in that evening but the waitress made us a  VERY tastey one. We started off with the chicken nachos. Yum! My sis in law and I shared the Parilla dinner. We didn't want the carnitas or chorizo and had them replace it with shrimp.y husband had the chicken salad and enjoyed it. They know how to season and cook their meat! I am definitely returning!
Very good food. I go there once a week and love it. Steak burrito you can't go wrong. They are big and for 650 they blow away qdoba and chipotle away.

Stopped by here for the first time today.  Had the taco platter with a side of rice and beans and a horchata. Thought it was good and authentic.   It was fast and there was a variety of meat to choose from.  Reminded me of La Bamba only without a drive thru and you get to see your food being made.  Would recommend and will be coming back.
Good lord I love this place.  So flavorful, not a thing I don't like.  Better than chipotle or qdoba!!!  Cheaper too!

Ate here for the first time last week. I have been looking for good, fast mexican food in the area and this fits the bill.  We arrived at the peak lunch time and the line moved quickly. It was a little tricky finding a table outside, so we reluctantly sat inside. Then one of the workers politely let us know an outdoor table had just opened up and we moved. The patio had a nice vibe to it.  I ordered the carne asada burrito, which was filled with pico de gallo and guacamole. Nice and simple, the way I like it. The meat was perfectly cooked and the guacamole was fantastic. My mom had the blackened chicken tacos, which I tried a bite of (they lived up to the hype!)  SOPAPILLAS: they are seriously the most addicting and delicious dessert out there but not many restaurants seem to have them. I was overjoyed when I spotted the handwritten sign for "homemade sopapillas." For $3.50, you get 3 delicious fluffy pieces of fried dough covered in cinnamon and filled with honey.  Will definitely make this a regular lunch spot. Note: rice is $1 extra and chips and salsa cost $1.29. You do get a couple of chips with your burrito, but no salsa.
By far, the freshest, best tasting Mexican food around. I live on Mexican food and this is THE spot. Recommend the quesadilla with chipotle space and the taco salad with deep fried tortilla shell!

Stopped for lunch last week, ordered 3 carnitas tacos that were fantastic. Everything from the tortilla to the guacamole tasted incredibly fresh. The pork was tender and flavorful, also seemed like it was prepared same day. Food was prepared in an open kitchen and was made to order and served quickly. Will be back when I'm in the area

mediocre- not amazing but not horrible! i actually didn't want to write a review to be totally honest but i checked in here and yelp wouldn't quit telling me to write a review. i finally caved just to remove the annoying reminder. you win, yelp, you win.   i've only been twice. not a fan of the carne asada but the chorizo, shredded pork and blakcened chicken is Ok. The price is fair and the people working have been super friendly both times.

This is a great find.  I have had some take out before and it was always pretty good.  My husband loves this place, so every time he is in the area, he offers to bring some dinner home.  I had a fajita burrito a couple of times.  They travel well.  About a week ago, we were in the area and it was dinner time.  He convinced me to come here.  I am glad, we had a good time.  We ordered steak fajitas and shrimp fajitas so we could sample both.  We also had the chips and salsa.  The food was fresh tasting and very flavorful.  The portions are very generous.  I will definitely come back again.

I've been coming to Habanero's since they opened. They are the best and most authentic Mexican spot in the Scottsdale Airpark. The food is always delicious, they have great service, and great prices. They have two locations in Scottsdale now. The other one is on Scottsdale and Shea.

Folks in my office had been telling me about this place for a while so I finally decided to try them out...look up the phone number and dial and it rings....rings...rings...rings....FINALLY someone answered! Although it took a couple attempts (3rd call :p) when I got someone on the phone the service was super friendly!   When I went to grab my lunch, the place was packed and crazy so I had to wait  few for my order but the service was again super friendly and totally on top of things. I actually just sat there and watched their AMAZING grill cook do his thing (sounds weird but go watch, it's fun!)  Got the salad back to my office, oohed and ahhed at the presentation (sometimes, food is just PRETTY) and dug in-WOW! BEST grilled chicken EVER! Super juicy, fresh, flavor galore! Lettuce?.....ehhhh well it's all about the grilled chicken anyways :P  Aside from the phone difficulty at the start (can't fault a place for being popular/busy) my experience with this place was an "A" for sure.   Just make sure you have some time to order from this place :)

I don't understand why this place isn't packed all the time. We walk up here for fabulous - and inexpensive, but not cheap - tacos. They load the tacos so full you have to knife and fork them.  I have always found the ingredients to be fresh. I'm not a huge fan of the chicken seasoning, but the other meats are good for the price point.   Menu is simple: burritos, quesadillas, tacos, salads, tortas and nachos. Even though the menu states a 3 taco order, you can actually order just one (which I think is plenty). I really like the choice of pinto beans instead of the traditional black.  The guacamole is fresh and the portion is generous - and no extra charge when it's part of a vegetarian item.  The thing I find most unique are the spicy onions that are a topping offering. I love spicy food and these definitely clear the sinuses.   Finally, I loathe cilantro, and I have a lot of control over the cilantro situation here. The only topping I won't add is the corn, which has a lot of cilantro mixed in. The rest of the toppings are either very light on it or don't have cilantro at all, but you can have it added to your dish to get your fix, if that's what you're into.

I love Mexican food!!! One of the first things I always try when I go to a new place is the Chiles Rellenos.  Its a great benchmark for the overall quality, "tastyness", and value of most everything on the menu.  Is the chili fresh and prepared well? (Hatch or not Hatch). Is the chili stuffed with a delectable Mexican cheese mix (or just  jack cheese)? What kind of batter? egg? breading?  (One place I went had a deep fried, crumpled saltine cracker crust that was surprisingly good). Are sides included?  Habanero's Chiles Rellenos wasn't all that great.  Far to many seeds left in the chili for my taste.  Just melted jack on the inside.  Mostly egg battered outside (not very thick).  I don't think the chili was roasted in any special way or given any other kind of seasoning...Overall it was Meh.  The chili came with a side of beans that were authentic yet a little boring.  Also included:  A little Spanish rice (also boring).  Pico was yucky.  They are very generous with the sour cream.  (I noticed that sour cream and guacamole are included in most dishes so you don't have to pay extra).  Cool.
Great tacos, great people!  Love this place!

I stumbled across this place by accident and it turned out pretty well for me. This place is authentic Mexican food! Prices aren't an arm and a leg.   The whole layout was awesome. It gave it a special kind of feel. The bathrooms were kept up to date and clean. All the workers and even the owner were polite and offered great customer service. I was in there around 9:30 am so I decided to go with a chorizo breakfast burrito. It was a pretty big burrito and it sure was delicious!!   I didn't get to sit down and eat; I ordered my food to go because I had some running around left today. I sure will be back again! I highly recommend it! It's definitely worth the drive!   This ends my review for now. I give this place a 5 star and I highly recommend it! For breakfast, lunch, and even dinner.
This place is great.  You come in for a burrito and leave fully satisfied.  All of the food is fresh- which you've gotta appreciate!!  I highly recommend the fajita burrito or their guac.  Yum :)

The food was so delicious and the customer service topped it. Everyone was so friendly and attentive. The food was so good that I was full and wanted to keep eating. If you haven't been here, please try it out! The owner is very attentive with the customers as well and you don't get that at other places!

Had the 2 person platter for $20 and it was worth it. It came with chorizo, grilled chicken, shredded beef, carne asada and grilled veggies. The side of rice and beans was delicious and the corn tortillas were tasty (they also offer flour tortillas). They had horchata but I did not try it. A good authentic Mexican restaurant.

Tried blacken shrimp and a lobster taco. You get your money's worth and it's delicious! Can't wait to go back and try everything else. A must try and of course they will be busy during lunch time, very friendly employees.

Excellent food! It was the hubby and I's first time here. We both had tacos, I would highly recommend the corn tortillas, they are great! The restaurant is very clean and the severs are really nice. Great prices overall, we will be back!

Went with a group of friends from work for lunch. They were packed, but we managed to get a table.  Service was good and friendly. My carnitas burrito was a bit plain and expensive for what I got. Overall, a bit disappointed.
Blackened chicken tacos and carnitas are fabulous, will definitely be coming back.  Very friendly service, nothing fancy, just great food!

Don't judge a book by its cover. Inside is clean and roomy and the food is great. Very fresh and delicious. The people there are friendly too. So glad I checked yelp for a place to eat here in Madison, WI.  My steak tacos were terrific. Muy Bueno!

This place is a nice surprise for the size of it. When we walked in I was under the impression it's and order and sit type place. BUT it is actually a sit and be served! I was so happy for that. We ordered chips and salsa: I'm not a big fan of Green Salsa but theirs was pretty good!. Hubs got a Carne Asada Burrito which he devoured. I got the same with Enchilada style. And devoured.  They do have a bar which was interesting. Hubs ordered a Michilada which he liked. But of course I could not give a 5th star because there is a Victoria sign which we thought they would have that beer but they did not. Other than that I would come back when I'm in the area!

Visited Habanero's for lunch yesterday and it was awesome! I had the Carnitas tacos - great flavor, fresh made guac and pico - YUM! My husband had a steak quesadilla and love it too. The service was fast and friendly. We will definitely go back.   Our only complaint is the chips and salsa - the chips are great, but both of the regular red and green salsa's were really mild for our taste - still great flavor though. Will try the spicy version next time we go.

The food here is excellent and I love going there. The only problem I seem to always have is with the kid's menu. I realize this is a mexican place, but my daughter will only eat chicken fingers and fries when we're there. The fries are always undercooked and greasy and the last time, the fryer was closed down.  I got her a plain chicken taco. Basically, she had no dinner that night.  The staff is always super friendly and I want to eat there every day, but the kids options can be a little tricky.
Blackened chicken tacos & carnitas tacos are my extreme favorite . Add cabbage & green sauce to both & its a date .

I completely have to thank Yelp for this one. I work around the Scottsdale Airpark and I didn't even know this place existed until I did a little Yelping. The food is definitely on point with what the other reviews are saying, and I was very pleased.  When I got there for lunch, there was a line to the door. I was grateful though because I had no idea what to order. I'm serious too because that usually doesn't happen to me at a Mexican restaurant. Their special sounded great as did pretty much everything else. I decided to go with the delicious sounding blackened chicken burrito and an order of chips and salsa (kind of a must for me at a new Mexican place). The chips were pretty standard, but crispy and yummy, and the salsas were great! We were given a verde, a regular (red with lots of pepper flavor) and their version of a spicy salsa. I believe the latter had habaneros in it; it lacked a little in flavor but definitely packed a little bite. Overall the salsas were very good; I even threw some on my burrito. Speaking of that, the burrito was great! It wasn't filling like any of the Berto places, but instead, just right. In other words, I didn't feel too guilty about it. The chicken was awesome and the other fillings (rice, pico and chipotle sauce) brought it all together very nicely.  I've for sure added this place to my list of lunch spots. I can see why it gets great reviews, but I can also see why people are hesitant to boast about it. It's a well-kept secret tucked away in the depths of North Scottsdale that is becoming less of one day after day.

This place was a winner, and I'm embarrassed to say I just found out it existed even though it's apparently been in business over 10 years! We drove by it the other day and then I looked it up on Yelp - so we were back for a quick dinner that night. Both my husband and myself just got a burrito - talk about bang for your buck! $6 with all the fixings, and it was seriously as thick as my upper arm....we already both agreed next time we would split one. I officially have no excuse to hit up a Taco Bell/Taco John's drive through ever again.

A great little hole-in-the-wall for a quick, affordable lunch. Gets pretty busy around noon, but if you're in around 11:45 you'll be fine.   I was trying to be healthy and ordered the Chicken Taco Salad - it ended up being served in a fried tortilla bowl so big I could have worn it as a hat! Everything in it was delicious, but this is definitely not something I could order every day. Burritos, on the other hand, ran a bit small but were still tasty.   This wasn't exactly what I'm looking for in a daily lunch spot, but the food was solid, the service was friendly, and the prices were decent. There's some seating, but you may be better off taking it to go if things are busy.   +1 for fountain drink Horchata! :-)

Quaint, authentic, wonderful little Mexican diner.  Outside or inside seating.  Bathrooms were clean. Food had a nice blend of spices and green and red sauces were lovely.  I had a very nice time here.  You can get in and out quick or you can relax and enjoy.  I sat in the patio and it was clean no bugs or flys .

This was a great find. We were overwhelmed with the menu. We got the chorizo and carne nachos, the special of the day shrimp Mexicana, and two tacos. All was great! Service was great and they had beer wine etc.    The Habanero salsa was screaming and the tortilla's fresh and homemade. Boy I wish we could get this kind of Mexican at home! PS Cheap too!
Great guys. Authentic food. Good prices. Get the carnitas w/ a cold Horchata and you'll be a happy camper.
Great place for happy hour!  Order the house margarita and chicken taco for sure!

I had high expectations for this Mexican restaurant since the Yelp reviews were all quite positive.  We enjoyed some chips and salsa to start and then I ordered the cheese enchiladas for my dinner.  Honestly, the portion was pretty small and there was nothing special about these enchiladas.  Hoping that I just ordered the wrong thing and this place does well otherwise, but I'll get my Mexican fix elsewhere!
The food was good and the service was excellent. The salsa though was not as spicy as expected

Food is great. I wouldn't say it's the best Mexican food but it's pretty darn good. I wish they would be a little less stingy on their salsa. Always seems like it's a struggle to get it or like it's somewhat of a bother when u ask for multiple types of salsa. They should just put it out so we can grab our own if it's too time consuming for them.

Our first visit to this Habanero's location, in a strip mall near the Scottsdale Gun Club.  We opted to go with the table service although you can also choose to order at the counter fast-food style. Our server was friendly, helpful and attentive.   You pay $1.29 for a basket of chips and 3 salsas which is a reasonable price for the quantity you receive, but they are just room temperature chips from a bag and the salsas, although very tasty, were extremely thin in consistency. We didn't eat a whole lot of them because it was like dipping chips in bowls of soup broth.  The carnitas burrito and chicken fajita burrito that we ordered were outstanding. They were a fairly large size, piping hot, loaded with a generous portion of really flavorful, moist meat. We would not hesitate to order either one of those again.   Overall, a really pleasant experience!

The quality of food here is EXCELLENT. The meats are fresh grilled, and the food is not greasy at all. Tacos are delicious and authentic. Nachos are light and tasty. Salads come with a healthy portion of grilled meat. Authentic Mexican beers wash it all down (for only a few bucks a pop!). So yummy. So clean. So friendly and welcoming. I love this place and will be coming back often.

Ordered take out from here, and was actually impressed! They were super quick and the food was really good. I had a blackened shrimp burrito with a delicious chipotle cream sauce as well as a lobster taco (I mean, how could one not order a taco with lobster in it right?) The blackened shrimp burrito came with a side of chips and was everything I was looking for in a lunch. The lobster taco was also delicious, and the lobster was cooked perfectly.  I'm thinking of ordering here for a large group order for work in the future, just because I think it would go over really well! The only thing I wish (as someone who works in the area) is that they delivered, but honestly I'll definitely be back.
Some of the best Mexican I've had. Had the Parrillada Tampiquena...excellent. So good we're coming back for breakfast.

Habaneros is always one of our favorite quick stops for lunch or dinner!  They have really flavorful meats and salsas and fast service.  I usually make a burrito bowl the steak with the steak and you can't go wrong.  This place definitely rivals Qdoba or Chipotle but does have a few less options but they aren't needed here.  Out of the three locations, this one is definitely my favorite!

The food is excellent. Blackened fish and ground beef tacos were very flavorful and filling. Steak fajita was well seasoned. Steak  was tender and juicy. Tortillas were hot and lightly steamed. Chicken quesadillas were meaty and not dry. Service was excellent. Very friendly and accommodating staff. Will definitely eat hear again when back in the area.
Had the blacked shrimp and fish tacos and the chile rellenos both were outstanding as were the Margeritas.  A must eat casual Mexican place in north scottsdale.

Just can't go wrong here, the food quality is fresh and just tastes great. For me they have the best tacos in the area. I've tried other spots within a few miles and they are not nearly as good and genealogy charge more. 5 stars.

Currently enjoying my first meal here. I'm a simple eater and chose the bean and cheese burrito; simple but delicious! Only thing I found a little weird was the plates. They were a little kiddish but no matter this is definitely a nice joint to eat at!

I come here for lunch almost every day. Great lunch specials and great tasting food. I've had almost everything. Some of my favorites would be the Mahi Mahi Tacos, Blacked shrimp or chicken burritos are loaded and bomb. Today I ordered the blacked shrimp and steak quesadilla. It was off the roof. They usually rotate a lot of tequilas, which is good cause they know their tequilas. Make sure to stop by and check it out. And if you are getting off work and have some time, the HABANERO TEQUILA SHOT IS A MUST HAVE! I get it every Saturday after work .
I try to go here at least once every 2 weeks for lunch. Amazing food and customer service.  Highly recommend the carnitas burrito!
Once again the best. All the employees are happy and helpful. The blackened chicken burrito with green sauce was awesome!!  We love this place

One of the few places where you don't have to pay 10 bucks to enjoy lunch. The food here is pretty good and the service is nice and friendly. Give this place a try if you're a local and looking for mexican food.

Found this place on Yelp and it did not disappoint!  We had chicken fajitas for two, perfect serving size, chicken seasoned nicely and tender.  Service was great, margaritas were tasty and other guests were friendly and happy to be there.  We will be back!

Well, I have to say that I am not fast food eater and I like to seat and read menu, and service of course . Stopped here right after celebration New Year, I was hungry. It looks like fast food, you must order at a counter, but full bar & serve to table. I ordered fajitas with two eggs in top, no problem! Food was soooooo delusionsssssssssss , eggs great, chicken great, veggies just right ... not over cooked , not undercooked! With margaritas! Let new year get started !!!!!!

First let me compliment the friendly and helpful staff, they were very welcoming. Second, the carne asada tacos my spouse and I ordered were just okay. The meat was a little tough and lacked flavor. I had high hopes for Habanero's. I love Mexican food and they're relatively close to my house. I wanted to love the food, but I didn't. I will continue my quest for a phenomenal mexican eatery in Scottsdale, hell, I will even settle for a hole in the wall in Phoenix as long as the food is GOOD.

Service is amazing, the most friendly people work here. Plus a mini bar on top of awesome Mexican food?! Orale! Micheladas and street tacos go together like peanut butter and jelly, rice and beans, peas and carrots... You catch my drift

I have been to Habanero's 3 times now in less than a month. It helps that it's conveniently located close to my office. The first time we went there, it was a suggestion by one of my colleagues. We got there at 2:00pm. It was quiet. We were asked to sit and was given the menus. My colleague had been there many times before so she recommended that I order the Carne Asada Burrito. We were asked if we would like chips and salsa with or without guacamole and we said yes & with. We were served a basket of colored chips and two salsas, green and red and the guacamole. We really enjoyed the green salsa, red not so much. The guacamole was superb! Very fresh, I loved it.   Our food was served pretty quickly. It was a Tuesday so we also were offered our "company discount" which we weren't aware of! I think the waitress who works there recognized either our badges or car tag, she guessed where we worked herself! 20% off an already reasonably priced meal, that was great! We decided we'll definitely be back again and that's exactly what I have done twice already.   My second time there was with my husband on one of our days off during the week. We ordered the steak fajita for two. I expected the fajita to come on a sizzling plate. It did not but, it was pretty good. At the end of our meal, we were asked if we would like to have dessert and we initially said no, but then I could not resist Flan! The waitress said it would be home made, delicious, and the best in town. I had to say yes to Flan! Who would say no??? I tried it and for someone who has had lots of Flan in the past, this was indeed Delicious!! It was so yummy I beat my husband and finished most of it alone, lol!   My third time there was yesterday. This time we were there at around 1:20pm. Honestly, since we only have an hour break for lunch, this wasn't the best time to be there. With it being such a popular place around a business area, it was packed! We had to order at the cashier and then take a seat. Our food still came out in a reasonable amount of time but since the line was quite long when we were ordering, we had to rush through our food. And yes I ordered Flan to go!   Definitely a great spot to have lunch or dinner. I strongly recommend the Flan if you're a Flan fan! Great service and good food for a reasonable price. We have just become regulars!

Really amazing food. Caritas were perfectly cooked and the service was crazy quick and with a smile. Carne asada burrito was also perfection. I could eat here every day. Also affordable.  Highly recommended

I have been a customer at Habanero's since the joint opened. The food is delicious, they have a great menu, and the staff is friendly.   Another great aspect of Habanero's is that they cater. Their mini-chimis are a great alternative to wings on Superbowl Sunday.  My personal favorite dish is the buenos nachos. Authentic? Nope, but it's really delicious. Their fish tacos and carne asada burritos are also great.

Great find! Don't let the mini-mall outward appearence deter you!   Went here for lunch with our employees, almost decided not to because from the outward appearence it doesn't look special.  Its VERY authentic food, which is big for me because there are a ton of super-americanized mexican restaurants in Scottsdale. This is the real deal...  I got the Carne Asada Burrito and it was excellent. Then after finishing , the waitress was so kind and brought out some free blackened chicken tacos and they were also spectacular she mentioned that was their specialty.  Great service, great food, great prices... Secretive and decieving location...  Try it out you wont be disappointed!!

Sadly it's just OK.  I ordered the parrillada.  The chicken and steak were dry and for an extra $2 I got 3  tiny little shrimp.  Steak was also chewy.  The people are nice but they're stingy.  My meal was $14 plus $6 wine and they charged me .50c for a bit of lettuce and .50c for a bit of diced tomato.  NEVER seen that at any MX place, anywhere. They need to focus on the food. We spent $40 and let disappointed.
Good food, friendly staff. Blackened Chicken Burrito Was very good. Fast service as well. I would go back.
Awesome breakfast.  Had a burrito and DH had the scramble with chorizo.  Both made to order.  Fresh ingredients and spicy red and green salsa.  Always friendly service.

Family owned with two locations in the valley (I think), this is probably the best Mexican spot in north Scottsdale. The space is small, and it caters mostly to folks who work in the area. The food is fresh, and the staff is extremely friendly and focused on ensuring you have an awesome meal.  I had the carnitas Jalisco, which is a pork based dish. It was what I would expect out of a home kitchen! Must go if you're in the area.

We wanted authentic Mexican food and this place had high ratings.  It was located a few blocks from Downtown Phoenix with a moderately-sized parking lot. You can dine inside with tableside service or you can call ahead and pick up as evidenced by the pick up only parking spaces at the entrance.  Upon entry, you are able to view the kitchen area in plain sight, there are several tables that you can sit at and if small bar in the corner. The music was good & made me want to dance (LOL);  but must have been on a loop as we heard it twice in the hour we were eating dinner.  We made it just in time to enjoy the last 5 minutes of happy hour. I selected a traditional margarita that was surprisingly tasty and not too tangy.  The hubby got a Corona. The kids each got horchatas that were really good and appeared to have free refills.  The bathrooms: are locked as they are for customers only per a sign on each bathroom.  The women's bathroom bathroom was very clean and well-stocked with real toilet paper and not the rough commercial toilet paper. :-)  The food/meals: The kids shared a bean burrito that was made out of real flour tortilla (approx. 14") and not a thick Ameeican store bought one, the beans were tasty & they used white cheese which was great.  The hubby got carne asada nachos that came with three different types of tortilla chips (red spicy one, yellow corn & blue corn), pinto beans, pico de gallo, jalapeños, sour cream, white melted cheese & guacamole.  In an attempt to stay away from the carbs I ended up choosing something on the menu that was called a carne asada bowl.  Ultimately, it was not a bowl and was a cup of unsavory red rice topped with about 1/2 cup of equally unsavory carne asada, guacamole & pico de gallo that was served on the inner circle of a nine inch plate. I added some salt to give it a little bit more flavor and that helped a bit.  Total of $40... definitely not bad.   The service: we only saw two guys cooking in the back and a young woman who was our waitress. She appeared to speak mostly  Spanish but every now and then we would overhear her say something in English. She was extremely friendly and was patient with the kids.
We got the sampler plate and everything was delicious! ! The chorizo was super spicy. Staff was attentive.

I came by here from reading Yelp reviews and saw the Lobster Enchilada Special! I wasn't too hungry but needed some food in my system before a show.  I never had lobster enchiladas but it was amazing! They also had a habanero sauce which made the enchiladas taste much better! They also have happy hour from 3pm-6pm which would help quench your thirst.   I would definitely come back here for food when I'm in the area. You would have to order and pay prior to sitting but it all works out.

This is our family's favorite restaurant for a number of reasons.  First the food is very fresh and always consistent.  My kids get the blackened chicken nachos, which they crave at least once a week.  I typically order the blackened fish tacos, which are outstanding.  My husband recommends the blackened chicken tacos or burrito.  The guacamole is always fresh and delicious.  In addition, they have draft beer and margaritas.  The prices are very reasonable as well.  What more could you ask for!  We always have Gabby as our server.  She is super friendly and remembers exactly what we like to order!
Food is amazing!!! Freshly cooked, just give them a little more time to cook or call ahead if your in a rush!

Quick, clean and great tasting food. The staff greet you with warm welcomes upon entry and are eager to help throughout the dining experience. We came here on our lunch break from the gun range. Glad we did!

Habanero's, Besame Mucho. That's a perfect theme song for this restaurant. I've been eating here for the last five years and I see it's been about 4 years since I last reviewed Habanero's.  This is a family owned restaurant in which they also opened up a location at Shea & Scottsdale Rd about 18 months ago. I've had just about everything on the menu and everything is delicious. If they don't have what you're looking for on the menu then just ask. They will cook it for you. Is your hot sauce too gringoized for you. Tell them to put more heat in it. No problema, gringo.  A few of my favorite dishes are the Carnitas Enchilada style. I couldn't tell you what enchilada style means, but I like it. This Burrito is packed full of carnitas meat and the  other goodies that you normally find in a burrito. Besame Mucho!  I also really like the Buenos Nachos with the carnitas. If you haven't picked up on this yet, I really love carnitas. These are basially nachos covered with cheese, cilantro, jalapenos, tomatoes, onions, refried beans and of course a generous dose of carnitas. I usually share this dish with my wife at lunch time. Besame Mucho!  My absolute favorite is the Parrillada. The menu board says 1-3 servings available. But since no one's willing to share in our family of four I order the Parrillada for four. Remember, if you don't see it on the menu, ask. This dish comes with Carnitas, Chicken, Steak and Chorizo along with home fry style potatoes, onions, tomatoes, hot peppers, beans, guacamole and sour cream. And don't forget the rice and tortillas. My wife always substitutes the beans with the rice. And the kids don't like the sour cream and guacamole so they leave that off their plates. So you can see how accommodating the staff is at Habanero's. Besame Mucho!  They also serve adult beverages which include Mexican Beer and drinks like Tequila, etc. The owner and his staff are really nice people and they serve you great food at an affordable price point. Try them out. Besame Mucho!

The food here is amazing and service is top notch. The prices are reasonable and serving size is decent. The food tastes fresh and full of flavor. The chips and salsa are also great. They have both indoor and outdoor seating along with a good selection of drinks. I would highly recommend and will definitely revisit when I am in town.

We were on a mission to find a good Mexican eatery in Scottsdale and we happened upon Havanero's Mexican Grill.  The guacamole is to die for.  I designed my own burrito stuffed with guac, cheese, black beans, cheese topped off with hot sauce.  My husband had soft tacos stuffed with pork and steak with rice and beans.  YUM!  Everything is FRESH and authentic.  The owner waited on us and was nothing but totally gracious and humorous, as well.  We came in at 8:55, not knowing they closed at 9:00.  We offered to leave and he would not hear of it!  He just got his liquor license and is very excited about that!  He made my husband two drinks, one was on the house!  This little delight is hidden amongst other businesses, so you have to search.  It is well worth the extra effort!

Really good Mexican food.  Love the blackened fish tacos and the blackened chicken salad.  I usually judge Mexican food by their chips and salsa as well and I am always satisfied with both.  My husband and I tried their breakfast this past weekend and we were happy with that as well.  Very nice and friendly staff.  So nice to have good Mexican food that's not overpriced!!!

I heard about this place often from my husband and son because it's a spot close to where they work and they love the food.  So we all went there tonight for dinner and I'm glad I finally got to try it.  I had the salad with blackened chicken and it was just the way I like it - Just a little cheese and beans and lots of really fresh greens, chicken and corn. I wasn't a fan of the vinaigrette dressing, so I was glad that I got it on the side and used some of the salsa that came with the chips instead for dressing, which was good.  The guys' dinners looked great, too.  Would go back for sure!

Poor excuse for good Mexican food. The people cooking the food in the kitchen would never cook that food at home. I have gotten various burritos and other dishes. The meat is always flavorless and the dishes are bland. They need to learn how to use these novel things like SALT & PEPPER

We had the absolute WORST food here today. EVERYTHING was stale and tasted awful. We both got the cheese enchiladas and it tasted like the tortillas were about 2 months old. The rice was hard as a rock and even the soda tasted terrible. CAUTION: STAY AWAY!!!! We totally just threw $20 down the drain!!

I visited Habanero's on a Sunday afternoon with a party of four.   We were surprised how busy they were at that time and that's usually a good sign. Not so much this time though.   What we ordered:  two carne asada burros, one enchillada style.  One bean/cheese burro.  One carne asada taco and one carnitas taco.   1. We weren't really greeted when we came in, but people were waiting at the counter to order so we followed suit.  Turns out that you can also sit and they'll come and take your order.  It was very confusing and we weren't the only ones feeling this way. 2. We awaited over 30 minutes for our food!  That is not acceptable at a place like this.  They weren't THAT busy.   3. Those that say that the carne asada is the best they've had need to get out and try some other places.  It was some of the worst I've had.  There wasn't any real flavor in the meat and it was very tough.  There also was very little meat compared to the amount of other stuff they filled the burro with.   4. The "enchillada style" burro had something red (maybe enchillada sauce, who knows) smeared across the top (spritzed on may be a better term) and a dab of cheese.  Where I come from, enchillada style means it's swimming in sauce and melted cheese.  5. The carnitas taco was very good, but they REALLY skimp on the filling (as another review has also pointed out).   6. The carne asada taco was pathetic.  It was just a little carne asada meat covered in lettuce....and that's it.  No pico or sauce or tomato or avacado.   7. The beans in the bean burro were actually really good and seemed home made.  It could have used a little more salt, but I'm just being picky now.  8. The girls that brought out the food and cleaned up our plates were very friendly and they apologized more than once for the long wait.  They even provided a 15% coupon for next time.  Unfortunately, due to the quality and value of the food I won't be back.

I was on golf vacation and wanted some Latin food. I found this place on Yelp after coming from the golf store. I came around 3. The service was great and the food even better.  I had a small appetizer and 4 tacos. All made fresh to order.

Pros: Great food, Professional staff Cons: Slow service, Expensive drinks  On June 4th, I stopped by Habanero's on the corner of Butherus Dr and Northsight Blvd for some tacos. It was 2:00pm, and hoped I'd missed the lunch crowed. I wasn't expecting many people to be eating during that time. The line at the lunch counter was about five people deep when I walked up and another three people were waiting to pay at the register. I've heard this place could get busy, but this was a little too much of a wait for me.  Other than the wait, my experience at Habanero's Mexican Grill was positive. Again, the staff is friendly and tacos are great! This is the only reason I decided to wait out the line for a table. If you ever find yourself waiting and thinking about going somewhere else. Don't do it, tacos are worth the wait.

Habanero's is by far one of my favorite places to stop for a quick lunch (or dinner!). There is not anything on the menu that you can order that will not be amazing. I don't know how anyone can compare it to Chipolte or Qdoba, because I have never had anyone at either of those place make my food with actual fresh and authentic ingredients. Not to mention getting fresh horchata every time is something you won't find at chain places!

Fast, friendly, no nonsense. Just going to agree with what everyone else is saying; if you want fresh ingredients and solid Mexican staples, this is the place. They've moved into the shopping center nearby and it's a great new spot. They even have horchata and specialty sodas too.  If you want expensive and unique blends of herbs and spices in your tacos, look elsewhere. Here you get your choice of essentials and exactly how you want them. My fiancé and I prefer to go meatless, and they're happy to sub in some extra beans for us; plus you can ask for less of things you don't want.  It's not a family sit-down place, more of a quick lunch or a dinner take-out option. They have plenty of seating available though if you can't wait to dig in.

This place is great!  Guacamole is fresh and tasty, tortillas are warm and soft - they even have horchatas - and its totally affordable.  WAY better (and more authentic) than Baja Fresh and other such chains.  Very friendly service.  Next time I want to try the chiles rellenos.

It is surprising that, notwithstanding our shared border, the majority of our Mexican food options are average or too similar.  Case in point is carnitas.  Many people offer them but few excel.    Carnitas, my friends, is the reason to visit.  The meat is succulent, has great flavor, and is cooked to create a great texture.  Everything is priced to please the lunch crowd.    A very solid operation worthy of Yelp praise.

I wanted to try this the last time I was in town and nobody wanted to go with me :) patience paid off, the food was very yummy! Definitely recommend the blackened chicken taco.  I also had the carne asada taco and it was very good.  The guac was fresh and the margarita was  just what I needed after work. Two of us ate for $21 total.  Great food, great prices, can't wait to go back :)

Unfortunately, Habanero's kind of fell flat for me. As other reviews have stated, this is a build-your-own [blank] kind of Mexican restaurant, offering burritos, tacos, nachos, etc. They had a variety of burrito meat fillings, including two types of beef, two types of pork, and chicken.   I ordered the chicken filling, which is bright orange, and which I hoped indicated spiciness. In actuality, the chicken was incredibly bland, lacking both spice and flavor. Others at my table ordered burritos and burrito bowls with different fillings, like the spicy pork, but the consensus was generally the same: 0 seasoning whatsoever. This seems to extend to the beans and rice, not just the meat.   Honestly, you might as well just go to Chipotle. They may not be authentic or local, but they at least offer more flavorful food.

This place is seriously good.  It's kind of like a really good chipotle grill...but actually authentic!  The food is very fresh and flavorful.  The service (been there twice) was really nice.  The prices and portion size are GREAT.    The only downside, if it is a downside is that the clientele are VERY blue collar.  It is out of my way, but I will go here again and again and again!  Best Mexican in Madison!

This place is the real deal.  Great food, prices are competitive with other places nearby.  If you're not a fan of the ingredients in the burritos then just order it the way you want it, they'll hook it up.  I haven't had a bad meal there yet and I try to make it out to this place for lunch every Friday.  Coke in the glass bottle, soo good.  My favorite item is the Carnitas Platter.  It's on the higher end cost-wise but is definitely worth it.

a prologue: dear yelp, why can't you give a zero-star rating? y u do dis?  i guess it's my fault. i guess i can only blame myself. but i mean, i read the yelp reviews, you know? four whole stars, and the reviews were generally pretty positive. oh, this is like chipotle? word? i love chipotle! but upon pulling into the gigantic and also very empty parking lot, i should have known. i should have known.  against all our better judgment, we walked in the door and they were packing up the ingredients at 8pm. is this place... closed? (no, they supposedly close at 9.) the habanero's employee had a bemused look on her face, like, "humanoids! coming in here! what news do you bring?!" (i mean, she was pleasant, i'll give that to habanero's.)  i got a burrito bowl (see: burrito styrofoam container). the employee spooned room temperature ingredients into my "bowl" (but not salsa, which i asked for and did not receive). i don't have any other word for it but "sad". i saw all these reviews calling the food "really flavorful" and "fresh" and i was so stoked to try this place, but that just wasn't my experience at all. couldn't have been further from that. the "steak beef" was basically non-existent, and all i could taste was white rice, corn, and store-bought guac. if that's what i wanted, i could have made that at home and saved myself the money, you feel me?  because i was hungry, i also ordered some chicken nachos. nachos -- who messes up nachos? even if the rest of the food was questionable, i figured that there was almost no way this could get mucked up. well, that was dumb of me to think that. the employee took a styrofoam container of chips and microwaved it, which, yo: i never asked for carcinogens with my nachos. we got some pico on there, a dollop of guac. we found out upon returning home with our food that there was no cheese on them -- i wasn't aware that you had to ask for cheese for nachos, i thought that was just a thing. even without the cheese as a bonding agent, the chips were soggy and gross and clumped together and just not desirable whatsoever, which no one has ever said about nachos. also, chicken shouldn't be that pink, brah. i'm not even talking like, not-cooked-all-the-way-through pink, because this chicken was quite dry. i mean, it was this weirdly bright, pepto bismol-esque kind of pink. we took two bites and noped out of there.  this place was awful. i have a gutter palate -- i mean, *disgusting* -- and was somehow still extraordinarily let down by this place. i wish so hard that i could have given this joint a zero-star rating. i wish i could say that it would make me feel better if i was reimbursed for the money i pissed away here. but even that doesn't do it for me. i'll never get that meal back. i would highly recommend people who like food and care about food never come here ever.

I was staying downtown for business and was looking for something decent to eat without breaking the bank. This place was perfect. Clean and welcoming, the service was friendly and quick. The food was amazing: chips and fresh guacamole to start and fajitas for two. Super delicious!
Came in during the crazy taco Tuesday lunch hour and was impressed by the service and quality of the food. Great place to come for a Mexican food fixen. :)

I have only been here one time but I am a fan and it was enough to get me to write a yelp review.  I had the chicken taco's and they were excellent.  I ordered three of them and had planned to eat two and bring the other home with me.  I didn't bring the other one home with me because I ate it.  The woman at the counter was very informative and friendly and the food was great.  I prices were the same as any other taco shop in the Phoenix area and the product was superb.
Combo burrito is extremely good. Spicy pork and beef happiness. People are extremely nice and no skimping here. No fake stuff here.

I was worried when I moved to this side of town and thought I was lost to all fast-casual burrito chains. Luckily I found Habanero's! Friendly service and yummy food. Basically a more authentic Qdoba with Tortas.
Great local Mexican food prepared on demand. They have small seating tables up front and a large seating area in the back.
Very Reasonably priced, huge portions, and great food!  Much preferred to the cookie-cutter chain restaurants.  Will return!

You can never have enough fresh tasty Mexican places around.. even in north Scottsdale. Let me tell you, this place is very tasty! Everything is made right there in the open kitchen and if you sit at the bar you can see how fresh it all is.   The Mr and I were hungry so we ordered way to much food. We had no idea that the portions were so large. Started with the Parrillada Tampiquena for 2.. a huge sizzling platter of meaty goodness! Steak, chicken, carnitas and chorizo.. served with tortillas, rice, beans.. well you get the picture.. a mother load of food for 12.99.. this is enough for 2 healthy eaters. Me and the Mr being healthy eaters we continued to over gorge ourselves.. steak quesadilla and a carnitas burrito.. both were large and stuffed with tasty meat!   If you love some thick juicy meat like I do, this place is a perfect fit!!

We were looking for a good Mexican restaurant and saw the reviews on Yelp for this place. The food was great and very reasonable prices. Only reason it got 4 stars is because the service was a little slow and the ordering process was confusing. We will definitely go back for the food.

I would actually give this a 4.5 if that was possible. They have very delicious authentic Mexican food. I love the Carnitas in the Carne asana is pretty good too. Sure some of the other reviews have mentioned the wait which isn't bad but it takes a little while to cook everything well, this is not fast food. I highly recommend habaneros. Please stop by and give them a try. Salsa is good and guacamole is excellent.

I have been coming here for a couple years now.  I actually discovered it on accident, and I am sure glad I did!  I am not a huge fan of Mexican restaurants, probably because non of them taste like this.  This seriously is the best Mexican food I have ever had!!!  Maybe because every order is cooked fresh and no matter what I order every bite has amazing flavor.  The costumer service has ALWAYS been amazing.  Everyone there is so nice.  I've sat down to eat and called in orders for pick up and they never fail in costumer service or the quality of their food.  My mouth is watering right now thinking about how good it is!    My bf and I have had a good majority of the menu, but our favorite is the blackened chicken tacos, blackened fish tacos, lobster tacos, and the absolute best taco that I actually discovered on accident (again),  I called in and ordered the fish tacos but something went wrong with what she asked me and I said yes, then I got home and of course my bf was pissed because they were not what we ordered.  BUT.....what we got were "fried" fish tacos in a "fried" flour shell with yummy tarter sauce, and some other good stuff.  My bf absolutely LOVES these now.  Which I LOVE these as well, but I can't or shouldn't eat "fried" all the time.    Anyway, if you haven't tried this place yet, I seriously suggest you do!!  You won't regret it!

I LOVE this joint!  Great food, amazing family that owns and operates it.  Bonus:  one of the few places that the entire family agrees on. I have tried numerous menu items and have loved every one. This is a small restaurant in a strip mall, but it is one of the best local Mexican restaurants around. Try their takeout some time.  Just as good as eating it there!!!
Good, basic Mexican diner. Great seafood taco selection.
Like a Mexican Subway, you get something and you add the ingredients! Tasty, filling, and inexpensive, if you have to work on that end of town, this would be a tasty place to go!

Was traveling in Phoenix for a convention, and ate here twice. Food and service were amazing! Honestly 1000x better than any of the fancy places downtown that cater to the convention centers. This ended up being the best food I had the entire time I was visiting

It was better than what I was expecting and that's a plus! First off, the map sent me to the wrong area and it took me a bit to find it, but it was worth it. I went on a Saturday night and it was pretty much empty aside from a few people grabbing takeout. It's pretty small and simple in there which I definitely liked!  We got chips and guac to start and it was delicious! The salsas were good as well. The habanero one was a bit too spicy for me but the others were good. I got a vegetarian burrito and was happy to see whole wheat tortillas were an option, so I had that! I was expecting the burrito to be small since it was only $5.50 so I got a side of rice and beans. Totally wasn't necessary, I ended up taking the rice and beans home! Our service was very fast too which was great since I was in a rush. Come here if you want lots of food for low prices. I totally wanted to try a margarita too but had to babysit after, so I will next time!

Ordered two cheese enchiladas, which came with rice and beans. The beans tasted like water, which sucks, because that's the best part. Rice was also very bland and dry. Enchiladas were soggy- just unimpressed with my order. However, my friend loved her burrito, even though it was cut in half, like a wrap instead. Service was exceptional, hence the 3 stars...won't be back though, because of the food.

Cute and cozy restaurant in downtown Phoenix. The waitress was very friendly and told us to pick anywhere we would like to sit. Right away she took our drink orders and just as fast as she took it she brought them out. I love horchata and I had to try theirs it was good and refreshing. She also offered us chips and salsa and if we wanted to guac of course we said yes. When she brought them out she asked if we wanted to try their habanero salsa. How could we say no after all it's on their restaurant name! Holy moly it was spicy but yummy especially if you're a lover of all spicy things. I ordered the flauta plate and was able to do chicken and beef (i can be a bit indecisive). They were both really good, but for sure the beef were tastier. I was also able to choose from refried beans or black beans. I did the refried beans and I can tell they were homemade and not from a can. The rice was s but dry, but I tend to be picky with my rice because I make it at home a lot.   My friends ordered the Chile relleno and i had a taste and found it was quite tasty and not super spicy which is perfect for my liking. I'm not sure what cheese they used but it was delicious.   I want to come back to try some of their other plates and margaritas.
Our new favorite Mexican restaurant!  Food is fresh and delicious, service is very good.  Portion sizes are generous and prices are very reasonable.  We always order the buenos nachos.

Habaneros could be cool because it's Mexican American food seen through the lens of the Midwest, but it's got to fix a lot.  Positive #1: It's cheap I suppose cheapness is important to some people. When I rotate things through my everyday I definitely am concerned about cheapness, but it has to be good first. But if I were really concerned about being cheap I'd probably avoid fast food and do things like farmer's markets...  Positive #2: There are options Being picky is what makes me the discriminating diner that I am. But format isn't as important as, you know, flavor and taste. The difference between taco and burrito is minimal. One is more shareable. The other holds well. Neither is optimal. The burrito rolling technique leaves a lot to be desired.  Negative #1: It's not competitive I feel like the jerk who has to say it, but you have to. This place really can't compare to chain burrito joints. Staff at either popular chain both a) knows more about their product and b) is faster. I can't get excited about your product if you're not excited about your product.  Negative #2: It's not unique If the mechanics behind your chain aren't better than your competition, your product might as well offer something different. I'll stray from something great for something different merely because I'm interested.  Being more Madison or more Wisconsin or even just a little weird and better put together would make this place a lot more interesting.
Pricey, but very good, fast service. Food was fresh and tasted great! Worth going back.
Restaurant was clean, people were friendly. Had cheese enchiladas  and chili rellano delicious,  fresh .Had flan for deserts everything was fantastic, this is a must try place,  we will be back !!!!

I think I had my expectations too high for amazing mind blowing Mexican food. While it was good, it wasn't knock your socks off good.  I started with chips, guac and salsa which is a solid deal at $3.99. It was pretty good, no complaints there, but just like most Mexican food I can get in NJ. I ordered the blackened chicken burrito, the chicken didn't really seam blackened. Overall it was kind of small, while I didn't expect Chipotle size, I expected something just a bit more.  The guy next to me at the small bar ordered tacos and they looked much better, I should have gone that route. Overall it was all A-OK, not bad, but not amazing.  The server was very friendly. This was a decent cheaper spot for lunch.
Great Eats and value! Not a fancy dining environment, but the awesome hot & fresh food overrule that! Try it!
I used YELP to find a Mexican place with a good rating when we were in town. THANKS Yelpers! This place is awesome!!!!  Really cool gun place next door too.

I had the flautas and they were extremely bland and barely had any chicken in them. The chicken needed seasoning. I added salsa on top to give it some kind of flavoring. The margarita was pretty good though. Not my favorite Mexican in Scottsdale/Phoenix. There are much better places to get authentic Mexican.

This place is awesome. It's pretty unassuming, in a strip mall in North Scottsdale and pretty generic even once you get inside, but make no mistake: Habanero's is the real deal. The carnitas, as mentioned before are outstanding, as are the tortillas and salsas.

I was here for lunch the other day and had the blackened chicken combo plate.  It came with rice, black beans and three tortillas.  Everything was fresh and flavorful.  The service was friendly and I'll definitely be back.

Arturo is the owner of of this quiet little restaurant in the middle of a shopping mall right down the street from Costco on Hayden (1 block west of Northsight off Raintree). All his staff/cooks are family. We met Arturo when he was the caterer at a Super Bowl party, and he gave us his card announcing he would be opening up his new restaurant. Others may know him when he was the bartender at Maestro's on Pima.  He is getting a liquor license for the place. Many locals have discovered his gem. This is the way Mexican food should taste. It is authentic, good, and not pricey. Place is not fancy but perfect for this food. We've had them cater one of our parties too. Everyone raved about the food. He knows his stuff. Buenos Nachos with diced bits of carne asada and chunky chorizo is the only thing I order now. Try it and whatever specials they have going on and you'll be hooked too.
Great authentic Mexican food for dine in or take out. We've been here a dozen times. Always on-point, prompt, and delicious.

I am a HUGE fan of this place! So, let's just say this place is not fancy.  It is tacos and burritos and the prices are great.  Honestly, it is hard to find a simple, traditional taco in Madison. This place satisfies all those needs.   The location is strange. It is in a strip mall on Stoughton. Kind of annoying to get to, BUT they are open SEVEN days a week. They are pretty quick and like I said the food is delicious and affordable.

OK, this was my first time at Habanero's today and I went with my co-workers. YUM!! I ordered the fajitas, steak, asked for extra onion and got it. Delicious, not salty like some of them are. came with tortillas, rice, guacamole and sour cream. So good. The place is busy so get there early for lunch. If you pay cash you get free chips and green and hot salsa. I will be back. Sit inside or outside, clean restaurant.

My sister and I are visiting AZ for a girls weekend. We decided on Habaneros because we wanted something local. This place was perfect. We dined on a Friday night. It was busy, but they easily seated the two of us without a wait. We asked the server for her recommendations and ultimately settled on the parrillada for two. It was delicious and so much food for under $20. We also ordered chips and guacamole. The guacamole was so creamy. I also had a margarita. It was big and surprisingly inexpensive. Our server was delightful and gave us the right amount of attention. I wish we lived closer because I would come here often.

Mediocre Mexican food.  The best pinto beans any can opener can offer up.  The Spanish rice is completely flavorless.  Nachos are decent with steak but get soggy entirely too fast with the pinto bean liquid.  Flautas are okay.  Red and green sauces are too mild and habanero sauce is too hot.  No happy medium.

Awesome little Mexican grill with great food at an awesome price with VERY friendly attentive staff!!  Even though it is designed for ordering at the counter and sitting wherever you want the staff made sure to not only bring our food to us but also to check several times to make sure we didn't need anything. Will definitely eat here again!!

Yummy galore!  I go here to share the skillet platter..we get beef and chicken and it's so savory.  The meat is delicious because it just tastes fresh and not all greasy.  Most places rely on grease or lard to make their food taste good (gross) but here it's good as is!  Great pricing too!  The tortillas are yum. The rice is even good!  Just try it.  You'll enjoy the flavor!  Also- the employees are super nice!

Habaneros is a solid, no nonsense taco joint. Quality ingredients and a lot of food for your money.  Despite several visits, I have to admit I've only had tacos, but I've tried most of the meats and other toppings. The spicy onions, I forget the name, are delicious and very spicy.   If you're on the north side and hungry, check it out!
My husband and I love this place! Burritos and tacos are awesome! Our favorites are chicken and the pulled pork! Yummm! Also, the horchata is delicious!
Found this spot and it was well worth it! The carnitas de Jalisco were excellent!!!! They were cooked just right. The flour tortillas are homemade. The service and staff were fast and friendly.

The food was good, but not my favorite in Phoenix so far. It was moderately priced. We had 2 burritos (one chicken and one shrimp) and chips, salsa, and guacamole. The fajita vegetables were a little too undercooked for me in my burrito but the shrimp was really good. The guacamole was delicious.
I only came in for the Orange bang... lol but since I'm a piggy decided to have a couple of tacos. They were delicious! Service is great and they have a full bar! I will definitely be back...

It's like Chipotle, the local version. The spicy pork is great. Food is all a little salty and there isn't a water service that I can see (bottles of water and pop in a case, lemonade and horchata machines). But the food is really cheap (and if you only want one or two tacos, you don't have to get three). They really need to put out some bottles of Chula. No real hot sauce here. Also, they serve beer.

Well, it's no Pedro"s, thankfully.   Went here to check out what the yelpers are talking about.  Got a burrito and a quesadilla.  Right off the bat you can tell that their meat is good just by looking at it.  I started with chicken just to be safe and now I wish I had tried the beef because it looked so darn good. The quesadilla was good but pretty simple.  The burrito was very good with great portions.  Everything was fresh. The outside looks like it's a pretty small place but inside it is pretty big and plenty of space for people to sit down and eat in.  Crummy location though. Will be back for some tacos and the tortas look fantastic.   Open kitchen so you can watch them cook your meal.  I like that.

From the fresh chips and superb guacamole to my large chicken fajita burrito and my wife's blackened chicken and mahi mahi tacos, we could not ask for a better, more affordable meal. We will definitely be returning and judging by the greetings other customers received, we will be just one of many, many return visitors.
I go here at least once a week.  Burrito bowl with steak is delicious!!  Fast and great prices.

So where can I find a taco in Madison that I can be proud to say is amazing....Habanero's! So to get started---a little hard to find. I have been driving past the location every day to and from work never noticing it next to the Pool/Spa store on Stoughton Rd. Silly me.  I finally took the chance after seeing the great neon lights in the window and stopped in.  You first order at the counter, and they have their operation set up like a "build as you go".  The choices are limited, but all the essentials (Taco, burrito, torta, or quesadilla). I suggest either the steak or chicken but you can also get barbacoa or carnitas. The tacos (if orders in corn) come in 2 shells each taco ordered.  After ordering then you and sent around the corner and you get to pick what you want on them.  Pico, corn, sour cream, great Mexican cheese, lettuce, guacamole, and a fine selection of salsas.  It's quick & convenient with ample seating.  Also, a fine selection of drinks and beers. What is not to love!  I recently went against my current taco order and had a burrito....huge! It was also a great choice.  If you order the extra meat for $2, you will be very happy. They pile it on, no matter what meat you decide to select.  Heck yes! Great pricing too.  3 tacos-$5.99 1 Burrito-$5.99 (cheaper and better than the other chain "build as you order" burrito joints)

Tasty food, very affordable. Only downside are the plastic plates that are warped. Blackened shrimp taco was great, tho overpriced compared to other items on menu. Chicken chimichanga style was also pretty good. Overall 3/5.  Will be going back again soon.
Out of towners, used Yelp and we were very happy! We'll definitely have to come back when we visit the area again. Yummy burritos!
Excellent lunch - blackened shrimp tacos - chips and salsa. Easy counter service made for quick in and out lunch.
Excellent and authentic Mexican food. Please ask for Norma. She provided the best service and loves her job.

Chunky fresh guacamole, great chips and for my first time, calamari tacos.  I also tried the blackened mahi- mahi fish tacos.  This is a fast food type of environment however each meal is prepared to order.  Fish was freshly grilled, guac was very fresh with large chunks of avocado and calamari tasted freshly fried.    For a drink I recommend trying the horchata which although it was from a fountain, tasted delicious.  If Yelp offered a 3.5 star I would have gone that way as although the offerings were a bit more unusual than most Mexican fast food places, it was just alright.  I round up to 4 for the effort in freshness and creative menu.

Food is super delicious here! The spicey pork tacos with extra hot sauce are my favorite!  Service is extremely fast and the workers are friendly.  I only gave this place a 4 instead of 5 stars because I think the place could be cleaner and updated.  Some of the decor look run down and look like DIY projects.

Hidden gem this side of the border.  Lunch is very yummy. We've eaten here several times and never disappointed. They are open for breakfast, lunch & dinner. Breakfast burritos are wonderful. I recommend the chorizo burrito, although all are delicious. The entire menu is wonderful and their homemade salsas compliment the fare.  The owner is super cool and always makes people feel right at home!

You've got to check this place out!  Have the Parradilla, grilled steak, chicken and carnitas mixed with onions, potatoes and chorizo!  Your choice of tortillas and rice, beans, guac and sour cream... All just $12.99!  Friendly, happy people, great experience!
Went there for breakfast, food was decent however, waited more than 30 minutes to receive our order with no apology or explanation. Not happy with service we received.

My husband discovered this place when he used to work on the east side (we live on the west side). He would come home all the time telling me about this amazing place he'd grab lunch sometimes, and I'd be all sorts of jealous because I love delicious food.  So one day he finally took me and WOW, he was right!   The building is nothing special - it's located in an industrial area and I would never have found it myself. Pretty dive-ish. Food is served in styrofoam containers. It's basically like Qdoba or Chipotle, but more authentic and more delicious. Price is cheap, you get a good amount of food, and have I mentioned yet that it's delicious?  They opened another Habanero's on the north side.... please open one on the west side!!! We don't get over to the east or the north very much. Hubby still ends up on the east side sometimes for work and always makes sure to snag a meal there, the lucky guy.

We live right next door to this place so we've been a few times now and it has always been on point.  I don't know what they put on their chicken but it is SO good.  It comes out really juicy, tender and full of flavor regardless of what chicken dish you order.  I haven't tried the carne asada yet but I imagine it is just as good. I also really enjoy their skinny margarita (not as sweet as the regular depending on your preference).  Their chips and salsa are also great and the staff have been really welcoming and helpful to us.  I also really like how they added an out door patio.
