With how nice the weather is right now I'm sure it will get a lot of use. I look forward to keeping this as one of our regular go-to places!
We were craving tacos and this place did not disappoint. Great authentic flavor. We will make this a regular stop.

Low Rent Mexican Food shop sitting in Scottsdale. It was my first time here and they were very helpful with my menu choice. I tried the habanero salsa and it was screaming hot, had to mix it with the "mild" stuff!!!!  Loved the 4 different kinds of colored chips. Took too long to prepare lunch on a slow day. Very small place. PRICEY!!! I couldn't keep my plate from spinning making it difficult to cut my food. Beef was a bit chewy. Tortillas were thick & dried out hard before I finished eating. Chips & salsa cost extra!!! They don't mention you get chips on your plate already. (Hidden expense) And they want a TIP too????!!!!
Blackened fish & blackened shrimp tacos almost as great as their black beans and habanero salsa. Parrillada combo was amazing. Shrimp was spot-on.

Found this restaurant on Yelp when we needed to get something without getting too far off our route. This was a great find! Our very busy hostess/waitress was doing everything but cook the food with a quick step and a smile. She was a joy to watch! Even my two children recognized how good she was. The food was delicious too. We were very glad we chose this place!

Went in with a buddy.  I ordered three different kinds of tacos, Carne Asada, Carnitas, and Shrimp; and some chips and salsa.   The tacos were good, but I especially liked the Shrimp one.  When we came in, we thought we had to order at the counter, so we were rather rushed....didn't get a good chance to look at the options.  After we sat down, we noticed some new people coming in and getting a menu.  I would have liked to have done that so I could have picked something else out.

LOVE LOVE LOVE....my mom and i cleaned up three taco plates, shrimp, carnitas and lobster, plus blackened chicken nachos and chips and guac all for about $30.    Love supporting local family run and owned shops and this is no excpetion, the owner/chef came out to see how our food was and a discussion ensued.  who doesn't love duiscussing good food with another foodie/chef?   Can't wait to go back for the shrimp tacos and anything Carnitas!  MUST TRY yelpers!!!
Came in with my staff and we all really enjoyed the food. I ate the enchilada plate with beef and cheese. The beans and rice were also very good margarita was also very tasty. Very relaxed place.

Habanero's is a fast casual restaurant that offers Mexican food for a $1 less than Chipotle. Interested? Read on.  I forgot to take a picture of the menu, so I'll explain it right here: You can pick between burrito, burrito bowl, quesadilla, tacos, salads, tortas, or nachos. They have five different meat options: steak beef (carne asada), shredded beef (barbacoa), spicy pork (al pastor), pull pork (carnitas), and chicken (I don't know a spanish term for this preparation of chicken). They also had $2 tamales that were not on the menu last time I was there, so ask about that if you want one.  I've had a burrito and a taco order there before. Personally, I prefer the tacos because you can get a different meat in each of your three tacos, and they don't skimp either.  Overall, I'm a fan of Habanero's. I find that their meats taste better than Chipotle's meats even if it's been in the warmer for a while. Their salsas aren't as good as Chipotle's, but look at that variety in menu options! Plus, their tacos are jam packed. I'll be back the next time I want some quick tacos.

Directed to this place by Yelp reviews. Cute casual atmosphere with good menu. Good service even though there was only one server covering the restaurant and bar. My husband and I are vegetarians so my expectations were moderated by reviews of a place touting carne asada and lobster quesadillas. I had a veggie burrito and guacamole which were very good. The salsa was average and my pet peeve is water served in styrofoam cups which doesn't degrade in landfills. If you're washing plates, you can wash water glasses. Overall, I'd recommend.
Great fast food mexican restaurant. Since there aren't any Filiberto's out this way, this is definitely the next best choice if you live nearby.
I had a carnitas burrito. Excellent. Great salsa"s, nice walk up service counter with pleasant and helpful young lady! Check out the nacho"s

I was so hungry for lunch and I wanted Mexican food that was quick and easy so I found this place nearby. It took some time to figure out how to get here because the airpark was in the way but when I finally arrived, I found that the restaurant was in a shopping plaza with tons of parking. I parked and waited in line. I ordered a lobster and blackened shrimp taco on corn tortilla with a side of rice. My order came to $8.  I decided to just devour my food there and so I sat down and waited. The employees are really friendly. They came by and asked if I was ok, they gave me salsa and when I was done, they thanked me for coming it. It was refreshing because lately, the service in the restaurants I've been dining at lately haven't been great.   Let's get to the food - it was pretty delicious! I wish there was a little bit more meat but tasty nonetheless. I practically didn't leave much on my plate and for less than $10, definitely worth it!!! I'll be a returning customer for sure!

Another awesome Mexican restaurant within a couple of miles of our house....this place is pretty awesome.  I don't know why it took me so long to try it out....perhaps because it's kind of tucked away out of sight in a shopping mall that doesn't generally get a lot of traffic...?  I don't know....but one thing I do know is that it's no on my radar and I will be back many times.  Here's my Son and I had on our first visit:  Carnitas de Jalisco, $9.99 http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/habaneros-mexican-grill-scottsdale?select=hs9izE2KQH42bIhX2k2tPw#hs9izE2KQH42bIhX2k2tPw http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/habaneros-mexican-grill-scottsdale?select=873KJQLaeB5FKuPMB3jC8Q#873KJQLaeB5FKuPMB3jC8Q http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/habaneros-mexican-grill-scottsdale?select=yewf-V6M-eviSlnMFN_klg#yewf-V6M-eviSlnMFN_klg  Buenos Nachos w/Ground Beef, $6.50 http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/habaneros-mexican-grill-scottsdale?select=ZLUrrPL1RDSqhkQvkzRmtw#ZLUrrPL1RDSqhkQvkzRmtw http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/habaneros-mexican-grill-scottsdale?select=yi__pt7IXqW10j9yHcOFPA#yi__pt7IXqW10j9yHcOFPA http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/habaneros-mexican-grill-scottsdale?select=aOWIlXAmRLOPY72He5rTfw#aOWIlXAmRLOPY72He5rTfw  Carne Asada Taco, $2.50 http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/habaneros-mexican-grill-scottsdale?select=8LpgSd1OL903W82t13JOrQ#8LpgSd1OL903W82t13JOrQ http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/habaneros-mexican-grill-scottsdale?select=u38XVbgVvK3uG9jgrPQjdA#u38XVbgVvK3uG9jgrPQjdA  My Son ordered the Carnitas and I asked him for a few bites so I could sample the plate...it was very good, nice flavor.  Beans and Rice complimented it well.  I had the Nachos and the Carne Asada Taco.  The Nachos were awesome....the did a great job with this dish.  It's Spicy and has a ton of flavor....portion size is big too.  They serve it on a Pizza dish....I think that's the trend now as this is at least the 2nd or 3rd place I've seen Nachos served on a Pizza dish.  Before moving to the Scottsdale area, I'd never seen that.  Back to the food....  The Carne Asada Taco was OK...it was the only dish that disappointed.  They do something different here with it....they add Lettuce....a lot of Lettuce....too much Lettuce (see pics above).  I think the Lettuce overwhelmed the flavor of the Taco....if I order this again, I will either order it without the Lettuce or take it off before I eat it.  The service here is good too.  We asked for very Spicy Salsa instead of the normal one they give you with your dish and they came back with a Habanero based Salsa....it had a serious kick to it.  It was nice to have that option.  Return Factor - 92%

It's easy to understand why there is a constant line out the door here at lunch time. It is a hole in the wall and you would never know such good food was served in these four walls! Came here with my husband and ordered the Parillada for 2, (I didn't notice until later that I could have added shrimp for a few dollars more). I got lucky and scored a table and our food came to the table soon after. The food was a substantial serving, had steak, chicken, pork, chorizo, and veggies. Our sides were beans and rice with tortillas, sour cream, and guacamole. I'm glad we didn't get chips and salsa or guacamole because this one meal stuffed us.  This place put a smile on my face, we will be back! I hear they cater, too.

My wife and I love Habeneros.  I think we were the first customers at this location.  We've been through a lot since then-  the birth of our first born, scores of tacos, burritos and yes even tamales.  We use them for catering and the obligatory late night taco run.    If you haven't yet, you should.  If you already have- you should some more.   God bless.

Food is good and well priced, it always hits the spot when I have a taco craving, but this is now the third time that I've gone and every time people are just not that nice. They are kind of dismissive and I never feel like I want to stay and eat my food. It could just be my experience; maybe they are nicer to other people they see more regularly, but that isn't necessarily an excuse. I'll probably still come here every once in a while, but I want management to see this and hopefully work on being a little more welcoming and helpful.
The best chorizo breakfast burrito around. Excellent carnitas.  For quick and reasonable freshly made Mexican food, this is the best spot in scottsdale.  And the staff---top notch!
Thank you yelp for finding an excellent Mexican restaurant!  Great food cooked to order. Will definitely be back.
Disappointment all around.  Staff rude, food bland, salsa tastes like tomato water.  Only neat thing here is the mexican drinks on tap.  Extremely disappointing.

I guess I just don't care for "Mexican" in this manner, from the chain versions like Chipotle and and Qdoba to local versions like Habanero's and Mr. Torta's.  Love the concept because I'm a fan of the order at the counter type of restaurant but this type of food just doesn't seem to do it for me.  For the name, Habanero's food was pretty bland.  I guess I should have known ordering the chicken.  Hubby got a mix of pull pork and spicy pork.  He said the spicy pork was better -- I'm sure I would agreed.  We both got the 3 tacos and thought the portion was generous.  Also the guacamole seemed real so I was fine with the $1 up charge for it.  Prices overall were reasonable.  The guys who put together our lunches seemed real nice and I do want to support what I think is a local business but I don't see us rushing back since as much as I try, this type of food just isn't my thing.

I cannot believe we just found this place!  My only complaint is that we live right up the street and haven't been there before this.  Absolutely wonderful Mexican food and a superb staff with great prices.  Go there today!!!

Casual, counter service restaurant serving a nice variety of Mexican food such as fajitas, carnitas, carne asada, flautas, tacos, burritos, taco salads, and parrillada that pleases a crowd. They have some unique tacos like carnitas, mahi mahi, blackened shrimp, blackened chicken, calamari, and lobster that you usually don't find at most Mexican restaurants.   Ordered the carnitas de Jalisco that came with pico de gallo, guacamole, rice, beans, and tortillas. The carnitas were a good portion and delicious...tender, flavorful, and moist but not too rich. I don't mind that the carnitas has some fat in it but wish some of the large chucks of fat were cut out and not served. Overall, these were the best carnitas I've had in awhile. Would definitely come back to try some of the unique tacos and parrillada or have the carnitas again!
We stopped her on our way to Sedona from Tucson.  Great food and service!  I placed my order and went outside to walk my dogs, when my order was ready they found us outside.

One of the comments said its similar to Subway. Pick your platform (3 tacos, burrito, or quesadilla) and choose your meat. After that you add your condiments. They are quick and most people are in and out. It isn't like a traditional restaurant with waiters etc. The goal is for you to get your food and be out as quickly as possible. There are waves of people that come and go, it's that fast. We came during the evening, but I imagine this place is packed during lunch.   I had three steak tacos. Prices were good, food was good, and it was super fast. I'll come back to eat here again.

First, I should say I am from out of town (east coast) and have only been to this restaurant once. However, I have been to other Mexican restaurants in the Phoenix area and at my home. The food here is very good.  The sauces and guacamole are spiced with care. Watch out for their special sauce-one taste will bring tears to your eyes! My husband had fajitas and I had taco salad with blackened fish. This is a very casual place, but on my visit I felt like the staff worked hard to present quality fresh food.

Very very very good. We went for late lunch/dinner. It was about 14 of us and a variety of foods, EVERYONE, loved their food, even the kids cleaned their plates. The wait staff was excellent. Great prices, you definitely get a bang for your buck. Start off with the chips guac, and salsa. I could hardly finish my tacos (blacken chicken/shrimp). You must add the rice and beans. Oh and don't forget the churros Anytime I'm in the area I'm coming back.

Dear Habanero's ,  I love you !! This place has got to be one of the better Mexican food places I've found since moving here from Cali. Everyone who works here is always friendly and the food always comes out fast. I love the blackened chicken burrito and the blackened chicken nachos. Everything I have tried on their menu so far has been pretty damn good.

Spotted this place while heading down 7th and had to stop(craving taco's). Upon entering I was happy to see it wasn't a dirty tacqueria but a grand looking restaurant with a club like bar in one corner and a full view of the kitchen dominating the rest of the space behind the counter.  While marveling at their expansive menu I couldn't make up my mind as to what to have; The man behind the counter must of have read my mind for he mentioned that they serve breakfast all day! I had to get myself one of their breakfast burritos with bacon and steak which also came with potatoes, scrambled eggs and cheese. Now to say this breakfast burrito was great is an understatement for it was one of the most clean tasting breakfast burritos I've ever had; it wasn't dripping grease through the toasted tortilla and smelled amazing.  I'm excited for family and friends to come in from out of town just so that I may have the opportunity to share this place with them. It is a real treat in this city which is no small feat for a Mexican food restaurant in Phoenix.

I looked up top Mexican restaurants in Madison and this placed popped up. I read all the reviews and I'm the same as the rest. I've driven by this place before, but never thought to stop by. I regret my life choices. Every time I've settled for east side Pedro's. Every time I've settled for Taco Bell. Every time I've decided to try some new Mexican place. I regret every single time. This place is AMAZING. Since finding it three or so months ago, I've gone at least a dozen times. Their ingredients are just so fresh and delicious. I've never had better Mexican food.  Funniest thing, they don't really speak English well. The first two times my boyfriend and I went they thought we wanted the spicy, pickled onions. We were kind of annoyed, but didn't want to cause a fuss. The first two times we had it we hated it. Now we've grown to love it and neither of us will get the pork burrito without it.
Black beans are vegetarian. Other beans aren't. Limited vegetarian menu!

Oh my goodness!!! This place was amaaaaazing! I had the mahi mahi bowl with rice and every bite was so good. I wish I could pack this place up and take it home with me. My friends had the fajitas and the nachos and said they were the best they've had!!' We flew in from queen creek based on the reviews and would fly in again I'm a heart beat!
Amazing service. Margaritas are on point. Lobster tacos are worth returning for. Love this joint!

Habaneros is an awesome little gem stuck in the strip mall hell known as Scottsdale.  If you are one looking for an original meal at a decent price, try out Habaneros.   I am addicted to their chipotle sauce.  You can find it in almost every item there.  Try out the Shrimp or Fish tacos, they are delicious.  Sometimes the food takes a little while to cook (and there could be a line).  So be prepared if you are going there on your lunch break.  The salsa is not as spicy as I would like, but I am splitting hairs at this point.  Go try Habaneros, you wont be disappointed.  Its a nice change from every unoriginal, corporate restaurant you find in Scottsdale.
Our favorite Mexican place hands down. Fresh ingredients and atmosphere is very friendly.  Might eat here too much, but that sounds okay if I don't have to cook.

Its my new favorite spot! Cute, small atmosphere! I ordered the carne asada tacos and blackened chicken tacos, both with corn tortillas.  The carne asada taco had a little too much lettuce, but the steak was flavorful! The blackened chicken tacos were so good, it was like a explosion in my mouth! I think the next time I come here I would definitely get the chicken tacos with flour tortillas! I would definitely recommend this place to my friends!

Came here on a slow Sunday morning, starving and (I admit) slightly waning from hunger. The food was pleasing - fresh, blackened shrimp wrapped in a tortilla with rice, onions, peppers and a creamy sauce. The service, however, was slightly sub par. Our cashier, though polite, enough charged us several dollars more than what we figured (I guess their soft drinks must be in the $3 to $4 range - the menu did not say).   On a positive note, my partner's carne asada burrito came with a heaping amount of guacamole. Also glad to see a non-chain restaurant with personality that serves alcoholic beverages in the Northsight area.  Salud!
Our new favorite "go to" fresh Mexican restaurant. Love the seafood anything and love the seafood Mexican salads.

I really like this place!! Small, family owned and operated, with very nice people and excellent food.  We've gone for breakfast, lunch and dinner. I usually get Kayla's favorite for breakfast, stacked chicken enchiladas with eggs, cheese and salsa on top. On Friday's they usually have fresh lobster and fish, their lobster enchiladas are excellent. I also like the calamari and shrimp tacos, their calamari could be the best in town. And I like their flan, it is large enough for two people to share. My only complaint is that they charge for chips and salsa, but that isn't enough to take away a star.

One of my favorite lunch places. I've tried just about every type of tacos and all are great. The pork varieties + chicken are my favorite. LOVE the cilantro and limes. Ask for the salsa on the side if you do not want watery tacos.

They serve beer (actually a full bar now)!!!   This time I got a crunchy carnitas taco and a blackened chicken taco, SO good!  The carnitas is very flavourful, tender and the blackened chicken has a little spice. When we were leaving we saw a couples order; Carne Asada and Chorizo nachos, they looked phenomenal and they said they get them all the time!!!  ¡HAPPY HOUR! $2 Mexican Cervezas and $3.99 Margaritas 3 pm - 7 pm Monday through Friday  http://habaneros.mx/

We had just moved into our new place and wanted to grab a bite. Saw it had great reviews and was literally minutes away.   As soon as you come in you see a menu board on the wall. You can choose between a burrito/bowl, quesadilla, rice, salad, torta, or nachos. Then you pick your choice of meat: steak beef, shredded beef, spicy pork, pulled pork, or chicken.   They have a lot of toppings for anything you choose to go with...I ended up getting a bowl with steak beef. The guac was great. I had enough for leftovers for dinner later.   They have jarritos!!! Also they have margaritas for $2 and beer! Lots of drink choices in general. I just went for a fountain drink. This place smells soooo good when you walk in.   It was hot today and didn't seem like the AC was on but then again, it might have been the heat from the grill and the fact that we just moved a whole bunch of stuff.   I'm definitely going to be a regular because it was worth it. I wish I could've tried their chips with the guac or salsa. :)

It was okay. My husband got the cheese enchiladas and was not impressed. 5 out of 10 on those. Chips...average. kind of stale and the slasa was watery. I got the shrimp fajitas with wheat tortillas. They were good. Not fantastic. They had a watery sauce it sat in. Normally fajitas I've ordered have kind of a dry rub on them not swimming in watery sauce. The service was EXCELLENT the young lady that helped us was super sweet. I don't know if I would drive all the way up here to try again. But based on other reviews, maybe our mistake was getting our usuals when we should have ordered what others here have recommended.
Fresh guacamole smothered on juicy carne asada wrapped in a wheat tortilla.  Awesome!

So, so, so glad that this one popped up on our Yelp radar while in town for vacation. The area right around our hotel doesn't have a lot of readily available dining options. But Habanero's is just 10 or so minutes to the north.  I went with the tacos, with barbacoa, and they were absolutely fantastic. The homemade corn tortillas, wow. Paired it up with some horchata for a delicious dinner. Very friendly service. We don't often eat in the same place twice while on vacation (for variety's sake), but may have to make an exception here!

My coworkers & I often come here for lunch and we love it! I recommend the carne asada tacos with a side of guac, YUM. Maria & Abel are absolutely wonderful and their service is always prompt and attentive :)

Actually I'm giving them a 3.75 for a rating. I've only ate here once while in Madison. I had a steak burrito. It was good tasting, some what large, and at a reasonable price. They have a big selection of ingredients that you can put in your burrito or taco. It's not a San Diego area burrito, but not bad.

Some friends took us out for dinner on Friday night, as we planned an upcoming vacation to Mexico.    As others have said, don't let the mini-mall appearance/location stop you from going in.  Great food - I had Chili Rellanos and they were unbelievable- truly authentic.  Maybe the best part was desert - Sopapilla's were so tasty and my husband, who is a chef, said it was one of the most perfect flans he had tasted in years - creamy, no bubbles, and just great.  Service is friendly, and might be alittle slow when they are busy, but the friendliness and food make up for it.  And they are so helpful - such as gettting extra sauces, and explaining them.  We will be back.  It is also good to know they are open for breakfast.
Ugh, no redeeming value. Cold enchiladas, cheap tequila, under cooked Chili rellenos. Skip it

The Scottsdale location has much better service than the downtown location same great food but Service downtown was lacking because the servers boyfriend was in attendance and gave him a lot more attention than customers

Giving Habanero's a solid 3 stars because although I do enjoy the food (great fish tacos), the service is incredibly slow. Most of the time when I go there, I have to plan ahead a 20-25 minute wait (at least) for food to arrive, even if the restaurant isn't that busy in the first place. It's frustrating and time-consuming, but tasty.
Wow really really bomb taqueria!!!! I had the asada burrito and it was legit! Had a couple drinks and they were perfect! Definitely recommend this place!!!
My plain tacos took a looooong time and came with all the fixins'.  After I got what I wanted it wasn't bad ...
Best carne asade burrito ive ever had! They cook the steak for your burrittos right in front of you! Everythig is fresh! They dont even have a freezer. Ill mever go to chipotle again

I live very close to Warner Park in bad need of a burrito and couldn't be bothered to drive to Qdobas. A quick walk to the new Habanero restaurant later and I found a similar set up to Qdobas and Chipotles. The menu had a good number of choices but I ultimately chose a steak burrito. It was very satisfying and there were lots of toppings to put in, although the slightest bit watery. Will be back to try their other entrees.
Awesome food!  Friendly staff!  All around great place to eat. Highly recommend the burritos.

Visiting from Los Angeles and was surprised at the quality of the food. I had a shrimp plate as well as some of their fish tacos. Place was a little hard to find (due to location) but was worth it when i did find it. Would come back anytime im in the Scottsdale area

Unbelievable food!  The Mahi Mahi and carnitas tacos were absolutely delicious! The chile rellanos were amazing and the lobster enchiladas were out of this world!  And the premium margaritas are wonderful!  Great food and great service - thank you Maria!!

This place is really cute. The food is awesome and the service is WONDERFUL. we were seated outside today because the place was packed, but it was really cold. As soon as an inside table opened up, the owner came and got us and moved us inside so we were warm. So sweet.
Soooo good. I loved my enchiladas! The salsa and Orange Bang are can't misses!

We waited for about 30 minutes, figured eh this will be some darn good Mexican food like my great grandma used to make! It was no big deal since we didn't have plans. Good thing I wasn't starving otherwise I'd have a conniption lol. We had our food to-go, we live literally 3 minutes away and when we got home to eat, our food was pretty cold, we had to heat it up....I feel like because we waited so long the food should've been pretty hot or even warm but it just wasn't...McDonald's fries are fresher than our food was. The food itself was pretty good, not great. Not worth waiting that long for. It was cold and for how long we waited. No Bueno. I'll have to give this place another chance.

Considering this place is in Scottsdale, the food and prices are really good for Mexican food. I'm still on a search for good Mexican food here an this place does a pretty decent job.  We decided to try the Parrillada which is similar to the concept of fajitas but so much better. The price is dependent on how many people order it. 1 person is 10.99 and 2 people is $14.99.  Basically you get a combination of carnitas, chorizo, chicken, beef and potatoes on a warming dish.  There is the option to add shrimp for a few dollars more but we didn't get that. The meats are not mixed together but rather side by side. Each person then gets their own plate of beans, rice, sour cream and guacamole. The guacamole is freshly made and they give you a really good portion.  Even the beans seemed homemade too. It also come with tortillas - flour, corn or wheat. Wow, wheat?!  I didn't really like them but hey, it's great to know you have the option.  For the price and amount, it's a good meal for two people.  They make their own salsa according to the waitress. We got a side with chips and it ended up being a green and red one.  Both pretty decent but they were a bit too thin for me. I like mine with substance and chunky.   For drinks, they have self serve orange bang, pineapple whip, horchata, Jamaica. Yum!!! It's not too often you see that.    The place has great service too. The staff are all friendly.

Went here after reading the Yelp reviews and after visiting the Scottsdale Gun Club.  Best Tex-Mex atyle restaurant in Scottsdale,  hands down.   Nice family run place, not a chain. Good prices too. Trying to talk my wife into going back two days in a row! Yum.

no delicaies such as hutlacoche buche lengua or sesos but instead you get   great Jalisco style Mexican Food great soft or crispy tacos great burritos and a great parrillada (grilled meats dish)    The seasoning is just right and the meats are not over salted. (Chipotle's, I'm looking at you!) Usual selection of aguas frescas. Negra Modelo on tap! Great Michilada!  CLEAN! Safe neighborhood. NOT in a dodgy part of town! Our female server was very friendly and often checked on us without being obtrusive. No mexican polka music when I visited. Nice romantic bolero ranchero music playing (not blaring) in the background You can hold a conversation and not have the whole restaurant listening to your conversation. Great for families & dates, breakfast lunch and dinner.  I've tried it all when it comes to Mexican food. From late night street vendors in East LA to the streets of Mexico City. This is great mexican food and very convenient for the North Scottsdale crowds.

I think Habanero's has another location off Stoughton. This location is the same setup as the other one. First, you decide if you want tacos, a burrito, a burrito bowl, or a salad. Then, you choose your meat. There's barbacoa, carnitas (slow-cooked pulled pork, not the fried pork), adobo steak, adobo chicken, al pastor, or veggie. Then, there are a bunch of things you can add, like pico de gallo, sour cream, 3 different salsas, beans, cheese, etc.   I would recommend you get the 3 taco deal with the carnitas or the chile pork Mexico city style (cilantro, onions, and lime). It is a little piece of heaven and reminds me of home (Texas). It's all pretty cheap (about $6); does not come with sides like beans and rice. They also have horchata and Jarritos (Mexican soda).

One of the selling points for Mexican food is that it is cheap and flavorful. Habanero's was only one of these. From a place named after one of the spicier peppers, one would expect more heat and flavor, but both were lacking.   I ordered a burrito and filled it with chile pork (I think that's what they said it was. I just pointed.), rice, black beans, bell peppers and onions, cilantro, onion, corn salsa, pico, cheese, and those spicy onions (note: the onions were mildly spicy at best). I also got some of their horchata, which was a little on the watery side for me. Things to note: the rice is just plain white rice, no spanish or cilantro rice here. Also, if you are looking for spice you probably want to try the hot or extra hot salsa. The one marked as "medium" did not have a bite at all.   As others have said, the ordering process is Chipotle style: you choose what style of plate you want - burrito, tacos, tortas, quesadilla, etc. Then you pick your meat and toppings. The guys behind the counter were really friendly and nice, and I would give the service 5 stars. But the food is a 3.5: just A-OK. I would be open to going back and trying something else.  Habanero's is located on the end of a row of stores that sell things like flooring. Pretty easy to miss if you're not looking for it.

I love this place and have been coming here since they opened.  Never had a bad meal and the owners treat you like family.  Highly recommended for those who enjoy good Mexican food!!  I get the carnitas and black bean burrito and it has never failed!

Just to be clear, this would have been a 5-star rating if based only on the food and not the restaurant itself. I think it's important to make that differentiation because Habaneros food is excellent! I would highly recommend their tacos or burritos.   That being said, I would encourage you to get your food TO GO! This place is disgusting inside. After Rocky Rococos closed, they made an attempt to "revitalize" the space by adding more color. Unfortunately the paint that was added to the walls was also added to the floor. In addition to the paint, the floors are filthy. Saw dust from construction (months ago). Dirt and Grime from where booths use to be. Holes in several walls and temporary electrical (extension chords) taped to the ceiling to run lights, etc.   It is clear that management rushed opening this location. They brought their excellent food, but fell way short in providing a nice place to eat it. I've been here several times and there doesn't seem to be any interest in changing the ambiance any time soon.

This place is tasty. They have amazing salsa and the habanero salsa will knock you out! Boom! It's spicy! The meals here are simple and don't have an overwhelming amount of contents. Food is good and the service is great.
Awesome burritos, tacos, etc. Guacamole is plentiful and tasty.
Awesome!   Great fresh food, cheap, friendly staff.  The pickled onions with habanero's will make your eyes water in the best possible way.
The place was empty. But the service was fast and the food was great. I ordered a quesadilla with steak beef and the prices are great as well.

5/31/13  Finally stopped in for my first time visit to order takeout.  Since it was my first time, I wanted to check out the menu board overhead, but staring up at menu boards while people are waiting to take my order has never been my cup o' tea, so I looked around for a leaflet to peruse through, instead.  I liked the open layout of the grill and kitchen, as i was able to see the cooks in action.  I read under "Habanero Specialties" a listing for Chiles rellenos, a roasted poblano chile stuffed with jack cheese combo (rice, choice of beans-refried or black, choice of tortillas (corn, wheat, or flour) and pico de gallo for $9, and I'm a cheese-lover, so I had to try this. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/habaneros-mexican-grill-scottsdale?select=GtRJBN7OK6Vhu6x-zgZgrA#GtRJBN7OK6Vhu6x-zgZgrA  Looking around for a meaty meal, I saw under "Parrillada," that I could get a four-meat combo http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/habaneros-mexican-grill-scottsdale?select=GtRJBN7OK6Vhu6x-zgZgrA#vd5i45jyypKwClT1WigsnQ (grilled steak and chicken, chorizo, and carnitas, with rice, choice of beans, choice of tortilla, guacamole, and sour cream for one person, $11, but I also noticed that diners could add shrimp to their meals, so I wondered if the red meats were grilled alongside the shrimp (I'm allergic to shellfish), or perhaps there is a designated area where shrimp are partitioned away from the other meats, and looking past the order-taker's shoulder, I could see that shrimp are indeed cooked on the same grill with the meats.  I told the order-taker that I would like to try some of their barbecue, but I can't if the meats are cooked in the same area as the shrimp, since I have a shrimp allergy, and she fired off a few sentences in Spanish to the cook, who replied with a few sentences of his own, after which she turned to me and said that my meats would be prepared in a separate pan.  Sweet!!  While my orders were cooking, I surveyed the place and observed that while the resto is small, it didn't FEEL small, because of all the flourishes that gave the place a bigger presence (wooden furnishings and counters, a mini-bar with a handful of Mexican beer pumps, a small fridge stocked with bottles of Mexican beer if you don't want to order drafts, a counter in front of the grills where you may dine, or sit and sip on a pint of beer while you wait for your takeout (which is what one guy did while I paid for my order and waited it out on one of the dining tables).  There's even patio seating, should you choose to dine alfresco, or if you don't want to leave the restaurant smelling like you spent all day cooking in the kitchen!  Both dishes were muy delicioso!  Since I had two entrees, I decided to try both bean choices (refried and black), as well as two tortilla choices (wheat and flour), and they were all very good!  The black beans were soft and tender- I was expecting something like biting into boiled lima or kidney beans, but the black beans were softer, more akin to firm, spring peas (not mushy!).  I also appreciated that both bean choices weren't very salty and tasted freshly-prepared and sprinkled with cotija cheese, not from cans and doctored over the stove.  The chile relleno batter tasted decidedly eggy, which I did not mind, but if you don't like your foods eggy, then you might want to stay away from this dish.  I usually try to avoid tomatoes (inflammatory), but the pico de gallo smelled so bright and flavorful that I couldn't resist, and I'm glad I didn't, for it complemented the cheesy relleno perfectly!  As for the barbecue meats, I liked them all, even the spicy chorizo!  I'd say the grilled steak was my fave, followed by the diabolical chorizo, which also came with similarly-seasoned, grilled cubed potatoes.  (I didn't mind the spice level of the chorizo while the meal was fresh, but I noticed that it tasted too salty and too spicy for me to tolerate subsequent leftover meals- strange, that.)  While I enjoyed the grilled chicken (I try to avoid anything corn-based, since I'm allergic to corn, and yes, that would also include eggs... one or two in a batter is OK for me on most days), I wondered if I could order my next barbecue combo sans chicken and with more grilled steak, instead?  Doesn't hurt to ask...  I returned the next night for another installment, since Mom finished the chile relleno leftovers soon after I arrived home with them.  Would love to go back and dine-in one of these days, and perhaps enjoy a complementing beverage and dessert with my meal!  :)  Mmm... happy hour menu sounds delightful, too! http://www.habaneros.mx/Happy_Hour.html

Yum. Co-worker brought me here for lunch and this was a great spot. They are usually jam packed and nothing was different today. They are quick to get your order and quick to get it out, but the best part is that they cook everything right there when you order it. You can go to places like Chipotle and get things out of the steam tables and they are ok-not great not bad, but you can go to a place like this and get something fresh and great for lunch. They also cater so I will probably be ordered for our office at some point.  I got the ground beef taco and chicken quesadilla and he got the carne asada taco and a quesadilla but I can't remember the meat he had, either way we were both pleased.  I was really pleased with everything and their friendly service also says a lot to me too.
Old management seems to be back when I want about 3 weeks ago. Food still isn't what it use to be from a year ago however. Sadly, I don't think it will ever return to that point in time.

I ordered the blackened shrimp burrito, enchilada style.  After my first three bites, I opened the burrito to count how many shrimp were included.  In total, I found 7 baby shrimp hidden beneath the remaining 90% of the 2 lb burrito, which was all rice and a few diced vegetables.  Overall, the $9.00 burrito had good flavor, but paled in comparison to many (more affordable and more generous) nearby Mexican restaurants.  I won't be back.

Very nice, very fresh, good flavour. Quick service, solicitous and friendly ( not overbearing) wait staff-all family - I think. Great place for quick casual din( maybe not the romantic  date) . EXCELLENT fajita for two and very very nice flan ( rivals what we had in France).will definitely return.
Great food and service.. Everything made to order.  Love the carnitas burro! Both salsa's are fresh and tasty. Chips are also outstanding..

Loved it. Great food, great prices, great portions. I split the carnitas nachos with a friend and it was plenty for two, and also very tasty. It wasn't overloaded with cheese or anything else. Just good portions of beans, cheese, sour cream, etc. The salsas are all excellent, as are the chips. Next time I go I'll try something different and post it up here. They could have maybe used another  waitperson during the dinner hour, but our waitress was very attentive, considering how busy she was.

On a 2015 blizzarding day with no lunch in sight and the office seemingly miles and hours away this palace was my savior. It can be best described as an authentic Chipotle. I went for the burrito because I have been burritoing it up lately and you can see all the ingredients in from of you before you add them on. Ask for a sample and they will be more than happy to let you get a taste to make sure you will leave satisfied and very satiated.   Now on the the spice levels. As someone who grows the hottest peppers on the planet and has just about every meal with some sort of piquant addition, they delivery. Furthermore, with a name like "Habanero's," the specific pepper is well represented. My favorite being the lesser of there firery toppings, the habanero pickled onions. These onions have the spice level that most can handle and retain the crunch without a harsh raw onion kick. Even a corn based salas that is tasty and very mild. Live a litte and ask for them all ine the side!  ENJOY.

Honestly really wanted to like this place but I literally couldn't bite through the carne asada. It didn't look bad but it was so tough that it was not even edible unless swallowed hole. Other than that, the flavor was good.
Very tasty tacos, especially the tacos al pastor.  The only recommendation I have as a serious pepper lover is to have more peppers.

Yummy, cheap and fast. Why mess around with Taco Bell? Six fresh tacos for $13.50. Fresh, soft flour tortillas. Tried spicy and pulled pork, with pulled slightly more flavorful. Spicy might have had pepper flakes but was almost like it was stewed in tomatoes. Homemade sour cream, and assortment of toppings including lettuce, cheese, homemade guac and salsas. They've updated corn salsa to separate corn and diced tomatoes which probably works better. I took advice of other reviewers and added some pickled onions--nicely done. A little afterbite to them, but exactly what it needed. Most serious concern is that the pulled pork seemed a little on the dried out side. Small concern--man, I hate to use Styrofoam for takeout. Will eat from here again.

Yelp prompted my bf and I get some food here late one night. We were not disappointed. We got steak and pastor for our tacos and bf also ordered a burrito. The pastor was awesome and the pickled onions were also great. Can't say anything bad about the food and there was a point in time where we had it for dinner 3 nights in a row. Best tacos in Madison, in my opinion.
I was not impressed and expected more with all the great reviews. The tacos didn't have much flavor and the chicken was an odd orange color. There are better options.
Great food!! Wish there was one of these by my house!! Great service and awesome guacamole!! Ferry well priced as well!! They should replace every filibertos with a Habanero's!!

When we pulled up, we groaned-not much curb appeal & we were skeptical. Friendly greeting-we were the only customers. The iced tea & guacamole were freshly made. A mahi mahi bowl & the carne asada bowl were recommended & did not disappoint-delish! She brought hot, medium & mild salsa's & they all had good flavor. Oh, & pica digallo was a perfect accompaniment. I'll be back for more!
Excellent food. Simple but very favorable.  Service was very good. Has everything you could want in a quick good Mexican meal. Differently northern Mexican food. I'll be back again.
Really tasty food, and fresh. Clean restaurant and friendly staff. I would recommend this place.

These guys do a great job on the service as well as the food. I've eaten here about 6 times and have had a verity of items. The grilled fish tacos are very good and I suggest trying those. But watch that habanero's sauce you'll feel it the next day if you know what I mean. It is hot stuff!   The place is a bit out of the view and hard to find...I always get northsight and hayden mixed up. I like the open kitchen so I can see what the cook is doing too. They serve beer, wine and hard liquor as well.

We were out in Phoenix meeting our wedding photographer and wanted some Mexican Food. Found this place on Yelp! Cool set up being fast food and dine in, staff was very friendly and the food was good. If you are looking for real Mexican tacos I would say to give this place a try. They have a small variety of liquor but mainly different tequilas. If you are a taco and tequila fun definitely come here on a Tuesday. Only thing I didnt like was their beans and rice. With them having such a great selection of tacos I was hoping for real Mexican beans, but no luck. Thanks for a great lunch!
Great food, really friendly staff. Super cute place. The blackened shrimp tacos were delicious

Best tacos in Madison. Hands down.  It's a shame it's not that close to downtown (or the westside), or this place would rake it in.  Service is Qdoba/Chipotle style.  Other than the meat you ordered, there's no limit to what these guys will throw on the burrito/taco/etc.  Ask for a little, you get more than normal (no joke - be wary).  While 2 bucks per taco (6 for a burrito) might seem over the top at first, you'll find yourself full after just a few.  The food itself is delicious, spice is good, and it's a mess. Everything you'll grow to love.  Try the barbacoa, it's been simmering for 24+ hours by the time you get it.  The stuff melts.  The flatscreens with the spanish music videos seal the deal. You'll never go anywhere else again.

Habaneros is one of my favorite hole in the wall Mexican food. Order their guacamole. It is yummy. I like their fish blackened tacos. They have quite a varied menu to meet selective eaters. I have not had a bad meal here. Their green sauce is very good. Enjoy!
Awesome place..delicious food..great customer service..reasonable prices..love the Adam's burrito ^^

wow.  food made fresh.  food made well.  very tasty. had the parrillada tampequeno. MMMMMMMMMM.  habanero salsa was good, but not hot as some have said. (yea my kids say my tastebuds are warped)  bob had the chicken fajitas, he said they rocked.  the guac was very good.
Their food and margaritas are so fresh, authentic and inexpensive! This is the first Mexican restaurant that made me feel back in the days (35+ yrs ago) at Banning HS. Wow! Just WOW!

This place was extremely underwhelming, Especially considering how many stars they have received.  The personnel were very nice, but this is definitely not good Mexican food.  I ordered the spicy pork. I should've known it would've underwhelmed because the meat looked as though it had been sitting for quite some time, but I really wanted to love this place, to find a good Mexican restaurant.  Nonetheless the meat was really dry, the portions are very small compared to the price, but I washed it down with a bottle of beer and took my loss on the chin.

This is one of my favorite Mexican "fast food" joints ever.  My company caters from them quite often, and whenever we order from there, people love us!!! We get the chicken fajita , carne asada and carnitas burritos. The meat is so flavorful and delicious.  They always do such a fantastic job. Very hard workers. It is owned by Arturo and his sister, Maria. Say hi to them next time you stop in.

Great family run mexican food place. The margaritas are nice and they do have a happy hour.  I love the burritos plates, good beans, tacos, really everything is good. The service is very pleasant and they know their stuff.  They have a small ouside area to dine. It is a small place so get there early and enjoy the great service and food.  They have take out too.

Oh my goodness! Yelp has smiled upon my taste buds once again. I searched for lunch in this area while my boyfriend and I were waiting on our car and we walked up to Habanero's just in time. After we put in our order all these people showed up behind us! We sat outside and waited probably less than ten minutes for our food. Based on what I read I ordered the carnitas burrito, my bf got a carne asada, blackened fish, and blackened chicken taco. To drink, horchata for us both!   Before I dug in I tried a piece of chicken that had fallen out of his taco onto the plate. Seriously, some of the softest most tender chicken I've ever had. My burrito was perfect and the guac inside sent me to the clouds of food heaven. The horchata was really good considering it came from a fountain drink machine.   We were checked on at least three or four times during our meal and asked how everything was and if we needed anything else. After we finished eating we started to gather our plates and trash not knowing if we were supposed to take it inside or what, not a second later the manager (at least he seemed like one) came to our table to take it all away. He was very friendly and easy going.   Next time we want to go out for breakfast it will be Habanero's. I can definitely see why this place is so popular.

You'd never guess how great this place is if you're one to judge a book by its cover. The location is less than desirable, but the food is AMAZING.  Probably the best chicken burrito bowl I've had.  You know it's good when the signs, the staff and the TV show in the background: all in Spanish.  Will I come back to this place: absolutely.  In the next week:  there is high probability.

My new favorite go to fast Mexican place. Prices are reasonable, service is fast, food is fresh and tasty. What more can you ask for?  I am a huge chipotle fan but with a place like habaneros, why not patronize a mom and pop establishment and support a local small business.  I liked my meal so much, I returned the next day. The man behind the counter remembered me and piled on more food :)   I am a big fan of their green chile chicken salad. YUM

Habanero's is my lunch spot every Wednesday and has been for the past 3 years. I get a steak burrito almost every time, but I recently tried their tacos and enjoyed those as well. Friendly staff, clean restrooms, and quick service. I love that they have Grape Crush!
Drove 12 miles to eat there. Would not recommend walking across the parking lot. Over cooked and over stirred.  1 cook trying to teach 2 newbies, tried to eat it because I was hungry but could not.
Great food, friendly service, clean and very reasonable prices for the large portions.
Third time here. Great authentic food. Affordable prices. Great friendly staff. Can't go wrong  with anything you order. Their HOT sauce is HOT! Habanero house made sauce. Carnitas are awesome

For living in arizona, it's really tough to find some decent, authentic mexican food in the north scottsdale locale thus when I tried this play for the first time I was blown away. The blackened chicken is so moist and delicious, the carne asada is flavorful, and the best part of all, there is no need to run directly to the restroom after eating. BAM! This place has just been marked as my go to mexican food in the valley. Keep it up guys.

This place is absolutely amazing!  Great service, and better prices.  I can't believe it has taken me two years to get to this place.  I will definitely be recommending to all my Madison friends and I WILL BE BACK!  $5 for a burrito with everything on it!!  Plus they serve a wide selection of Mexican beers and everything is just so fresh.  I will not be going back to Chipolte or Qdoba anytime soon.  Keep up the great work Habeneros!!

The horchata here is really good in my opinion.  The food would be what I'd call the definition of "average Mexican".  Our guacamole appetizer was missing any real flavor, and lacked that creamy texture that I personally prefer.  Our main dish was one of the "house specialties", which also tasted average.

Looking for a Cinco De Mayo dinner. BINGO!!! Walked in and was greeted by a smiling crew and a fun atmosphere.  Taqueria-ish but very spacious with seating for 30 plus another 6 at the bar.  Service was prompt and friendly.  Top notch margarita $5.99 huge! Awesome food!  Calamari taco, fish taco, scrumptious and hearty.  The parrillada dish was as good as any Mexican concoction on a platter that I have had. Drop in, you won't leave hungry and your taste buds with thank you.

I've driven by this place many times and never thought to try it. Doesn't show for much from the outside, I would have thought it to be another "(fill in the blank)bertos" of some sort. However, I was driving by today, craving a taco, and needed somewhere quick. So glad I stopped! Food was great, and has much more of a restaurant feel to it, than a fast food joint.

Vistited this place based on yelp reviews and had excellent lunch. Chicken fajita was tasty and tasted best shrimp quesadilla here. Didn't like Chiles Rellenos much.. But everything else was very good and fresh. This place is definately going to be our frequent Mexican food place.
This place is just amazing! And I love Mexican food. They're on point, the price is great and the portion is enough to get you full. I totally recommend this place!!.
Great food!  Well kept inside, nice staff, and reasonably priced.  Will be back again next time I'm down town... oh and margaritas!

Habanero's is a small storefront with about six tables inside and another five on a patio.  You order at a counter and the food is brought to your table.  We've all done that before - no problem.    The menu is pretty standard Mexican, with tacos, burritos, a few platters that include rice and beans, chips and salsa, and guacamole.    There's no sense commenting on the service because there basically isn't any.  Ditto ambiance.  You just come here to satisfy your hunger.  So it all comes down to the food, and at Habanero's it's not bad, but it's not really good either.  Better than Taco Bell but not as good as a dozen sitdown Mexican restaurants in the area, and really not much cheaper.  Why go here?

We'll start at dessert...Three of the people at our table had the flan. All three of us said, "this is the best I've ever had." The other three had sopapillas - they said the same thing. Every main dish was delicious (we shared). The blackened chicken enchilada, the chilies rellenos, the fish tacos, the tacos carnitas. All so good. Then there was the fresh guacamole and house made chips. Oh, yum. And the margaritas - yep - everything, delicious. We'll be back.
Really good burritos with pleasant service. As others have stated, it's similar to Chipotle and Quidoba, but they have more options for toppings on your meal, like a dash of cilantro.

So excited when they opened up!  I have not been there when it is super busy but it is a very easy going atmosphere.  The more authentic way to go when compared to Chipotle or Qdoba.  Huge servings for less than Chipotle and Qdoba as well.  I had a plain bean and cheese burrito for $4.00 or so.  I think full on burritos run close to $5.50.  Not the fanciest place (a little tongue in cheek ;) ) but is clean!  The food is super.  Legit flavors and one of the only places that uses cilantro as a topping, not just thrown in with a salsa.  I love cilantro!!  Awesome food for sit down or a quick eat and run.
This place is so authentic, I absolutely loved the food and the service was top notch. The chorizo is great!

I recently stopped by this establishment and was very surprised at the quality of the cuisine. When we stepped in there was a huge pot of meats simmering away while an open prep kitchen showed just how much pico de gallo this place must run through.   The set-up is a lot like a fast casual restaurant and the menu is posted on the wall. Simply pick a option and customize it with meat/rice/beans/veggies/salsa and voila! Deliciousness.   I ordered the 3 steak tacos with corn tortillas while the fella got a steak torta. The tacos were amazing and I love how they heat up the tortillas before they proceed. I would definitely get these again and don't shy away from the spicy, pickled onions. Completely amazing.  The bite of torta I had seemed a little lackluster - I have had others that I preferred more but that's a personal thing. The prices are great and definitely worth it for the freshness and character that each dish possesses.   I would definitely recommend this place to any looking for an incredibly cheap-eat and tasty option. Also, they serve fountain soda, blended drinks, and beer. Perfect.

Fresh, fresh, fresh! These people care about their food. And they don't roll their eyes when you speak Spanish--they encourage you. Fantastic for my little girl and this Spanish minor. I always get vegetarian fare because it's so good. And cheap. And fresh. Did I mention fresh?

I've been coming here since the place opened as I work right across the parking lot. The food is always excellent and fresh. The owner and staff are some of the nicest people you will ever encounter.   Some favorites: ground beef burrito, blackened chicken salad, fish tacos, and the breakfast burritos (they are massive and filling and everything you could possibly want). Oh, and the sopapillas. Don't ever forget the sopapillas. Pillowy little bundles of cinnamon and sugar with honey if you want. Delicious.  Yes, they take a little while for lunch but it's all made right before your lil' eyes.   Red sauce is awesome, green is tasty, and the habanero sauce has a good flavor without cooking your face.  These guys also do catering and deliver!
First time here and I got the carne asada burrito. The burrito was good portioned and well priced. The meat was cooked perfectly, the guac was on point and the salsa added some great kick.

I returned to Habaneros and the owner "Sergio" addressed each and every issue I had. I knew that this man cared about his business deeply from the previous conversation I had with him. I feel for this good man and I'm willing to admit when I'm wrong. I didn't see the straws next to the drink machines, as I had previously stated they were next to the bar across the restaurant, I was wrong. I complained about the cooking time, that was due to me engaging Sergio in a conversation which took him away from helping with the cooking and also gave him the impression I had time to talk, I'm sorry. Today My food was prepared quickly and was delicious, just as it was the last time. I complained heavily about items missing from my takeout bags and right when I walked in today the owner exclaimed "We ran out after you, you didn't get everything!" Sergio gave me the items I didn't receive the last time and then proceeded to give me my meal for free. Sergio told me "We want our customers to have a wonderful experience and you didn't, I will make the necessary improvements and appreciate you letting me know where we can improve." Sergio went on to tell me that he has always and will always "Make things right for his customers," he went beyond the extra mile today and I was the one that was in the wrong by not understanding what had happened. I didn't receive everything in my to go bags, but I know that will never happen again and this kind owner made good on everything. This is a restaurant with amazing food, amazing customer service and an amazing owner who really cares. I had said that I hoped this place would soon blossom, not realizing, it already had. Thank you Sergio, I will be back often and hope this updated review makes up for the details I mistakenly criticized.

I know there's no rule book somewhere that says Mexican food ought to be cheap and fast, but I feel like it's a given considering the ingredients... right? Add to my wild assumption living in the southwest for 6 and half years and I grew to learn that if I was going out for Mexican, it wasn't going to be a long dinner experience and I wouldn't have to shell out a lot of bucks. Haberno's holds true on both accounts. They're quick (as you essentially watch them assemble food before your eyes) they're cheap, a five spot will buy you lunch, but in my opinion they lack flavor. I'm all for loading up some tacos with salsa, but I also think meat should be seasoned so you don't need to dredge everything in pureed tomato. I'm up for giving them another shot, but others in town bring the flavor these guys lack.

Just discovered this place. Food was really good! Nothing out of the ordinary food wise but it was really good and cheap. The staff was super helpful and friendly. A great first experience. We will be back!

I've eaten here many times since this location opened. The bottom line is it's the best fast-casual Mexican food you can get in Madison. There is no need to ever go to Qdoba or Chipotle again, unless you're dying to have some white cheese sauce. If you want tacos, burritos, a quesadillas, or tortas, this is the place you should go.  In the first year they were operating, it was like stumbling onto a gold mine. They were reckless with the portions and way cheaper than similar restaurants. Their regular portion of meat was more than what double what you'd usually get at a place like Chipotle. They have definitely reigned it in a bit over the years, which is for the best, as I would like them to stay in business. Nowadays, they're still generous with the meat, but really skimpy with the salsas, cheese, and guac. Don't hesitate to ask for more.  My go-to is a chicken burrito with rice, black beans, cilantro, onions, pico de gallo, habanero salsa, cheese, and veneno (spicy onions pickled in habanero flakes). The veneno is an absolute must. In used to melt your face off, and even though they have neutered it a bit for more average spice lovers, it still adds some nice heat and so much flavor.   The pastor and barbacoa are the other best meats, in my opinion. I'm not crazy about the carnitas or steak.   If you read a review telling you that the meats have "0 seasoning whatsoever," you should ignore it, because that statement is insane. In my many, many times eating here, there have been sub-par experiences, mostly owing to new staff. Maybe that person ate there on a day like that. This is the best choice in town BECAUSE the meats are so damn delicious. And it doesn't hurt that you pay $2 less than you would elsewhere and end up getting more food for it. Eat here. Get a punch card. Continue eating here. You will be pleased.
Good burrito w fresh ingredients. Nice and spicy, good service!

The food was terrific -- flavorful and nicely presented -- and affordable, and the service was speedy and friendly. We had tacos -- carnitas, fish and carve asada -- and they were excellent. Chicken enchiladas were delicious. We'll definitely be back!
It's ok, if all you want is a taco or burrito. Minimal selection and no platters of food. Very disappointing.

Love this place! Great blackened fish and shrimp tacos and blackened shrimp quesadilla. Calamari tacos aren't on the menu, but be sure to ask if they're available.  Owner Arturo is really hands-on and makes a mean margarita too!  Be sure to ask for the orange (habanero) sauce!

Disgusting! Ordered Guacamole & chips, though the guacamole was green that was the only resemblance, flavor was horrible. Pork for the taco was similar to the consistency of baby food but flavor was so bad my boyfriend actually gagged when he tasted it. Food was cold, not even room temperature. Will not go back! No stars are warranted for this place.

Great lunch spot downtown. I'm not a huge Mexican food fan but I found a dish I really like here. I get the chicken fajita plate which is chicken, peppers, onions, guacamole, sour cream (I don't get this), and a choice of beans or rice - I get the rice and it's delicious.  It's a pretty good deal too because even with the $1.99 drink it's just a little over $10. Local mom and pop shop which makes it even better.  They have a small bar area if you wanted a beer or margarita. They share a parking lot with Jimmy John's and it looks small, but we have never had a problem finding a parking spot at prime lunch time. Friendly employees and always had a good experience.

I love it when places keep it pretty simple.    I came here for breakfast on the recommendation of several friends who have been here.  Now, I wasn't sure if I could accurately judge the place based on breakfast offerings.  But that was the time I could get over here during my business trip.  So breakfast it was.    One burrito with egg, potato and chorizo later, and I see why everyone I know who has been here raves about the place.    I didn't eat anything overly creative here.  It was just a straightforward breakfast burrito.  But man, if I lived and worked here everyday, I'd get this for breakfast everyday.  It's one of those perfect everyday choices that would make me happy to get up in the morning.    My dining companions got items that looked even more appetizing to me.  It was so that I was actually jealous of what they ate.  Which of course means that when I'm back in town I'm getting what they got.    But it will be tough for me to turn down that burrito.
Awesome, I've bookmarked this place and it'll be a must stop for me in the future, when I'm in town. Guacamole made fresh, blackened chicken, moist, fresh & spicy - just right

Amazing quality for the price! I ordered some ground beef tacos and the ingredients were so fresh that I actually felt really good after eating them! The meat was not greasy or overly seasoned. My boyfriend got a breakfast burrito and had the same opinion. You can eat GOOD Mexican food here for a cheap price.

Prices have gone up since photos posted, each meat is around or over $7, it was $17 for two entrees.  Flavor OK. Definitely wouldn't say I'm going to pick this over taco bell next time because I can eat a lunch at taco bell for just a few dollars, but I guess in terms of taste it was better than a chipotle or qdoba type thing with similar pricing. Was disappointed that they charge the same price as meat for just a plain cheese quesadilla.

This has been one of the few places I have been to in the Phoenix area that has tacos and drinks. No Dollar Taco Tuesday but they did have dollar off Mexican beer on a Tuesday. And dollar off fish on a Tuesday.  So I got a shrimp taco and a fish taco, fried with corn tortillas. Not as good as real Mexico, but it will do. And they had a full bar for you Margarita enthusiasts.

I recently went here at 930 at night and grabbed a burrito. Instant food poisoning. I was sick for almost 2 days. I'm guessing the food had been sitting out way too long or there was some bad cross contamination. I'll never go back especially after discovering Cuco's down the road. Food is way better and the service is much friendlier.

Tried the steak quesadilla here for the first time the other day and it wasn't the best quesadilla I ever had, but it was pretty good! Also, yummy guacamole! My boyfriend goes here all the time and says he loves it!

Parriada was tasty and the serving for two was just perfect for two (no left overs- but we rarely eat rice or more than a spoonful of beans).   Chips were hot and fresh. Service was great.   Overall a little pricey for location and food.
Good quesadilla, the burrito enchilada style was okay but served on too small of a plate and it wasn't very warm. Friendly people, decent environment.

Excellent Mexican food from the Jalisco region.  Quality of food is consistent and high.  Great service and low prices.  Highly recommend the Carnitas.  We've been eating here for about 2 years and have never been disappointed.

We needed lunch after a round of golf and I knew there was a Mexican place nearby that had been Yelped in a good light, so I dug through the phone app to find the name of the place.  Whether I got it exactly right or not, Habanero's was the place we were going to hit - it had positive reviews from most everyone as well as my friends.  The menu is simple - "we have these ingredients - in which form would you like to consume them?" was the basic jist of it.  We both had the steak burrito and were not disspointed.  The flavors popped - I was very satisified with the taste and the large portion.  Basically, it's the same format as Qdoba or Chipotle, but tastes better.    I wouldn't mind trying the tacos next time - I saw them being made for a gentleman in front of us.  They were a bit messy (but a GOOD messy!) and I wasn't ready for that sort of committment, so I opted for the easier-to-eat burrito...  I won't chicken out next time!

Great customizable tacos, fresh toppings. Their chips and salsa are delish, better then most "Mexican" restaurants in town. Cheap food and beer, but still not on par with any taco place in Southern California or Texas.

Very small cafe-style spot in a strip mall. Habanero's offers amazingly good authentic food that you would pay double for down the street. They have everything from breakfast burritos to unique daily specials. All are served with several delicious salsas. If your not trying to impress a date, then try this for an affordable, casual, neighborhood experience.

Cheap prices...friendly service...good food.  Went here with a group of 7 people and we were accommodated quickly.  Tables were combined, orders were quickly taken and they even separated the bill 7 ways.  For a grab your own seat and order at counter type place they did not have to do all that but they went out of their way for us.  Ordered guacamole and chips with salsa for appetizers.  Salsa was to thin for my taste but the chips and guacamole were excellent.  For main dish ordered the blacked chicken quesadilla, ground beef taco and blacken chicken taco with black beans as a side.  Everything was good and tasted fresh.    Open kitchen is a nice touch.

i am rating according to service, price and food quality. best service - this is a family owned restaurant and the owners are the one taking care of you- very personal service. Price is cheaper compared to other restos around the area , so that is great! my favorite food is the blackened shrimp tacos - excellent. i also love their carne asada tacos! great find in north scottsdale!
Absolutely delicious!!! The service was excellent too. Great prices on the different menu items. You won't leave here disappointed!

Really friendly staff and great food. It seemed to be super busy but it never bothered and their was plenty of seating at the time. It looks as though there could be a challenge to find a table if everyone was looking to dine in but overall great spot. The beef burrito chimi style is the way to go!!!

The food was really good and the service was also friendly and fast. The restaurant was clean and convenient to get to what we needed. It's a little small, but it's situated well and we had no trouble finding a place to sit with 5 of us.

MMM... lobster tacos! I'm here at least once a month for lunch with coworkers. I always get a lobster taco and a shrimp taco on whole wheat tortillas with a side of chips and guac. Good service, good prices. ****4 Stars for lunch.

Kind of hard to find but it was definitely worth it. Food came out fast, hot, and so yummy. The burrito was wrapped tightly and was juicy and tender, while the bean and cheese nachos were beany and cheesy. Would very much recommend.
Great food and friendly service. I ordered the blackened chicken tacos,very tasty and had a carne asada burrito that was also delicious! First time here and will definitely come back!

We stopped here from two time zones away for a quick bite and a few cheap drinks. The service, food, and drinks were sincerely a steal for the bill we received. I highly recommend this place for anyone trying to decide if they should dine here. Great food, great service, great value. Muchas gracias de Kentucky. Oh, for the record we had carnitas, Guadalajara style. A great choice.

I had the lunch special and chips and salsa today. The special was blackened fish and shrimp along with all the fixings and 3 tortillas. The chips are a little thicker than I like and the red salsa (both green and red are served if ordered) is very much like someone else reported...liquidy, definitely nothing for your chip to grab on to. The highlight was the blackened fish and shrimp, which I used to make my own tacos. The beans and rice were average. The place is small with most tables fitting two people and a few tables for four. Inside they can hold perhaps 30 people including the 5 or 6 people at the bar. I gave it a three-star rating because the fish and shrimp was very tasty but the watered-down salsa was not my favorite. They are opening a second location in SW corner of Scottsdale/Shea in about three weeks behind the Denny's and will have more space for patrons.

There Chile Relleno's are so good! How ever, I feel like it was missing a sauce like my abuela makes. MMMmmm. Also, they should have the option to stuff these bad boys with chicken and cheese. My opinion but they were still delicious and I would go back for more. I also tried there carne asada tacos and they were pretty damn good.   Furthermore, the best thing I enjoyed was their hellish habanero salsa. Oh my was it freaking hot and tasty! Definitely pair that up with the guacamole. BOMB! I'm a fan of this place and will return again to try other things on the menu.

Habanero's is right next to my work so I'm a frequent visitor. In a nutshell, Habanero's is like a Qdoba but fresher and has more of a true Mexican flare. Their corn tacos are amazing. Their quesadillas are amazing. Their staff is friendly and they are quick!  When you first see the location it doesn't scream, "come here for lunch". But if you look past the frontage road location to give this place a try, I promise you won't be disappointed.
Recommend the tacos! All fresh and just the right size. We each got 3. Variety. Made to order.

My friend and I just happened to run into this restaurant on Saturday April 8th 2017 about 1 pm.. We are from Albuquerque and were in town for some baseball games.  I am sad to say we didn't get the servers name, but I was floored by her excellent customer service and her constant smile on her face. It's hard to find "good service with a smile" these days. The nachos were great. They ran out of the beer that we wanted but there were plenty of other options to pick from. We would definitely go back!!!!

Delicious. Atmosphere divey. We were the only people speaking English and it was awesome. I saw a whole pile of cut avocados in the back - I had to try the guacamole... So worth it. I got three tacos-one each of spicy pork, pulled pork and shredded beef, with corn tortillas.  Loved all three but the spicy pork was my favorite.   Overlook the location and the exterior! Your mouth will thank you!

I came here because I saw all the good reviews and they have ground beef.  It's hard to find ground beef anything out here. My boyfriend and I went and the first thing I noticed was the cook opened up a plastic drawer with the ground beef under the stove!!! I was like umm that doesn't look sanitary let alone how is the meat staying at the proper temperature.  He then just threw it on the grill and I was hoping he seasons that meat but he didnt. That was a red flag but I'm like well we already paid for it maybe they will do something later idk. The customer service was not good. I walked to the bathroom and it was locked and they just watched me so I assumed someone was in there. While waiting for my food a woman goes up and grabs a key to the restroom. I thought "why didn't they just say you need a key?" I go to grab napkins and they are just staring at me and I'm like I need napkins. Anyways I get my food and it is terrible!! The meat is just ground beef with no seasonings nothing and the refried beans are just that plain non-seasoned refried beans. Taco Bell even has seasonings and I hate Taco Bell. I understand some people have "lighter tolerances" when it comes to seasonings but come on. It's called Habaneros for a reason. Very disappointed I won't be back!

Really good plate with a variety of meats. Basically fajita. The chorizo was the standout. As well as the chicken.  The things we thought were bland we're the Carnitas burrito and Blackened fish taco.  Shrimp tacos were great!

We've gone back multiple times, and this is our go-to place for no-nonsense killer tacos and burritos.  Every meat we've had to date is killer;  the el pastor and barbacoa are incredible!  Great beer selection as well, and impossible to beat $2 tacos for the portions they give you.

Chips and salsa...MEH... BUT- The blackened chicken soft tacos are tasty for a little hole in the wall fast food kind of place.  I was definitely surprised.  The staff is so nice. Worth a shot to check it out for a little mexican snack.

Glad I found this place! it's an awesome local place with strong drinks and really friendly service. The house marg was perfect with salt and wasn't too sweet like at some places. The guac was homemade and excellent as well. The tacos were about perfect with the carne asada as the best but the shrimp and fish closely behind.   Be sure and check this place out if you're in the area and want local Mexican food.

Massive, fresh, tacos. Massive, fresh, burritos. Awesome pastor and carne asada. Tasty horchata. Good prices AND they don't charge extra for sour cream, guacamole, and extra salsa! This is my go-to joint for quick tacos and burritos.  Update: So apparently they changed things a bit since I was there last. They now charge 75 cents for guacamole, which is a bummer. Other than that it is still the same old deliciousness.
Great food,Eat there all the time,Need to expand their menu though,I recommend this restaurant

Great service. Friendly and very helpful considering it was our first time here. Had the blackened fish and shrimp burrito. Even though it's not considered spicy, there's still a bit of a kick to it. Had to buy chips and salsa but it comes with free refills as does the drinks. I like that they also sold breakfast burritos even though it was dinner time. Overall a good find... will definitely be back.

Delicious food and fantastic service from Natasha and friendly owner Arturo. The place is fairly small with only a few tables and the decor is reminiscent of Mexico.  The food was fresh and plentiful and prices are very reasonable. No complaints here. Will be back.
Fresh with great service. Sauces are great: standard red has a bit of heat and very deep, smoky flavor. Green is nice and fresh/tangy. Drip a little on each bite of your burito:

This place was awful. There was one waitress waiting on the entire restaurant. It took us 30 minutes to get chips and salsa, very bland chips and salsa. By the time I got my food I was starving but 2 bites in I found a bug crawling across my plate. Will never go here again ever.
Cheap and easy Mexican. Not Stellar, but good enough for quick eats on a friday night.

The food was excellent, very authentic!  The service was friendly, too.  The place was very small, though; kinda cramped.  Everyone was willing to wait for a table to get the great food.  This place is worth your time!
Anything everything on their menu is great. The owners are so nice. I especially like the tacos. Try the pickled onions - they are deliciously soaked in habanero peppers.

Thank you Yelp for helping us find this great lil Mexican grill while at spring training. Great service.  Great food. The special blackened chicken chimichanga's were awesome. Hope to see you next trip down.

We stumbled upon this hole in the wall type Mexican restaurant after a long morning at the science center. A quiet and cute little place, friendly staff, and the food, oh my goodness the food!
