It was so delicious. We ordered fresh guacamole and chips while we waited for our order. It was so good! I had the chicken burrito and my husband had the steak burrito. They were stuffed with all of the fixings! Also, their salsa was yummy. We were offered green and red. Even the kids meals have big portions! All in all, delicious, filling, and super fresh! We will be back!!!!

I don't get too adventurous with mexican food, but I have trouble finding places I like and that my fellow diners like. This place is quick, and the food is good, especially for the price. The cheese crisp and sopapillas are great. Also, the service was 5 star - very friendly from hi to goodbye.
Been going here for years, never disappoints! Love the fajitas and quesadillas. Chips and salsa are a must too!
One of my favorites.  Try the parrillada.  It's always tasty and very filling.  Great staff that is always very accommodating.  I always enjoy the ice cold draft beer with dinner.

Food was very bland. Ordered the breakfast burritos(steak and chorizo) and the blackened chicken nachos. The burritos came with about an 80% ratio of potato to steak and eggs. Don't really think even if the ratios were proportionate that the taste would have been any different. Even adding sauce did not make the meal any more appetizing. The blackened chicken nachos were decent only because of the fresh guac. Gave two stars solely for the guacamole, otherwise water has more flavor then their breakfast burritos.

This is definitely my local go to taco spot! Best tacos and great prices. Most tacos are $2.50 each and they are loaded up with meat. I usually always go with the carnitas and their red sauce. They have a good habanero and green salsa as well. I've taken others that have gone with the crane asada or chicken and never heard anything but positive feedback on it.   They will also do catering on short notice. I had my team working on a Saturday at the office and was able to call him that morning and got the food delivered by 11am to our office. Everyone absolutely loved the food and asked that we use them again in the future instead of the other spots we've used in the past.   Service is always great as well. It's a order at the counter type of setup but they will let you leave the tab open and serve you in case you want to order drinks or more food because you loved the first plate so much.

1st visit here. Very conveniently located near Scottsdale Gun Club. Had observed many favorable Yelp reviews and was intent on trying it for quite a while.  I was there for a Sunday lunch pretty much right around noon. There was another fast casual restaurant a couple doors down with no customers in sight. Habenero's was hopping with people nearly filling the dining area and the outside tables.  I took a menu and found a table. Drinks were served almost instantly after ordering. Chips and salsa were fast behind. I ordered the carnitas burrito. It comes with guac and pico. The server brought the mild and medium salsas with the chips.  The chips were light and not overly seasoned. The mild salsa is just that. Mild. So mild you could drink it like it was soup. The medium salsa is a tomatillo base with onion, garlic and jalepenos. Very little bite but good flavor. She asked if I wanted the hot salsa and cautioned that it was "very" hot. It's a flavorful mix of habenero peppers and garlic. A bit of a bite to it - not something I'd drink like soup. Good flavor. One more note about the chips: without salsa, I could detect that the oil might be a bit off as there was a slight aftertaste that didn't seem great.  Now, the carnitas burrito: not too big, not too small. Good value for the money. And, lean pork. A decent amount of well-made guac and a small amount of pico. No fluff. No lettuce or cheese or anything else unnecessary. A very tasty burrito!  So why only 3 stars? OK. First, the staff was very friendly. Service was attentive and prompt. Great burrito. Great "hot" salsa. Really good "medium" salsa. And who cares about mild salsa? The chips, as I said, were just a bit off. Maybe the oil needed to be changed out, I don't know. When the check arrived, all I was given was the smallest piece of receipt paper I'd ever seen with a printed total. I expected an itemized receipt. And, when presented with the copy I was to sign, there wasn't a customer copy. I guess I was to take the tiny slip that came at first. And, therein lies the reason for only 3 stars.

This place had pretty good chile Rilenos and I was pleased with them. The lobster tacos were out of this world and I'm saddened we didn't come back for more. The chicken my kids got had a funny taste, and therefore I can't give it 5 stars. It was a small restaraunt and our party of 7 took up most of the place.
Salsa is like water.  The waitress was on her cell phone while taking our order. Not attentive and somewhat rude. Way better places every where . Margaritas were large and good

Bad deal all around.  Monday night, no customers, literally.  Gal at the front did not smile once. I should have walked out then and there. She should be trained or let go.  The cook was wearing gloves which is nice since he is working where customers can see him clearly. Not sure what he was doing since there were no customers, but maybe fiddling with the grill or something? Then his phone rang which he answered with his gloves and began to have a conversation, while continuing his kitchen work. Phone in hand... phone on shoulder...phone in hand. Yuck.  Do whatever you need to do with gloves and phones, etc., but please not in front of the customers.   We walked out so can't comment about the food.

I've drove by this place a couple of times...  Curiosity finally got the better of me today, and I couldn't be any happier with my decision.  The carne asada rice bowl was excellent.  It wasn't too much food to give me a food coma, but definitely filled me up.  I was in for $10 with carne asada rice bowl and a soda.  I will note that I asked for the HOT sauce and it was a burner - gave me a bit of a sweat stash.  It was habanero based, so watch yourself before you wreck yourself!  Enjoy! Rikky

First time here. Came by after barrett-jackson car auction. Figured I'd try it out. They looked very good from all the pictures. Ended up being great food. Very friendly. Family own, got to talk with owner and family.

Living in SoCal, I've had my fair share of Mexican food. From Tex-Mex, to hole-in-the wall, to authentic, to fake Mexican-Cali-Fresh. So while in Scottsdale for work, I had to see what they had to offer. Yelped, and found Habanero's. Overall, I have mixed reviews. The chips were gooooood! Not just corn, but different flavored chips. Yummy. I got a side of guac, which I'll pass on next time. TOOOO many onions for me and not enough salt or lime juice. The owner, as others mentioned, was super nice! Cracked jokes, was friendly, very good service. BUT, when it came to the food, ehhh. I hate ordering take-out and having them eff up your order! I ordered 3 tacos: 1 fish, 1 blackened shrimp, and 1 carne asada, requesting them on corn tortillas with no onions, cilantro, or pico, with extra limes. Got them on flour tortillas with cilantro, with 1 small lime wedge. The fish taco was my least fav. Just tasted like frozen battered cod that was seasoned enough. The shrimp was just ok. The carne asada was great. The meat was very tasty. Also got a side of rice. My whole order (including guac, 3 tacos, and rice) came to $11.16.   Overall, I was disappointed with my food mostly because it wasn't as I ordered it. Lesson learned: check it before you leave if you get it to go. I miiiiiight go back when I'm in town next and give it 1 (only 1!) more chance.

just had a carne asade burro for lunch with guac, sour cream, and pico. wasnt anything speiclal at all. I prefer my burro's to not be cut in half considering its a burrito not a PB&J.  The salsas didnt have a lot of flavor. The hot salsa had a good heat to it but just not much flavor. I found myself using the green salsa the most.    On the upside i had an ice cold Victoria that made up for it all. I would go back and try the fish tacos i suppose

First you have the option of ordering from the counter or having sit down service. My family and I wanted the service. Our server was very sweet and efficient! She also kept our drinks full. We started with Chips and Salsa. My husband loved the salsa!I wasn't too crazy about it so I just put cholula on my chips! Yummy!! Everyone was happy with their meals. Dad loved the taco salad. Mom devoured her lobster tacos. The enchiladas were delicious except chicken was a little dry for my taste!! My husband loved his breakfast dish choice so much.   Highly recommended.

Tasty, better than average Mexican food.  I hit this place up on lunch with a coworker and we were both pleasantly surprised.  Their food is all made from scratch (except tortillas), tasty, and seemed fresh.  Prices were reasonable and definitely worth it.    You walk up to the counter and order, then they bring it out to you.  I had their Carnitas "Guadalajara" Style... when I asked the owner "What is Guadalajara style?" he replied "Guadalajara style means they're the best carnitas you will ever have".  Well, how could I say no to that?  Turns out they are slow cooked carnitas, done proper, then deep fried before serving... haha, so good.  I won't say they were the BEST carnitas I've ever had, but they were probably tied for best..... although a bit greasy, obviously.  The beans and rice are nothing special, however the hot sauce and corn tortillas were spot on.  This place is definitely an addition to my lunch rotation.

Went there for takeout lunch on a Saturday late afternoon.We were excited to try something new.  The place was not too busy, but kind of loud because it is an open floor plan. Workers there seemed to be bothered by taking my order. $30 later we got about $15 worth of below average Mexican food,.. I wont be back, you guys gave me no reason to come back.

Pretty dang good Carne Asada for sure. I had the Carne Asada burrito and it was tasty. Comes with chips and salsa for 6 something. Not bad. Filled me up. No rice in the burrito which I like. Just meat and some grilled veggies. Service was good. Pretty fast and they handed my food right to me. They have Orchata on tap including a piña colada mixed one. Pretty tasty. The building is a bit small, but it's nice and clean inside. I wouldn't go out of my way to go here but I'd go if I was in the neighborhood.
I only have one word for this place, yummy. Love the Victoria on tap. Best Mex in the area. Great red sauce.

This place is awful. The food is mediocre at best. If I wanted mediocre Mexican food with no service, I would've just went to Arriba's down the corner. I found the food to be saturated with lard and just overall, horrible. The only bright side to this place is that it's cheap. If price isn't an issue, I'd recommend Los Sombreros, right down the road on Northsight. For one, you get service, two the food is better, but it is more expensive.
They went above and beyond to accommodate my dairy allergy, they made me a Mexican dairy free desert (buenuellos) and I loved them so much, as well as my meal! -a forever costumer :)

Just had lunch there today @ 11:25 (on a Monday) or so. I give a specific time because boy was it packed in there. When I got there the line was a just out the door. The food was great! Wife had fish tacos and I had carnitas de jalisco.  Food was great, seriously. Just too bad the seating is limited and it's a popular place to eat obviously. Staff was pretty friendly with a genuine smile.

Went in for lunch the other day.  I wasn't expecting much, but when my coworker and I got there, the parking lot was packed.  It must be a decent place.  There was a line to the door, but it moved pretty quickly. I got a chicken burrito. My coworker got the carnitas.  We both enjoyed the burritos.    I was a little worried at first because the chicken was Cheeto orange. I don't know what sort of spice mixture they soak it in to make it that color, but it tasted just fine.   The drink menu was just cans of soda in a cooler. I'm not a fan of places that do that. I like a fountain drink. I like free refills. Around lunch, I need all the caffeine I can get to make it through the remainder of the afternoon.  I don't have anything bad to say about this place. Like Chipotle, Qdoba, Burrachos, and Pancheros, it does what you'd expect.  It's not really better or worse than the others, but I would go back.
We love the food and the people are great.  We've ordered a dozen tamales (delicious!) from them a few times, and they've been very accomodating (just order a day or two in advance).

Habaneros has some good stuff. I enjoy the carne asada burros and tacos. I've gone with people who have gotten the breakfast burrito before and they loved it. A buddy always gets the taco salad, he says it's the best! Friendly staff and pretty quick service keep us coming back for more.

Passed by this place a few times & finally decided to give it a try... Not regretting it! This is def the most authentic Mexi food I've eaten in No-Sco. Had the carne asada burrito and horchata (: left happy. This experience was bueno! I'll be back to try more!

I really don't know how to review Habanero's.  In my opinion, it was just kinda blah and stale. I guess I thought my burrito was ok. They slapped my burrito together from ingredients that were being kept lukewarm on a buffet table. No salsa and chips, or condiments at the table. I was also disappointed that they did not offer half orders. I also thought that Habanero's was kind of pricey for what you received. For the same cost, you could eat at a nicer Mexican restaurant with complimentary chips and salsa, fresh food, and a much more inviting atmosphere.

I'm wavering between 3 stars and 4 stars. I'm leaning towards 4 because I think I brought the unhappiness upon myself. Meaning, I got something too spicy for me to handle. Regrets.  It's Chipotle-styled ordering. There are a few things you can choose from, then you pick what you want in it. I decided to get the tacos with chicken. The chicken was like bright orange, so I think it was spiced heavily. And then I thought, cool, I'd like to try the hot sauce too. So in addition to the already spicy chicken, I decided to add more spice on top of it. Did I mention I can't handle that much spice?  The tacos were good. I tried my best to eat as much as I could without dying. They give an ample amount of food, so yay.

This place has delicious food. I had the parrillada for the first time and it was fantastic! My wife had the chicken quesadilla and said it was one of the best she's ever had. The music was a bit too loud for my liking, but the overall dining experience was very enjoyable. If you want great food but do not want to wait a long time, this is your place.

I always make sure I stop into Habanero's when I am in the area. It is a great stop for lunch because you can get in and out quick. You order at the counter and they have seating if you choose to stay. The building and interior are nothing special but the food is fantastic!   My go to is always the 3 taco meal. I get corn tortillas which are warmed up on the spot and then have them pile on spicy pork. It has a kick, but these are indeed the best pork tacos I have had. Then you get to choose what beans, veggies, salsa, sour cream, guacamole, etc. you want. Make sure you get an order of chips and salsa on the side. They also offer Mexican beer and margaritas, but I have never tried them because I typically go over the lunch hour. Soft and bottles drinks are available.   The staff is always friendly and cracking jokes between themselves and with the customers. If you are looking for great quality Mexican food, this is the place!
I read the reviews before trying Habanero's. For the most part, they were accurate. Good food for the price, friendly service, nice dining area, and ample portions.

Eek! Methinks not. Very very bland salsa. Tastes close to water with a hint of cayenne and stale chips! I had to season them with salt to at least taste something a bit. I had breakfast steak burrito. Hubby is right. Sonic's tastes better. We expected good food because of the 4-star reviews in average but left disappointed and wont be coming back nor be recommending this place to friends.

The food was delicious and the service was great!  Even though there were a few mistakes they were very polite and quick to fix everything. We would definitely go back. The restaurant was clean and felt very welcoming. Thank you for a great lunch!!
Great Quality. Fresh ingredients and good meat. Tried The Carne Asada burrito amazing

This is a great neighborhood spot for some traditional Sonoran Mexican food.  I usually get the Blackened Chicken or shrimp burrito and it is always very consistent and good. They make all their own salsas and they are very good. The habanero sauce is their hottest and it has a good kick but nothing crazy hot. Good place and a good price.

Delicious food, excellent service, and quick for fresh food. We had the vegetarian bowl; no cheese and no meat and it was GREAT! You know the seasoning is right when you don't miss the meat or cheese. The portions were perfect, as well. As return customers, though, we hate their hours. This place closes super early and when we've come within their last 30 minutes of business hours they have turned us away.

Even though Habanero's Mexican Grill is located inside, the place reminds us more of a Sidewalk cafe with very friendly waitresses.  Mainly because it is located in small strip mall with glass covering the front of the establishment.  You don't come here for the ambiance or for a fancy meal.  Just like a Sidewalk cafe, you come here for simple food served quickly and to enjoy the company of the friends your eating with.  Other terms that might help to describe Habanero's are hole-in-the-wall or mom and pop.  They've got "Cantina" stuck on their logo and they do have some nice Happy Hour (3-6pm) prices on their draft beers.  I ordered the Steak a la Mexicana, which was slightly disappointing.  When I've ordered this dish at other similar restaurants (Even at places in Mexico), I've always received a whole piece of meat.  At Habanero's, they serve this dish Fajita style with the meat sliced up.  On top of that, the meat was very tough.  Overall, I enjoyed the dish, but those two complaints kinda ruined the food for me.  My wife had the Chiles Rellanos, which she enjoyed.  We always share and she agreed with my complaints and I thought her dish was average.  Also, we ordered a Blackened Fish and a Carne Asada soft shell corn tacos to try.  We prefered the Carne Asada over the FIsh, but liked them both.  Our favorite part of the meal was the side of chips, salsa, & guacamole.  It came with three sauces and our waitress, thoughtfully, brought us a forth spicier salsa.  The quac was fresh and the salsas were great on the chips, but even better as toppings on the tacos.  The biggest complaint is that they don't give you an itemized bill and our final bill was higher than we'd expected.  We assume that they charge for the side of chips, salsa, & guacamole, for extra tortillas, and that they didn't give us the Happy Hour price on our drafts.  When a waitress asks, "Do you want Chips & Salsa?" you typically don't expect to pay for it.  Overall, we enjoyed our meal, the place was clean, and the employees were really friendly.  This would be a great place for a fast lunch or a quick, easy dinner for a busy family or couple in a hurry.  We hate leaving this place with the three star rating, but there is a ton of competition in the area.
Went to Arizona and found myself some bomb-as mexican food!  Here's what I got:  (1) Pork Taco - 4 stars! (2) Pork Taco - 4 stars!  **OVERALL: Yup, I got double pork tacos! NOMS!

I was debating 3 or 4 stars. I pushing 4 stars for the value. I thought the guacamole was excellent and the green salsa was really tasty. I had a carne taco and a carnitas taco, both were decent but the amount of food your get for the price is unreal. I think I will give them another try and go for a blackened taco. Overall, I thought everything was lacking salt; from the salsas, to the chips, to the guac. I tried the ceviche but I believe there was some imitation crab meat in it. In my opinion, leave the fake crabmeat out and just do veggies and shrimp, also spice it up a bit. The employees/owners are super nice people. Also, I wouldn't say its a hole in the wall by any means. The place is pretty nice.

We came here after visiting Phoestivus downtown.  This place is a real gem.  The food was great, highly recommend the Fajita Burrito's and they were super friendly.  I hope this place becomes a staple of downtown!

What a cute hidden gem!  We were looking for some quick, traditional mexican food in Scottsdale.  We started looking at reviews and decided.... let's take a chance!    First off, you'll have to look for it - its in a shopping center/strip mall so we passed by it once.  Keep your eyes open!  Now let's talk about experience.  Let's start with the atmosphere.  As you walk in, there's the counter to order and on the left... about 9 small tables.  It's definitely set up more as a fast food style service.  I wouldn't go here to spend an entire evening sipping on margaritas - Cantina Laredo would do for that - but this place has become a staple due to the experience and food.  I'd say... think a local version of Rubios.  We've also had great service -  always nice, smiling, and making sure we're happy.  That alone makes getting quick food nice and more relaxed - although lunch can get crowded.  The food: pretty darn good - quite a surprise.  We've tried the carne asada burrito, quesadillas, fajitas.  I love their guacamole which is a great addition to a burrito.  It's also nice not to have it filled with rice, beans, instead of protein - they are quite the opposite and generous on the filling.  Cons:  Their salsa is pretty runny and not quite exciting.  Nothing to write home about.  Overall, fun little place.  Great for a quick bite and I will keep coming back

Little hole in the wall restaurant serving authentic and flavorful Mexican food! Everything was sooooooo good and the service was quick considering the quality of the food. I highly recommend the parillada plate so you can get a little taste of everything. It was ALL delicious! Margaritas were great!
Best Mexican food in town. Authentic, affordable, and excellent service. What more could you ask for?

This place is great!  Definitely the best Mexican Food in Madison.  Barbacoa and pastor tacos on corn tortilla shells are the best I have had.  The carnitas were a little dry the last time I went but the other meats made up for it.  The guys that work there are also really friendly and every thing is fast and fresh!

The tacos are excellent here and I'd give 4 stars if the service was speedier and if my ground beef taco was served with more toppings than just lettuce. (It was supposed to come with pico de gallo and cheese as well.) I waited for over 20 minutes for my food (too long for a fast food joint), watching as food was delivered to two tables of customers who had arrived after me.   They need to come up with a better system of food delivery, with no numbers given or names taken and restaurant workers wandering from table to table, asking, "Did you order this?"  Still, the tacos are excellent and I'll be back. The crunchy corn tortilla taco shells are best. Soft corn and soft flour are available as well. I hope I get better service next time!

Watery, watery salsa.  In fact, it's too watery to be considered a hot "sauce" because even that has some measure of thickness to it.  It's odd that it is paired with chips, because the chips cannot hold any of it as it runs off immediately.    Such a bold name to have too - Habanero's.  So the food may be spicy, right?  No.  Even the "hot salsa" which is allegedly made with Habanero is medium at best.  This isn't some macho claim that it's not hot enough for me personally; no, it's really not anything like a typical salsa with habanero ingredients.  When the food leans mild it's all to easy to label it as a gringo place, but even more so when it's under the pretense of being a place with some spicy Habanero ingredients.  Service was incredibly slow, and it's another one of those places where it's ambiguous if you sit down for service, or order at the counter.    Food was above average, served hot, and in a reasonable portion size for the price.  That's the main positive for this place - that the food is good and worth tolerating the other issues.  It's just not an overall great experience here.

Finding a good Torta (Mexican Sandwhich), taco and burrito at a fair price has been quite a challenge here in Wisconsin. That was of course, until I found Habanero's.   This gem will soon have a second location to offer their extremely yummy food to Wisconsinites, perfectly located across the street from the Mallards Stadium.  The waitstaff are all very friendly and eager to make sure you enjoy your dining experience.   Now to the food. Their three taco plate is quite the value when you witness how much meat they pack into either your corn or flour tortillas. But it doesn't stop there. You then have several, 11, additional toppings to choose from. Your usual onions, cilantro, tomato, guacamole, sour cream, cheese, lettuce and four different salsas; Green salsa, red salsa, corn salsa and an onion habanero mix (the more habanero slices you get with your onions the spicier it will be).  Now if you order a burrito, you also have rice, black beans, pinto beans and fajita mix (onion and bell pepper) to choose from.   The torta sandwhich is equally as yummy and if you are there shortly after they open they offer the choice to add a fried egg to it. Super yummy.  And as far as meat is concerned, you have options. Chicken, Carne Asada (Marinated Steak), Barbacoa (Shredded Beef), Al Pastor (Marinated Pork), Carnitas and for those looking for a vegetarian option fajitas (grilled onion and bell peppers).  For drinks they have bottled and canned soda varieties as well as water. They also offer beer. But if you are here, you might as well try their delicious Orchata (Rice Milk with cinnamon) or juice beverage that they make fresh.  Their value really comes through each time you purchase a three taco, burrito or quesadilla you get a stamp on your Habanero card. After your 9th purchase the next one is on them.   I usually order the three corn tacos with steak, onions, cilantro, red and green salsa and the onion and habanero mix. My wife will get hers the same way but with just the red salsa, instead of green and add tomato, guacamole, cheese and sour cream. Craving these right about now.  For my burrito I'll get it with the barbacoa or steak, black beans, onions, cilantro, tomato, all four salsa's and guacamole. Delicious and perfect before or after a long run.  For my torta, I'll get it with steak or barbacoa and a fried egg (usually get it in the am), black beans, onion, cilantro, tomato, lettuce, all four salsas and guacamole. Super yum.  Coming from California where there are mexican taco shops everywhere this is as good as they come. Very authentic.

As others have written, this place is like QDoba, but much more authentic.  You order your food and they prepare it as you move down the line. Five of us had dinner on a cold Friday evening and there were no complaints. I had a torta - I have never had one - and it was delicious. It comes on an enormous grilled bun and then I topped it with carnitas, rice, black beans, salsa verde and cheese. I could only finish about half of it, definitely worth the price!  Others in our party had the tacos and burritos and everyone said their food was tasty. Tacos can be ordered either on corn or flour tortillas. The chicken, as others have reviewed, is a strange blaze orange color, but the taste was good. Beer, Margaritas and sodas in the can are available. The Margaritas are pre-mixed in a dispenser, so I went with a beer.  The two men working behind the counter were fast and friendly. If we find our selves near Stoughton Rd., we will definitely return to try other menu items.

Here is the story of how we fell in love with a little Mexican restaurant called Habanero's:   Friday: Did a random yelp search for Mexican food in the Scottsdale area and stumbled upon some decent reviews for this place. Decided to try it out since it's not too far. After a slight detour we finally found a little unassuming store front in a generic looking shopping plaza with a red, white and green banner in front and knew that we must have finally found it. Ordered some flour tacos (fish, carne asada, shrimp, and carnitas) and a steak quesadilla along with a side of chips and salsa and our beloved Orange Bang drink that we were pleasantly surprised to find here. Within a few minutes of taking our first bites we turned to each other and proclaimed, "This shit is good!!" Fresh Mexican food that was reasonably priced and not overloaded with grease!! We were officially in lust.   Saturday: Couldn't stop thinking about how good Habanero's was from the night before and made plans to stop by for breakfast the next morning and try some of their breakfast burritos.   Sunday: Stopped by to grab a few breakfast burritos before our road tip to eat in the car. Bacon and steak burritos were delicious and not greasy at all, just like the rest of the menu. Egg, potatoes, meat and cheese in a fresh tortilla make these burritos worth coming back for again! And, breakfast served all day during the weekdays! Sweet!   Monday: Craving Habanero's again and we even made plans to stop by on our way back into town. Unfortunately for us, they closed early for the holiday, but we were more determined than ever to get our fix in the next day! Nothing could keep these star crossed lovers apart!   Tuesday: The craving was almost unbearable at this point. As soon as we got off of work we headed over to our new favorite place to pick up some tacos and another breakfast burrito. We were not disappointed, everything was just as amazing as the last few times we had visited. Habaneros can do no wrong!   So there you have it...if you're in the north Scottsdale area and craving some fresh authentic Mexican food that won't break the bank then head over to Habanero's and you'll be falling in love in no time at all!

I stopped in Habanero's today and had the daily special, a Chicken Fajita Quesadilla. It was great, bright cruchy veggies, great chicken and a side of sour cream and Guac. I will defintely be back soon.

Habeneros is just like Chipotle and Qdoba. Seems that this concept is new to Madison based on the other reviews implying that this dining experience is a new one for them.  Coming from Denver where excellent Mexican food is common, this meal was good but not a stand-out.  Tasty overall.  Generous with the portion of meat and able to add unlimited toppings without any extra cost.  A good place for a quick lunch.

A customer tipped me off to this restaurant, and I could just kiss her for the recommendation!  Knowing we were going to be short staffed the following morning, I order two chorizo breakfast burritos. Those were divine! Solid spiciness and full of flavor, these breakfast burritos are served all day, kids. And that's a terrific thing. Because sometimes you just want breakfast for dinner.  The chile relleno was fantastic! Seriously good eats. The rice and black beans were equally delicious.

Came here for lunch with some coworkers.  The place was pretty packed - we waited about 20 minutes for our food to finally come out.  The food was pretty decent.  I had the chicken fajita and it was very tasty and made me very full.  I'll try the nachos next time as my coworker had it and it looked fantastic!

This was our first time at this restaurant and definitely will not be our last. It was outstanding and I'm so excited to finally give a restaurant five stars. Everything we ate was delicious and the service was wonderful.  The restaurant itself might look like a hole in the wall but it's definitely worth it.  This is going to be our choice for Mexican food!
Great food and margarita, very reasonable prices. The house margarita is huge and pretty decent and the service is good.

First visit here and it won't be the last!  Nothing fancy, but very clean and bright.  Colorfully decorated.  Food was great (blackened shrimp tacos and calamari tacos).  Pacifico on tap and very good margueritas.  Anxious to return and try several other menu choices.    Service was OUTSTANDING!!

Aqui encontraras un servicio excelente! Very friendly staff and delicious food as well. Food is made to order in plain view which i always enjoy. I tried the carnitas burrito enchilada style and loved it.
I have been coming here for over a year but sadly have only had one item... Carne Asada Burrito.  This is THE BEST carne asada burrito I have ever had!

Sunday night I was craving spicy, and was rather cranky about it.  Hubby went here, and brought me home some kind of burrito bowl thingy with spicy habanero onions, pork, corn, rice, sour cream, etc. It was fantastic!  Emergency situation (removal of hubby's face) averted!  Thank you Habaneros!!
I absolutely love this place. I make it a point to always make a visit when I'm in Scottsdale. Staff is always friendly and  the food is very authentic to my taste yet it's not so greasy
